label: joy
text: During the period of falling in love, each time that we met and especially when we had not met for a long time.

label: fear
text: When I was involved in a traffic accident.

label: anger
text: When I was driving home after  several days of hard work, there was a motorist ahead of me who was driving at 50 km/hour and refused, despite his low speeed to let me overtake.

label: sadness
text: When I lost the person who meant the most to me.

label: disgust
text: The time I knocked a deer down - the sight of the animal's injuries and helplessness.  The realization that the animal was so badly hurt that it had to be put down, and when the animal screamed at the moment of death.

label: shame
text: When I did not speak the truth.

label: guilt
text: When I caused problems for somebody because he could not keep the appointed time and this led to various consequences.

label: joy
text: When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had applied for.

label: fear
text: When I was going home alone one night in Paris and a man came up behind me and asked me if I was not afraid to be out alone so late at night.

label: anger
text: When I was talking to HIM at a party for the first time in a long while and a friend came and interrupted us and HE left.

label: sadness
text: When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party with them.

label: disgust
text: When I saw all the very drunk kids (13-14 years old) in town on Walpurgis night.

label: shame
text: When I could not remember what to say about a presentation task at an accounts meeting.

label: guilt
text: When my uncle and my neighbour came home under police escort.

label: fear
text: Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a serious illness, even death.

label: anger
text: When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility of elucidating this.

label: sadness
text: When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this short time.

label: disgust
text: At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and discriminating.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontent with myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blame on him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very self-centered.

label: joy
text: After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's place.

label: fear
text: When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

label: anger
text: When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the road.

label: sadness
text: When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical book in English that I did not understand.

label: disgust
text: When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

label: shame
text: When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually not so important.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I think that I should have been able to have accomplished something during that time.

label: joy
text: When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

label: fear
text: When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.

label: anger
text: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

label: sadness
text: When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

label: disgust
text: When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that, quite unwarranted.

label: shame
text: When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.

label: guilt
text: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

label: joy
text: Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

label: fear
text: When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied that the ladder was not very stable.

label: anger
text: Friends who torture animals.

label: disgust
text: Friends who torture animals.

label: joy
text: When I had my children.

label: fear
text: When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost his balance when he sat down.

label: anger
text: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

label: sadness
text: When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and war.

label: disgust
text: When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

label: shame
text: When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.

label: guilt
text: I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.

label: joy
text: When my child was born.

label: fear
text: It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it.  The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed in over my head.

label: anger
text: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.

label: sadness
text: Failing an examination.

label: disgust
text: A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that turned into sadness-unpleasantness.

label: shame
text: When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.

label: guilt
text: When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off than me, I realize how privileged I am.

label: joy
text: When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.

label: fear
text: When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.

label: anger
text: When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not  understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

label: sadness
text: When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular because there is no time for anything else.

label: disgust
text: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing going on in the world.

label: shame
text: I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.

label: guilt
text: When one lets friends down

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

label: fear
text: A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.

label: anger
text: At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had to learn all on my own.

label: sadness
text: When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

label: disgust
text: When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him nowadays.

label: guilt
text: At my Summer job a new caretaker had been employed who was my age  but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel rather than with him.

label: joy
text: Passed an exam by 2 points.

label: fear
text: In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the dark.

label: anger
text: When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.

label: sadness
text: Railway station good-bye.

label: disgust
text: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was probably an imposter.

label: shame
text: I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not have fitted in and there was something in that.

label: guilt
text: I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

label: fear
text: On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch, there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very scared till I managed to get him back onboard.

label: anger
text: I locked myself out.

label: sadness
text: I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.

label: disgust
text: I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.

label: shame
text: My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him away, and they later contacted his parents.

label: guilt
text: I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

label: joy
text: When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

label: fear
text: When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character comes towards me.

label: anger
text: At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and distrusted me.

label: sadness
text: When I had not understood anything after a lecture.

label: disgust
text: When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

label: shame
text: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we realized that he had been listening.

label: guilt
text: When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me believing that I liked her.

label: joy
text: At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have such good friends.

label: fear
text: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few seconds.

label: anger
text: Mad at my dad.

label: sadness
text: A case of unrequited love.

label: disgust
text: A bad smelling cucumber.

label: shame
text: Nearly caught masturbating.

label: guilt
text: I do not help out enough at home.

label: joy
text: I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

label: fear
text: When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that we were going to crash.

label: anger
text: When someone stole my bike.

label: sadness
text: When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I thought \ Oh God how will I ever manaage it!\""

label: disgust
text: It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

label: shame
text: When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby started laughing.

label: guilt
text: When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  The store then contacted my parents.

label: joy
text: When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.  Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out well and we enjoy ourselves.

label: fear
text: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, she had gone to bed to sleep)

label: anger
text: When friends try to put me down or hurt me.

label: sadness
text: Marriage crises.  Boredom.

label: disgust
text: When someone makes advances that one does not want.

label: shame
text: The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.

label: guilt
text: When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.

label: joy
text: When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

label: fear
text: When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

label: sadness
text: Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend went to Greece for a holiday for a month.

label: disgust
text: When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

label: shame
text: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep the promise.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of economics.

label: fear
text: While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and was saved only by the appearance of other people.

label: anger
text: At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

label: sadness
text: At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

label: disgust
text: While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying themselves.

label: shame
text: When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had not mentioned it earlier.

label: guilt
text: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is aware that I know that they are wrong.

label: joy
text: When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a margin of three marks.

label: fear
text: When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

label: anger
text: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not have a raincoat on me.

label: sadness
text: When I failed an exam.

label: disgust
text: At a Sm÷rgasbord table, a man mixed differnet kinds of picked herrings with fruit salad.

label: shame
text: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the overall result was poor.

label: guilt
text: When my father and I worked on the house just after he had recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he had to work hard and was not very well later.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.

label: fear
text: When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not know how long he would live.

label: anger
text: When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact that he had more time to do it than I had.

label: sadness
text: When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting and understood how little one's work was appreciated.

label: disgust
text: When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time and heard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have got in touch with her earlier.

label: guilt
text: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.

label: joy
text: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the first time.

label: fear
text: When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no consequences.

label: anger
text: The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.  He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written about.

label: sadness
text: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the scene of the accident.

label: shame
text: One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am ashamed of myself now.

label: guilt
text: Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my parents' expectations.

label: joy
text: When I got the loan for my studies.

label: fear
text: I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley one Wednesday night.

label: anger
text: On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman      attacked a group of black people with a whip.

label: sadness
text: The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in English.

label: disgust
text: Grovelling people.

label: shame
text: My inability to assert myself positively in a group.

label: guilt
text: I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

label: disgust
text: Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, having extremely bad manners.

label: shame
text: I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of other people.

label: guilt
text: Having been angry and unpleasant towards my parents.

label: joy
text: When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

label: fear
text: When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.

label: anger
text: We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to was very negative and not very helpful.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

label: disgust
text: I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had left me.

label: shame
text: Can't think of any.

label: guilt
text: Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed there when the car crashed.

label: joy
text: Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a year.

label: fear
text: I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, and was shot at.

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly.

label: sadness
text: Breaking up with a girl.

label: guilt
text: Little contact with my father before he died.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having thought it possible.

label: fear
text: When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident, and found that a close school friend had been killed.

label: anger
text: I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got very angry.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: Not applicable.

label: joy
text: A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

label: fear
text: I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the blanket)

label: anger
text: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the lecturer.á

label: sadness
text: I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope of human life is sad.

label: disgust
text: In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I would choke.

label: shame
text: When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my sense of shame.

label: guilt
text: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty about her sadness.

label: joy
text: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on my birthday.

label: fear
text: I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that I would not do well.

label: anger
text: In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its loudest.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

label: disgust
text: My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I could not but detest him.

label: shame
text: Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was still feeling feeble and tired.

label: guilt
text: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the association).

label: joy
text: I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

label: fear
text: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if I would succeed as a group leader.

label: anger
text: We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

label: disgust
text: At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty growling man.

label: shame
text: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also a friend of mine.

label: guilt
text: I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained firm and did not change my mind.

label: joy
text: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking \the same language\"- meaning an inspiring discussion and encounter."

label: sadness
text: After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

label: disgust
text: In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while I was trying to concentrate on the program.

label: shame
text: My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after he had drunk some beer.

label: guilt
text: At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I wish there could be some other way of acting.

label: joy
text: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the hand of the other person, etc...

label: fear
text: I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me, though nothing very serious actually happened.

label: anger
text: Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

label: sadness
text: My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

label: disgust
text: Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and masturbated.  Very disgusting.

label: shame
text: After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and having been stupidly cross in every way.

label: guilt
text: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

label: joy
text: When I won a tennis match.

label: fear
text: When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.

label: anger
text: When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right into the court.

label: joy
text: Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

label: fear
text: Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.

label: anger
text: I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have nothing against, disturbed me by \terror ringing\", i.e continously interrupting me by telephoning."

label: sadness
text: After an exam which I failed.

label: shame
text: When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an acquaintance in the car with me.

label: guilt
text: I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying    on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20 metres away and did not go to help him.

label: joy
text: When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in Sk+vde.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling to school, I nearly got knocked down by a car which (overtook me too closely) did not give me any swerving space.

label: anger
text: When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies took liberties, more than what was normal.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going to separate.

label: disgust
text: Dog dirt which thaws in the spring.

label: shame
text: When I forgot my mother's birthday.

label: joy
text: Passed the last exam.

label: fear
text: Was nearly knocked down by a car.

label: anger
text: I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus pass.

label: sadness
text: My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from time to time.

label: joy
text: When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.

label: fear
text: When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.

label: anger
text: When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.

label: sadness
text: When I think about my parents getting old.

label: guilt
text: I do not have the time for other people's problems.  My mother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time, the desire or the strength to help.

label: joy
text: An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their accounts bureau.  They needed \clever people\" and he had \"immediately thought of me.\""

label: fear
text: I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.

label: anger
text: I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.

label: joy
text: When my girlfriend became pregnant.

label: fear
text: When I nearly collided with another car.

label: anger
text: The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.

label: sadness
text: When I read a lot and did not remember anything.

label: guilt
text: The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.

label: sadness
text: Long illness.

label: joy
text: When I passed an exam.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.

label: anger
text: When I missed the tram after having run for it.

label: sadness
text: The inability to read a book at college.

label: disgust
text: If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.

label: shame
text: I drink wine too often.

label: guilt
text: I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

label: joy
text: I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very good reference from him.

label: fear
text: I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I had to go the outside toilet on my own.

label: anger
text: When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably angry.

label: sadness
text: When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.

label: disgust
text: Someone vomited on the street.

label: shame
text: I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.  There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance, not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.

label: guilt
text: I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for my ex-boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When I was finally qualified for my profession.

label: fear
text: Someone attacked me with a knife.

label: anger
text: Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.

label: shame
text: When I boxed my child's ears.

label: guilt
text: When I was fined for speeding.

label: joy
text: I stopped working (had a boring job).

label: fear
text: I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.

label: anger
text: Quarrel in the family.

label: sadness
text: When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - loneliness drains me.

label: disgust
text: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.

label: shame
text: Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.

label: guilt
text: When I feigned sick leave from work.

label: joy
text: When I get a hug from someone I love.

label: fear
text: I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car in a right handed bend.  The other driver was on his own side of the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision.  It was dark.

label: anger
text: My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after I had already parked.

label: sadness
text: After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

label: disgust
text: I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had not asked for but got it anyway.

label: shame
text: When I did not buy what I had promised to.

label: guilt
text: By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed to be loaned out.

label: joy
text: When I won an unexpected sum of money.

label: fear
text: My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I was responsible for her.

label: anger
text: A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

label: sadness
text: I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    at every menstruation.

label: disgust
text: In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus stank.

label: shame
text: I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her addiction.

label: guilt
text: I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me the date in passing.

label: joy
text: When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.á

label: fear
text: When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were shouting something at the same time.

label: anger
text: When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying Psychology because of its low status.

label: sadness
text: I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

label: disgust
text: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

label: shame
text: My mother revealed personal details about me and the negative aspects of my character to other people when I was present but unable to defend myself.

label: guilt
text: I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad for a long period.

label: joy
text: When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

label: fear
text: When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.

label: anger
text: My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did not understand that he had done anything wrong.

label: sadness
text: When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

label: disgust
text: When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.  He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible complex about it.

label: shame
text: When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she found out she finished our friendship.

label: guilt
text: When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.  It was quite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason for the break up, such as someone else.

label: joy
text: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and soul.

label: fear
text: When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaborate with.

label: anger
text: The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks.   It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.

label: sadness
text: I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

label: disgust
text: When a member of the family complains about the food that is served, it disgusts me.

label: shame
text: Cannot recall any incident when I felt shame

label: guilt
text: I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term results I am left with a sense of guilt.

label: joy
text: When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of Psychology.

label: fear
text: When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather in the open sea.

label: anger
text: When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long time.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.

label: disgust
text: When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate up the contents of another patient's spitoon.

label: shame
text: At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  of a lesson.

label: guilt
text: I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I had misunderstood the time).

label: joy
text: When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

label: fear
text: When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).

label: anger
text: When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

label: sadness
text: When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

label: disgust
text: At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and personally.

label: shame
text: When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and this was obvious to a third pereson.

label: guilt
text: When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: fear
text: When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was difficult to get out.

label: anger
text: When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and my mother took the teacher's point of view.

label: sadness
text: When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

label: disgust
text: My parents attitude towards each other when they should become reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.

label: shame
text: When I was caught stealing money from my father.

label: guilt
text: I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.

label: joy
text: When after 10 months of national service I was \downgraded\" and did not have to do the remaining 5 months."

label: fear
text: When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I worked during Autumn 1984.

label: anger
text: When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have easily waited.

label: sadness
text: When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk of her being pregnant.

label: disgust
text: When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

label: shame
text: When my mother caught me masturbating.

label: guilt
text: As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to her education and life experiences.

label: joy
text: When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

label: fear
text: Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who it was and why he was there.

label: anger
text: When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly angry.

label: sadness
text: I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I had anticipated.

label: disgust
text: A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.

label: shame
text: When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).

label: guilt
text: As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference   the next day and really needed to sleep.

label: joy
text: When I got through the first day here at the department.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games with a friend.

label: sadness
text: When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a big spider from very close.

label: shame
text: When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.

label: guilt
text: When one of my parents insinuates something about the other (they are divorced).

label: joy
text: When i was asked to be a child's godmother.

label: fear
text: On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

label: anger
text: When my mother interfered in my life.

label: sadness
text: When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for it.

label: disgust
text: The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a black rubbish bag.

label: shame
text: When I forgot about a meeting at work.

label: guilt
text: When I demand too much from my friends.

label: joy
text: When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and brought some flowers and cake with him.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

label: anger
text: When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

label: sadness
text: When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the job.

label: disgust
text: T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.

label: shame
text: When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the neighbours boys their mother caught us.

label: guilt
text: When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We were with a marriage counsellor then.

label: joy
text: When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

label: fear
text: Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

label: anger
text: When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to trample on his associates.  I have the misfortune to have one of my superiors in my course.

label: sadness
text: When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two children differently.

label: disgust
text: Spit and vomit.

label: shame
text: Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.

label: guilt
text: Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a relationship on my side.

label: joy
text: When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment \myself\" i.e on my own initiative."

label: fear
text: I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I     realized what could have happened.

label: anger
text: When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a performance.  We missed it.

label: sadness
text: The elections of 1982 and 1985.  The thought of what a social democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially \worker share\" funds and its extension."

label: disgust
text: A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell, the environment and the noise.

label: shame
text: Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.

label: joy
text: When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to change the working environment.

label: fear
text: I was alone in a cottage I often stay in.  I was woken up by a rustling sound in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended ten times).

label: sadness
text: When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly intead of being criticized by the teacher.

label: disgust
text: When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

label: shame
text: When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the family first.

label: joy
text: After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.

label: fear
text: When we could not land our plane and we knew that the fuel was running out.  Bad weather had already frightened us.

label: anger
text: When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the South African boycott.

label: sadness
text: When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died later.

label: disgust
text: A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

label: shame
text: I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother had understood it.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not come.

label: joy
text: When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later accepted.

label: fear
text: I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright till I got hold of her.

label: anger
text: Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep as I had to get up early the next day.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently qualified.

label: disgust
text: When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.  I was forced to wipe it up.

label: shame
text: When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I was responsible.  I never admitted it.

label: joy
text: Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.  Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being here on earth.

label: fear
text: When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in situations when an argument is on hand.

label: anger
text: Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very angry.

label: sadness
text: When I watched the T.V programme called \The living planet\" and saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man."

label: disgust
text: Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e snakes on T.V.

label: shame
text: When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.

label: guilt
text: When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.  Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person I love most on earth.

label: joy
text: On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we won the jackpot of SEK 1000.

label: fear
text: A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike got caught in the tram tracks.  I somersaulted but had no injuries.

label: anger
text: On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our relationship by letter.

label: disgust
text: At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

label: shame
text: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

label: guilt
text: I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found it.

label: joy
text: When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to have a good time without alcohol.

label: fear
text: Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as fast as my legs could carry me.

label: anger
text: In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these marks.

label: sadness
text: When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.  It was my fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.

label: disgust
text: I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during the trip home and again when I got home.

label: shame
text: When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the coffee was undrinkable.

label: guilt
text: Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europe and I preferred to travel alone.  I felt guilty because I wanted to go on my own.

label: joy
text: When I felt that my love was returned.

label: fear
text: When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

label: anger
text: When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was forced to hide this for a while.

label: sadness
text: When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without any result.

label: disgust
text: When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a divorce.

label: shame
text: When as an 8 year old, I wet myself in school.

label: guilt
text: When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.

label: joy
text: When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a clinical pilot study.

label: fear
text: Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.

label: anger
text: When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the floor.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my closest friend.

label: disgust
text: When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.

label: shame
text: When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the next day I owned up and returned it.

label: guilt
text: When I was forced to decline the invitation to my mother's 70th birthday because of my work committments in another area.

label: joy
text: When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

label: fear
text: A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

label: anger
text: When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own phone reconnected.

label: sadness
text: Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and nature.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world (mistreated and used).

label: shame
text: When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.

label: guilt
text: When I \hated\" one of mmy flatmates who was nice to me."

label: joy
text: When my 6 month old son is happy and well.

label: fear
text: A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.

label: sadness
text: When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.

label: disgust
text: When I read racist slogans on the walls.

label: shame
text: About Sweden's arms exports.

label: guilt
text: Not doing something I had promised.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

label: fear
text: When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were  not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the  house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more frightening.

label: anger
text: Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.

label: sadness
text: When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold shoulder.

label: disgust
text: When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to change the nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.

label: shame
text: When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had been on a particular occasion.

label: guilt
text: When my middle child became very difficult to handle after the birth of his baby brother and I did not have any patience with him.

label: joy
text: When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a particularly trying period.

label: fear
text: Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an expected miscarriage.

label: anger
text: Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

label: sadness
text: Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.

label: disgust
text: When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered that our dog had diarrhoea.  There were small \piles\" all over the floor and the smell was choking."

label: shame
text: When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared itá being discovered by my parents.

label: guilt
text: At work a boy was injured because of my lack of supervision.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it was put against my breast.

label: fear
text: During labour when the foetal sounds became faint and there was a big alert for a forceps delivery.

label: anger
text: At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper at a reduced price.  After queuing with screaming children; it turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one 16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.  The assistant said \You will have to get it another time.\""

label: sadness
text: When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.

label: disgust
text: The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.

label: shame
text: On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been aggressive though he could have been.

label: guilt
text: I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all over his clean clothes.

label: joy
text: The high school entrance exam.

label: fear
text: A gang of screaming and drunk youths \captured\" a tram."

label: anger
text: An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team leader.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend left me.

label: disgust
text: I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I could not change my own reactions.

label: shame
text: When I was given detention at secondary school.

label: guilt
text: When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving through a puddle of water.

label: joy
text: Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish title.

label: fear
text: I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I was scared.

label: anger
text: A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about it.

label: sadness
text: When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his other activities.  We both play in different bands and rehearse in my parents garage.

label: disgust
text: A friend unjustly put the blame on me to relieve his conscience and also spread lies for the same purpose.

label: shame
text: My behaviour at a recent party.  I passed out early, luckily.

label: guilt
text: When I was face to face with my deceived friend after sleeping with his wife.

label: joy
text: When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.

label: fear
text: When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.

label: anger
text: When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach me beacause of prejudice.

label: sadness
text: When I could not do anything because of a bad back.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full of cockroaches.

label: shame
text: When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.

label: guilt
text: When I pulled a chair from under someone at kindergarten and he hit his head.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my licence.

label: fear
text: When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in   a ditch with one side against a rock.

label: joy
text: When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.

label: fear
text: When a guy chased me when I was out jogging.

label: anger
text: When the morning newspaper has not arrived.

label: joy
text: I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

label: fear
text: A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.

label: anger
text: When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels superior to me.

label: sadness
text: When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to continue at college.  I did overreact.

label: guilt
text: When I argue with my sister.  It feels sometimes that I have the upper hand and I use it.  I often argue better and this makes her terribly angry.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I got an attractive Summer job.

label: joy
text: The birth of my child.

label: fear
text: When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I fear that something will happen to the baby.

label: anger
text: When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any water for two days.

label: sadness
text: I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.

label: disgust
text: The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.

label: shame
text: I fell on the ground while crossing the street.  My cap covered my eyes and I felt quite \difficult\"."

label: guilt
text: I have a two-month old baby.  When I came here, to the university, to attend lectures, I had to leave the baby with his father.  I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends, after not having seen them for six months.

label: fear
text: We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove down a precipice.

label: anger
text: When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts and doom's day as official teaching.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

label: disgust
text: I happened to see the video-tape movie \This is America - Part one\" at my friend's place."

label: shame
text: I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hit them when I was drunk.  The next day, I was ashamed of course.

label: guilt
text: I stole carrots and got caught.  I had to apologize to the owner.

label: joy
text: In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for money.  Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told me that I was really good-looking.  A man who was in front of me also turned to look at me.

label: fear
text: I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for my studies.

label: anger
text: In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the whole pot.

label: sadness
text: My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

label: disgust
text: During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy meat dishes which make me feel sick.

label: shame
text: I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where there were many people walking by.

label: guilt
text: I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately put on a kilo.

label: fear
text: At about nine p.m., I went home by bike on a dark cycle-track; because of lack of time I had to take the short-cut.

label: fear
text: Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a forest and I was going alone.

label: anger
text: I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours. For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very important for me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

label: disgust
text: When I went home by train from Sicilia, I was molested by a man.

label: shame
text: I lied to someone and some time later this person found out that I had not told him the truth.

label: guilt
text: I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.

label: joy
text: A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We became reconciled.

label: fear
text: A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend although I did not know his family.

label: anger
text: I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.

label: sadness
text: My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.

label: disgust
text: A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him, provoked her and just utilized her.

label: shame
text: I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but understanding. We talked the whole thing over.

label: guilt
text: I had told a person unpleasant things in a bad manner. He was very depressed and caused an accident.

label: joy
text: After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

label: fear
text: After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I was able to get to sleep again.

label: anger
text: I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that sloppiness and impudence.

label: sadness
text: My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get over it. During all that time I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.

label: shame
text: Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people, had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a conversation about it with a person.

label: guilt
text: I had a quarrel with near persons. I said many ill-considered things and I regretted it when it was to late.

label: joy
text: In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

label: fear
text: I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.

label: guilt
text: Meeting a male friend with whose wife I was having an affair.

label: joy
text: Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenly came across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side, which I had to cross.

label: anger
text: A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it anyway (i.e. being late).

label: sadness
text: Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life etc.

label: disgust
text: I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs who were all fighting and going against what they would say was good.

label: shame
text: I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough, and was told that my work was not up to standard.

label: guilt
text: I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some things I did not consider morally right).

label: joy
text: On meeting an old friend of mine.

label: fear
text: When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.

label: anger
text: During a fight with my best friend.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.

label: disgust
text: During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers in Africa.

label: shame
text: When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.

label: guilt
text: Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should have kept her company.

label: joy
text: When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need forgiveness.

label: fear
text: Fear - paralysing - that I would not be accepted by the God who I believed to be there because I was \morally bankrupt\" (before becoming a Christian and realising that that was why Christ came to free us from sin and to forgive us)."

label: anger
text: At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, and not being committed to her.

label: sadness
text: At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is damaging himself apart from mum.

label: disgust
text: At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexual encounters, while I held a vision of having a deepening above-board (you know, \girl next door\") devotion to a girl in my head. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently I felt disgusted at my failure."

label: shame
text: At using other people, because of sexual experience that was using another to the detriment of both. Anxiety that I may have affected another for the worst.

label: guilt
text: For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.

label: fear
text: I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up it.

label: anger
text: I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week (including rent).

label: sadness
text: My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly as she walked across the tarmac to get on the plane and she looked back at us.

label: disgust
text: I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.

label: shame
text: My mother told my uncle who is a Roman Catholic Priest (Redemptist Father) that I had been living in a de-facto relationship for three years. He was very, very angry at me.

label: guilt
text: I \snapped\" very abruptly at my mother when she said something silly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked so defenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that."

label: joy
text: I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the flat.

label: fear
text: One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was (mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me.

label: anger
text: Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being given the runaround.

label: sadness
text: Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it would be to be her in the same situation.

label: disgust
text: Coming home one night - my sister was home, and had been drinking heavily and started picking arguments.

label: fear
text: When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car while overtaking.

label: anger
text: When a close relative is treated badly.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend died.

label: disgust
text: When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.  It felt awful to see such suffering.

label: guilt
text: When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for.  This was disclosed later.

label: joy
text: When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.

label: fear
text: Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.

label: anger
text: When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.  She does not trust me and constantly misunderstands me.  I get particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend with whom she works.

label: sadness
text: When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.

label: joy
text: When my love for a guy was returned.

label: fear
text: When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents, brothers and sisters.

label: anger
text: My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now an ex-boyfriend).  He happened to be 13 years older than me and he was considered completely unsuitable for me.  IDIOT.

label: disgust
text: When my uncle comes (3 times a year) for the traditional Christmas dinner with my grandparents and other relatives and is very drunk.

label: guilt
text: I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards the end decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings to the appartment in Guttenburg.  When I had finished I went to my ex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed there till 5 A.M.  I had to leave then as my parents needed the car for work in the morning.  My parents do not like my boyfriend.

label: joy
text: I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.  We had said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we were not going to the same town in England).  As soon as I walked in he called from England as he could not wait till he came home.

label: fear
text: When my mother's heart nearly stopped.

label: anger
text: There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who were acquaintances.  It should have been picked up a year ago but they had postponed it.  Eventually they decided on one date and I stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do.  They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got in touch with me.

label: sadness
text: When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

label: disgust
text: Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight.   I met a vile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me till I got up, then he got angry.

label: guilt
text: When my nephew asked me to tell him a story and I simply did not have the energy or the will.  When I saw his disappointment I was terribly guilty and read a story to him after all.

label: joy
text: When I fell in love.

label: fear
text: Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.

label: anger
text: A girl I was with went off with another guy.

label: sadness
text: At set-backs.

label: disgust
text: I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the back of the lorries.

label: shame
text: The day after the night I drank too much at a party.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at Gutttenburg.

label: fear
text: I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted with fear.  I thought that someone's cold hand or something similar had touched my hand.  I crept down under the covers and went back to sleep.

label: disgust
text: When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are still there.

label: guilt
text: I broke off with my partner as I wanted him as a friend and not as a lover.  He reacted very violently and I felt guilty as I had made him so desperately unhappy.

label: joy
text: I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.

label: fear
text: I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.

label: anger
text: My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough at home.

label: disgust
text: I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I had done was wrong and it disgusted me.

label: guilt
text: I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.

label: joy
text: After intercourse.

label: fear
text: Disappointment over a friend.

label: anger
text: Quarrelled with my younger brother.

label: sadness
text: When I woke up after a nightmare.

label: disgust
text: Helping older people on the toilet.

label: guilt
text: Squeezed the puppy in the door.

label: joy
text: When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology student.

label: fear
text: Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy  seas and the wind was strong.  As we could not steer the boat we drifted towards the rocks.  We did not succeed in attracting the attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.

label: anger
text: A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went   on holiday (I live in a collective).

label: sadness
text: When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.

label: disgust
text: I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop.  He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.

label: guilt
text: My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in hospital for an eye operation.

label: joy
text: After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and got a good write up in the paper.

label: fear
text: When I was 7-8 years old, I woke up one night and found myself alone at home.  My mother had gone out to buy cigarattes from a machine.

label: sadness
text: When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the term by one point.  The fact that exactly the same thing had happened last term did not help.

label: disgust
text: When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes.

label: joy
text: As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback.  When the atmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.

label: fear
text: After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrance doorbell and getting caught by him.

label: anger
text: The sight of a man who ran amok (fighting) at a dance.

label: sadness
text: When out of work.

label: disgust
text: With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated).  It took a while for the milk to seep through the bun.

label: guilt
text: A boy who shot dead a squirrel.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The notification came by post.

label: fear
text: When I was involved in a car accident last November, after the first fall of snow.  I lost control of the car and it spun round and landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hard shoulder.  It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down to a stream.

label: anger
text: With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge explained that a male teacher was more suitable for the particular post.
