I had more years of service than the male teacher, but this was not taken into consideration.  I could have been given a less attractive job if things had gone the way the headmaster wanted.

label: sadness
text: A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer and has only a year to live.  I  heard about it 6 weeks ago.

label: joy
text: When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the night, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.

label: fear
text: Having quarreled with a boyfriend, he threatened to leave me.

label: anger
text: Someone didn't show up at a meeting in spite of having agreed to come.

label: sadness
text: When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we decided to be legally separated.

label: disgust
text: At an anti-pornography meeting, when samples from films and magazines were shown.

label: shame
text: Comments from other children on my alcoholic father

label: guilt
text: Having failed to help with the 5th of March arrangements (Women's Day), although I had previously promised to take part in the work.

label: joy
text: When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

label: fear
text: After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.

label: anger
text: When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and hindered by my cousin.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: shame
text: Hit a dog with my car, and didn't stop.

label: guilt
text: Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I suffered the worst injuries.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

label: fear
text: My father has a chronic desease. In the autumn of 1983 he had a very strong fit or seizure.

label: anger
text: A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was also drunk.

label: sadness
text: When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wanted very much.

label: disgust
text: My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he knew was extremely important to me.

label: shame
text: An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.

label: guilt
text: I hit my little sisiter on the head with a stone while we were fighting.

label: joy
text: When my father managed to begin a \new life\" after the divorce from my mother; resulting in a new little sister for me."

label: fear
text: A \near-accident\" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road."

label: anger
text: My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my father when they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myself were allowed to listen.

label: sadness
text: Being bored in school, not being able to marry and have children.

label: disgust
text: When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and sisters badly.

label: shame
text: Stealing from my mother's purse when I was a little boy.

label: guilt
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: joy
text: I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quite unexpected.

label: fear
text: I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.

label: anger
text: I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend left me.

label: disgust
text: Slaughtering of animals.

label: shame
text: I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someone already was sleeping.

label: guilt
text: I failed to show up at an agreed date.

label: joy
text: When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar, after baving tried for a long time.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither up nor down.

label: anger
text: Meeting generally dominating persons in social occasions.

label: sadness
text: Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment that suits my taste, even though I had been told so.

label: disgust
text: Can't describe any disgust situation.

label: shame
text: When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting a conservative government.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine shot himself through the head after having told me and others that he would do so.

label: joy
text: When my children were born.

label: fear
text: When I almost ran over a small boy who suddenly was in front of my car.

label: anger
text: When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

label: disgust
text: When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about me.

label: shame
text: I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and discovered that his daughter was listening.

label: guilt
text: When my ex-husband left our house, and the children cried because he was not coming back.

label: joy
text: When my special friend said \I love you\" for the first time."

label: fear
text: After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to take the dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on the porch... (We live some distance away from other people).

label: anger
text: When my car suddenly broke down !

label: sadness
text: When an earlier friend was spreading negative rumours about me.

label: disgust
text: There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me cringe, feel disgust.

label: shame
text: Cheating to get the best grade on a test in 7th grade.

label: guilt
text: A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed me and was run over and killed by a car.

label: joy
text: When my term paper was evaluated.

label: fear
text: After seeing a terror movie at the cinema, I was so scared that I couldn't even drive the car into the garage. I often thought about the film afterwards, hoping such things couldn't exist in the \real world\"."

label: anger
text: Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.

label: sadness
text: When my gradmother died.

label: shame
text: I overreacted towards my mother and felt ashamed afterwards.

label: guilt
text: When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting them down, disappointing them.

label: joy
text: Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.

label: fear
text: I lost my way on a trip in the mountains.

label: anger
text: Being subject to unfair treatment in a working group, someone \bending the rules\" was protected by the boss. This resulted in more work for the others."

label: sadness
text: The death of a close friend.

label: disgust
text: Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other people because of their social status, beliefs, color and outlook on life (perspective).

label: shame
text: Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey my own thoughts and feelings.

label: guilt
text: I failed to complete a working task within the agreed time.

label: joy
text: Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives abroad.

label: fear
text: Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.

label: anger
text: One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early on problems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I was angry and hurt.

label: sadness
text: Realizing that school will soon be over, and we will all go different ways, perhaps never meeting again our friends from this year.

label: disgust
text: In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was swimming.

label: shame
text: I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples. Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.

label: guilt
text: I had planned a trip to the South during Easter, together with a friend. She was very sorry when I changed my mind and decided not to go after all.

label: joy
text: A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.

label: fear
text: One dark night with no street lights, a car was obviously following me.

label: anger
text: I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.

label: sadness
text: I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any more because of his relationship with another girl.

label: disgust
text: This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards anyone.

label: shame
text: If I don't go to lectures, I often feel ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and she started crying.

label: joy
text: When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seen her for 4 months.

label: fear
text: I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through no fault of mine.

label: anger
text: I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use a different counter (for domestic traffic only).

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

label: shame
text: When taking part in the mobbing of one of my best friends in primary school.

label: guilt
text: When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 years old.

label: joy
text: When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

label: fear
text: Not applicable to myself.

label: anger
text: When students in our working group showed no responsibility or interest in our work.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend left me.

label: disgust
text: Some people were unfairly treated, because of their nationality/colour.

label: shame
text: Taking part in the mobbing of some girls in my class in primary school.

label: guilt
text: Not applicable to myself.

label: joy
text: A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebody cared.

label: fear
text: A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought he was going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading the rest.

label: anger
text: My nephew is a deaf and also \hyperactive\" boy. I had been responsible for looking after him for a full day, and was very tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain."

label: sadness
text: A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this process makes me sad.

label: disgust
text: Close friends talking badly of other friends.

label: shame
text: My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt relieved, and was ashamed of that.

label: guilt
text: We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with her job, I stayed in bed all day.

label: joy
text: Renewed contact with an earlier friend.

label: fear
text: Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the minority.

label: anger
text: A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but later used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.

label: sadness
text: When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started the process of breaking up.

label: disgust
text: Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.

label: shame
text: Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when I believed I was acting honestly and fairly.

label: guilt
text: When my aunt took her own life, I felt guity for not understanding that she needed support.

label: joy
text: Receiving a postcard form my sweetheart who was abroad on vacation, not being at all sure if he would write me or not.

label: fear
text: Doesn't apply.

label: anger
text: When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to let me go.

label: sadness
text: Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.

label: disgust
text: Doesn't apply.

label: shame
text: Doesn't apply.

label: guilt
text: I dated another boy several times, when I was still \going with\" my former boyfriend. This made me feel a little bit guilty towards my friend."

label: joy
text: Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.

label: fear
text: Falling off a cliff in the mountains.

label: anger
text: Having a fight with a class mate.

label: sadness
text: When the gear broke on my car.

label: disgust
text: Can't remember having had this feeling.

label: shame
text: Can't remember that feeling.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.

label: joy
text: I got a job right after school was over.

label: fear
text: Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?) meeting.

label: anger
text: I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.

label: sadness
text: At the death of a close relative.

label: disgust
text: Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person responsible.

label: shame
text: Being caught in changing the truth (lying).

label: guilt
text: Doing something wrong at home, and then letting my (normally) more rampant brother take the blame.

label: joy
text: Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV dealer.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long climb ahead.

label: anger
text: Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period of time.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close relationship.

label: disgust
text: Reading about executions and massacres which happened during World War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.

label: shame
text: I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very much about what had been said or done during the party on the previous night.

label: guilt
text: Borrowing a car, and then having a minor accident (breaking a headlight).

label: joy
text: Succeeding in helping others.

label: fear
text: When I realized that we are living on borrowed time, and that the nuclear holocaust appears to come closer every day.

label: anger
text: When others let me down, fail to keep agreements.

label: sadness
text: Death in the close family.

label: disgust
text: When people manipulate others through appearing better than what they really are.

label: shame
text: Participating in a theft several years ago.

label: guilt
text: Feeling helpless, not being able to accomplish what I really wanted to do.

label: joy
text: I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I really wanted to go.

label: fear
text: I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I realized that they probably were still there.

label: anger
text: I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and then refilling with water.

label: sadness
text: Got a package from my parents, without even a small note enclosed.

label: disgust
text: Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.

label: shame
text: Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my brothers and sisters unfairly.

label: guilt
text: I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of my brother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.

label: joy
text: Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.

label: fear
text: Before important sports events.

label: anger
text: When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

label: sadness
text: Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I intended to win.

label: disgust
text: Can't remember any episode of disgust.

label: shame
text: When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two weeks. That was very unpleasant.

label: guilt
text: When I and the boy next door set fire to a house by accident.

label: joy
text: Getting the top price in the football pools.

label: fear
text: Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form another unit. The reason was girls.

label: anger
text: When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.

label: sadness
text: Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.

label: disgust
text: Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger woman, beating her up.

label: shame
text: My father was a member of the public Alcohol and Drugs Board, when I was picked up by the police for being drunk in a public place.

label: guilt
text: When being illoyal (disloyal) to people close to me. Had such an episode with my sister, who should have received my support and attention.

label: joy
text: Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for years.

label: fear
text: Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the road. Broke an arm, only.

label: anger
text: Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in the back of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front with the entire bill.

label: sadness
text: Death of a close friend.

label: disgust
text: Can't remember any such feelings now.

label: shame
text: At a private party I literally fell into the food. The party was completely ruined for the host, carpets had to be cleaned, etc.

label: guilt
text: Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it was broken.

label: joy
text: Selling my used car.

label: fear
text: Almost crashing my car, something which could have led to great problems.

label: anger
text: Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certain contract.

label: sadness
text: Talking to a pensioned and bitter \street order\" policeman."

label: disgust
text: The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.

label: shame
text: Forgetting an important appointment.

label: guilt
text: Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importance to the receiver.

label: joy
text: Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.

label: fear
text: Afraid I wouldn't catch the train when I was going to see my sweetheart.

label: anger
text: Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.

label: sadness
text: Not getting a job.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.

label: shame
text: When unjustified hurting other people.

label: guilt
text: The negative feelings towards me displayed by my \parents-in-law\"."

label: joy
text: Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

label: fear
text: The house was on fire, and I was saved by the dog. I am afraid of the fire, verging on panic.

label: anger
text: Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were \pissed off\"."

label: sadness
text: My father dying.

label: disgust
text: Maltreatment of children.

label: shame
text: I lost my driver's licence because of speeding.

label: guilt
text: Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.

label: joy
text: Relating to my closest family.

label: fear
text: Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death, etc.

label: anger
text: In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers. Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).

label: sadness
text: Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when losing our dog in a traffic accident.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of others.

label: shame
text: Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the person was listening.

label: guilt
text: I often feel guilty, and it has to do with other people, e.g. if I haven't visited my older relatives for a while.

label: joy
text: When the contract about my shop was signed.

label: fear
text: Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving off the road.

label: anger
text: Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.

label: sadness
text: My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.

label: disgust
text: Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.

label: shame
text: Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.

label: guilt
text: I crashed my father's car.

label: joy
text: Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me emotionally.

label: fear
text: Being close to drowning.

label: anger
text: Being slandered by friends.

label: sadness
text: Love problems.

label: disgust
text: Does not apply.

label: shame
text: Having finally to admit I was wrong, after having denied it for a long time.

label: guilt
text: Being aggressive against members of my family.

label: joy
text: I won the country ski championship.

label: fear
text: I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.

label: anger
text: Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship football final.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather's death.

label: disgust
text: A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was hoping for.

label: shame
text: Was caught stealing apples in a neighbor's garden.

label: guilt
text: Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has happened many times.

label: joy
text: When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my grant was spent.

label: fear
text: Once I was stopped by the police in Spain, when I had some \grass\" in my tobacco."

label: anger
text: My father accused my brother of having bumped his car, and it was wrong.

label: sadness
text: When a girlfriend left me.

label: disgust
text: When a \friend\" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know what it was."

label: shame
text: Fighting with my father while drunk.

label: guilt
text: During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly that she had a breackdown and was hospitalized.

label: joy
text: I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents and through them from the pupils.

label: fear
text: As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.

label: anger
text: I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce, we disagreed strongly.

label: sadness
text: As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my grand-father which made me sad.

label: disgust
text: I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her pregnancy.

label: shame
text: When I confessed to my girl-friend (now my wife) that I had betrayed her with another woman.

label: guilt
text: The same as in \shame\"."

label: fear
text: I was thinking about death.

label: anger
text: A conflict with a pupil.

label: sadness
text: When I am at home alone.

label: disgust
text: A saturday night a bus full of drunken people.

label: shame
text: A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teachers present.

label: guilt
text: Selling the appartment after my divorce.

label: joy
text: When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.

label: fear
text: In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.

label: sadness
text: When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on a close relative of mine.

label: disgust
text: As a child, when I saw an \unesthetic\" sight."

label: shame
text: On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of my autonomous nerve system (I could not help it).

label: guilt
text: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of my lack of self-insight.

label: joy
text: I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.

label: fear
text: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

label: anger
text: My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There were  only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the chair she was sitting on.

label: sadness
text: I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.

label: disgust
text: We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started coughing and spitting into his plate.

label: shame
text: We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

label: guilt
text: We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum down my throat.

label: joy
text: While dancing in a restaurant last week.

label: fear
text: I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.

label: anger
text: When a girl left me.

label: sadness
text: I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final journey within four days.

label: disgust
text: On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a \charming\" old saleswoman came to beg a drink for herself."

label: shame
text: At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my ignorance.

label: guilt
text: On Reberbahn, I was in a \restaurant\" where drinks were overpriced.  I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and when the bill came I could not pay the bill."

label: joy
text: My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.

label: fear
text: At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

label: anger
text: While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very close to me.

label: disgust
text: In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position to advance his own interests.

label: shame
text: When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an exam, when I actually did not even take it.

label: guilt
text: When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this person.

label: joy
text: When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid look stupid.

label: fear
text: When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie \Deer hunter\")"

label: anger
text: When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.

label: disgust
text: When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a movie.

label: shame
text: I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the people with a high standard of living.

label: guilt
text: When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.

label: joy
text: It feels good being close to another person.

label: sadness
text: Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.

label: disgust
text: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

label: shame
text: A man asked me: \May I sleep in your stairway?\"  and I answered \"No\"."

label: joy
text: I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I was completely healthy.

label: fear
text: My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was expected, he came back several hours later than expected.

label: anger
text: I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, however she had not understood the situation the same way so she did not turn up.

label: sadness
text: I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.

label: disgust
text: In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and behaved in keeping with his state.

label: shame
text: I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot about it.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.

label: joy
text: When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I like.

label: fear
text: I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.

label: anger
text: When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.

label: shame
text: I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme and the teacher criticized me.

label: guilt
text: I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised her personality, and she felt hurt and depressed.

label: joy
text: I shot the decisive goal in an ice-hockey match.

label: fear
text: When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a friend of mine.

label: anger
text: After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.

label: sadness
text: The death of my grandmother.

label: disgust
text: When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited economically.

label: shame
text: I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.

label: guilt
text: I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that it was also my fault.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies depended on it.

label: fear
text: In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.

label: anger
text: I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

label: sadness
text: My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale enterprise).

label: disgust
text: At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of understanding.

label: shame
text: I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at university, although I had been appointed to formally oppose the paper which was being presented.

label: guilt
text: I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some unnecessary work.

label: joy
text: On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a bird.(swans of the bay)

label: fear
text: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

label: anger
text: When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

label: sadness
text: The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in family relationships caused by it.

label: disgust
text: Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to clean up the dish later.

label: shame
text: A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the wrong place.

label: guilt
text: I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.

label: joy
text: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

label: fear
text: While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

label: anger
text: I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected manner.

label: sadness
text: I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made the call.

label: disgust
text: My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a peculiar manner.

label: shame
text: When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.

label: guilt
text: When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt is a part of my feelings.

label: joy
text: I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. ( I had not seen her for several months.)

label: fear
text: When my father was very drunk and raging at home.

label: anger
text: When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the yard.

label: sadness
text: When one of my cat died of a disease.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

label: shame
text: My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I felt quite ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for me.

label: fear
text: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

label: anger
text: I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was half an hour late.

label: sadness
text: The death of my grandmother.

label: disgust
text: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load on the tractor trailer.

label: shame
text: On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much, neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father had to carry me to bed.

label: guilt
text: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.

label: joy
text: I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

label: fear
text: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and ran out of the forest.

label: anger
text: I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and slammed the door.

label: sadness
text: I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

label: disgust
text: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that was stinking.

label: shame
text: While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.  I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.

label: guilt
text: I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the place.

label: joy
text: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

label: fear
text: Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across an exhibitionist.

label: anger
text: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

label: disgust
text: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to approach me.

label: shame
text: As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I vomitted in the basin of the classroom.

label: guilt
text: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.

label: joy
text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

label: fear
text: I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids were on the move.

label: anger
text: My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be done by me.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.

label: disgust
text: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my other friends and me.

label: shame
text: When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.

label: guilt
text: It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

label: joy
text: My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway station to meet him.

label: fear
text: I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an office.  I got frightened (later I was given a \natural\" explanation)."

label: anger
text: A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the same day.

label: sadness
text: The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to each other.

label: disgust
text: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  I did not like the man.

label: shame
text: At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had grown weary of it and said : \I would like to throw the book on the arse of Kuikka\".  My classmate said : \"Now, he is sitting there and waiting for the book\" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself."

label: guilt
text: The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

label: joy
text: My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our childhood, and we had a very happy time.

label: fear
text: My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an accident.

label: anger
text: I am a school teacher.  One of the classes does not obey me at all, keeps on talking, does no work.  One afternoon, everything went wrong, and I got exceedingly angry.

label: sadness
text: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few months old.

label: disgust
text: A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding from the nose and the mouth.

label: shame
text: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

label: guilt
text: A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know that I almost had full marks.

label: fear
text: I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.  Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

label: anger
text: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something which was serious and a real burden to me.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.

label: shame
text: As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.

label: fear
text: I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of mine.

label: anger
text: On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the increasing threat of war with the USA.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).

label: disgust
text: Watching a violent movie.

label: shame
text: The morning after a wild party.

label: guilt
text: I \picked up\" a girl and I thought that I had misused my position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any realistic possibility of continuing the relationship."

label: joy
text: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got \very good\" high school graduation marks."

label: fear
text: My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

label: anger
text: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

label: sadness
text: When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship and the coming separation hurt him.

label: disgust
text: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not encouraged and was rejected.

label: shame
text: I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and education.  I said something and then realized that I did not know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything about.

label: guilt
text: My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.

label: joy
text: I am not especially good at English, and after the high school graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My family was at home.

label: fear
text: I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know that I was not pregnant.

label: anger
text: A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.

label: disgust
text: In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.

label: shame
text: I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having followed the instructions

label: guilt
text: I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

label: joy
text: When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school mate.

label: fear
text: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would accidentally go off.

label: anger
text: My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all interested in any other place and had no time to study for other entrance exams.

label: sadness
text: I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed, lonely and deserted.

label: disgust
text: When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, this acquaintance had helped her move in.á

label: shame
text: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was amused.

label: guilt
text: When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do not care very much about children.

label: joy
text: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

label: fear
text: When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one movement it would have bitten me.

label: anger
text: When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

label: disgust
text: When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

label: shame
text: Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted to say.  Thoughtlessness.

label: guilt
text: When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

label: joy
text: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a moment.

label: fear
text: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed at night.

label: anger
text: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell me if they were visiting me or not.

label: sadness
text: A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.

label: shame
text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

label: guilt
text: I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed me.

label: joy
text: When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and went well.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence when  a train was coming.

label: anger
text: When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of other persons.á

label: sadness
text: I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.  I felt that he did not understand me and that there was no point in carrying on with the relationship.

label: disgust
text: I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave, threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away from home.

label: shame
text: When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel personnel.

label: guilt
text: When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had got in an easter egg.

label: joy
text: When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

label: fear
text: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the next day they promised to take revenge on me.

label: anger
text: My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to defend my friend.

label: sadness
text: I got to know about the death of a close friend.

label: disgust
text: When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

label: shame
text: When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with my pals.

label: guilt
text: When before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead of studying.

label: joy
text: When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought the cloth after months of hindrances.

label: fear
text: I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.  After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies were the only alternative.

label: anger
text: My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

label: sadness
text: Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

label: disgust
text: My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

label: shame
text: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

label: guilt
text: A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all my empathy.

label: joy
text: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and wine.

label: fear
text: The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health. Coping.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by the irreversibility of the decision.

label: disgust
text: A man spat on the wall of a house.

label: shame
text: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and invalids.

label: guilt
text: When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a nonacademic degree.

label: joy
text: When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

label: fear
text: At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a purposeful mannner.

label: anger
text: While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the decisions concerning my life.

label: sadness
text: When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact with my parents.

label: disgust
text: While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.

label: guilt
text: When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could not meet her because of a misunderstanding.

label: joy
text: The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt, then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the strongest.

label: fear
text: My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked on mucus secretions.

label: anger
text: The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close to me.(blaming us and lying)

label: sadness
text: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

label: disgust
text: A very drunk person.

label: shame
text: An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a person very close to me, when we should have been having a good time together.

label: guilt
text: While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him permanent injury.

label: joy
text: I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly, inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think \what others are thinking of me\".  It was delightful to dance to one's heart content."

label: fear
text: I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.

label: anger
text: I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.

label: sadness
text: I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess, blinding and blaming.

label: disgust
text: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and said \the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun was shining on it\". Hah Hah."

label: shame
text: I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an older, strange woman.

label: guilt
text: When I moved away from home.

label: joy
text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor said that the ear was completely all right.

label: fear
text: My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medical examinations we did not know what would follow.

label: anger
text: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

label: sadness
text: My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school weakened.

label: disgust
text: On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of her behaviour and paranoia.

label: shame
text: I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

label: guilt
text: I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.

label: joy
text: When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.

label: fear
text: When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me about it before.

label: sadness
text: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

label: disgust
text: While watching the movie called \Deer hunter\" on TV, when it showed how prisoners were treated."

label: shame
text: When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me picking my nose.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards my students.

label: joy
text: When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with joy that evening.

label: fear
text: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of cows.

label: anger
text: When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong manner.

label: sadness
text: When my friend did not pass the high school graduation examinations.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made to my friends, who did not approve of them.

label: shame
text: When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought that he had told about it to a friend of his.

label: guilt
text: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

label: joy
text: During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........

label: fear
text: At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

label: anger
text: In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of a leader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with undue strictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find his ticket at once.

label: sadness
text: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had once regarded as great and significant.

label: disgust
text: A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.

label: shame
text: I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress.  I sold my friend, I was despicable.

label: guilt
text: I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.

label: fear
text: Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle of the night in Italy.

label: anger
text: A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.

label: sadness
text: When our dog died.

label: disgust
text: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling false stories about herself and praising herself.

label: shame
text: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is important to our relationship.

label: guilt
text: A parking fine.

label: joy
text: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the whole of my studies.

label: fear
text: While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.

label: anger
text: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

label: sadness
text: The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

label: disgust
text: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

label: shame
text: After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

label: guilt
text: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.

label: joy
text: When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

label: fear
text: I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.

label: anger
text: When I quarelled with my parents.

label: sadness
text: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland for a year as an exchange student.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a spider.

label: shame
text: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.

label: guilt
text: While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.

label: joy
text: While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that her conception of man and work were similar to mine.

label: fear
text: While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt scared and fled to the bathroom.

label: anger
text: A \higher status\" colleague of mine despised my attitude and organization of work."

label: sadness
text: I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to illness.

label: disgust
text: Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.

label: shame
text: My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.

label: joy
text: I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard from a good friend (from my home town).

label: fear
text: My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to \be free\".  He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed."

label: anger
text: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.

label: sadness
text: After my boyfriend and I had separated.

label: disgust
text: In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor, near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

label: guilt
text: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had left open.

label: joy
text: I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for a long time (a good letter).

label: fear
text: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

label: anger
text: My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would not have liked to do so.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died, I saw my grandmother crying against my aunt's shoulder (I had never seen my grandmother cry before).

label: disgust
text: At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour in it.

label: shame
text: I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted later.

label: joy
text: When I got a letter from home.

label: fear
text: While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me, growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

label: anger
text: Disagreements with mother.  When I moved from KankaanpSS, she had promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some hindrance.

label: sadness
text: When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I would not be coming back home for a long time.

label: disgust
text: When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different directions.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

label: guilt
text: When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and disappointed.

label: joy
text: I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.

label: anger
text: I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.

label: sadness
text: The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me. And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.

label: disgust
text: The disgust I feel towards a certain person.

label: shame
text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

label: guilt
text: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My reaction was not as it should have been.

label: joy
text: I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I rejoyced at my success.

label: fear
text: I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of the town and I did not know what to do.

label: anger
text: An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

label: sadness
text: My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad because she was suffering.

label: disgust
text: A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that person as well as myself because I had partly submitted.

label: shame
text: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.

label: joy
text: A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

label: fear
text: I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.  Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.

label: anger
text: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook (almanach).

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died of cancer.

label: disgust
text: In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at me.

label: guilt
text: For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying  to be especially kind to me.

label: joy
text: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

label: fear
text: When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

label: anger
text: When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission first.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not democratic.

label: shame
text: While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up very well and they made a remark about it.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

label: joy
text: When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice, and his attitude made me glad.

label: fear
text: My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.

label: joy
text: I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged and had a long talk.

label: fear
text: One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.

label: anger
text: My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him.  I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angry or hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.

label: sadness
text: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support me and I began to weep convulsively.

label: disgust
text: I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the  boy on the ground.

label: shame
text: I had been away all night without having told my parents about it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.  She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that she was angry and disappointed.

label: guilt
text: I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me that she had been waiting for some news from us.

label: joy
text: When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

label: fear
text: I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been there.

label: anger
text: When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

label: sadness
text: When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas Holidays.

label: disgust
text: I once watched the series called \Dynasty\" on TV, and I detested it."

label: shame
text: I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not progressing.

label: joy
text: When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

label: fear
text: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had certainly happened to her.

label: anger
text: Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?

label: sadness
text: The death of a close relative.

label: disgust
text: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.

label: shame
text: My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she committed last night.

label: guilt
text: I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

label: joy
text: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I did not known about it and so was all the more glad.

label: fear
text: I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children were outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was responsible.

label: anger
text: I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they called me early morining to ask me \what are you going to do about the matter ?\" (which had been discussed in the meeting).  Then I got angry."

label: sadness
text: The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six years).

label: disgust
text: While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and felt like crying.

label: shame
text: When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.

label: guilt
text: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting I forgot to take the minutes.

label: joy
text: I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

label: fear
text: I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the others were sleeping.

label: anger
text: One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the two of us.

label: sadness
text: I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was \life is merriment\".  I felt depressed about the way they sought happiness."

label: disgust
text: I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.

label: shame
text: I gave a wrong answer at school.

label: guilt
text: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. However, the next day I said the same thing.

label: joy
text: When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.

label: fear
text: When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

label: disgust
text: I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic \student-like\" way."

label: shame
text: While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too raggy.

label: guilt
text: One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

label: joy
text: While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  and amusing sketch.

label: fear
text: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

label: anger
text: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

label: sadness
text: I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army was really mean.  I detested this.

label: shame
text: I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

label: guilt
text: While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

label: joy
text: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got me a three day furlough.

label: fear
text: When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering how I would get back home.

label: anger
text: I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students can find an appartment.

label: sadness
text: I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.

label: disgust
text: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is something I just can not tolerate.

label: shame
text: In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and the others started laughing.

label: joy
text: When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to win the Cup of England.

label: fear
text: I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased me to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of getting away from there.

label: anger
text: While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when I was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion  picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his last film.

label: disgust
text: I saw a movie called \The Thing\", the film directed by John Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted."

label: shame
text: I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person in question later.

label: guilt
text: While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.

label: joy
text: When I was in the sauna bath.

label: fear
text: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.

label: anger
text: When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in a questionnaire instead.

label: sadness
text: When my car froze, and I could not start it.

label: disgust
text: When I saw our computer teacher.

label: shame
text: When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first time.

label: guilt
text: When I was involved in a car crash.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

label: fear
text: My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop despite my asking her to do so.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died of cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which there was a rotten human skull.

label: shame
text: As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

label: guilt
text: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.

label: anger
text: New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated and my boyfriend's parents were present.

label: sadness
