text: Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

label: disgust
text: Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.

label: shame
text: I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was ashamed when I told my friend about it.

label: guilt
text: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold for half an hour.

label: joy
text: After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we are able to pay for.

label: fear
text: Car accident in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off because he didn't like me.

label: sadness
text: When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

label: disgust
text: A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my own flat.

label: shame
text: I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of leaving the house and getting to know new people.

label: guilt
text: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until several weeks later.

label: joy
text: I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed about it, I felt joy.

label: fear
text: My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her eyesight was at stake.

label: anger
text: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.

label: sadness
text: I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation: suddenly a friend came in and said \Have you already heard that...\"; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then everybody shouted excitedly \"How could that happen...\"."

label: disgust
text: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from another carriage.

label: shame
text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

label: guilt
text: A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the reason for her action.

label: joy
text: In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these examinations.

label: fear
text: I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could influence my parents to take it easy.

label: anger
text: I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed me for some work in the afternoon.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half a year later.

label: disgust
text: Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and the government decided to delay it for another year. When my father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

label: shame
text: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her from entering the room.

label: guilt
text: I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid that he would grumble.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

label: fear
text: My car skidded on the wet street.

label: anger
text: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, played cards with other people.

label: sadness
text: A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange manner.

label: disgust
text: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing with his penis in the middle of the town.

label: shame
text: Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a lie.

label: guilt
text: When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I felt guilty the next day.

label: anger
text: Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. He never said \please\" or \"thank you\" or any other kind word."

label: sadness
text: My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

label: shame
text: In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people were in the kitchen.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that two of them perished.

label: joy
text: When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.

label: fear
text: When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from school.

label: anger
text: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while under the influence of alcool.

label: sadness
text: My mother's death.

label: disgust
text: When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.

label: shame
text: I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night club.

label: guilt
text: During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he finally arrived but after a very long time).

label: joy
text: My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he loved me.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when he looked at me, I felt frightened.

label: anger
text: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an aggressive manner.

label: sadness
text: During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived with them. They were glad when I left.

label: disgust
text: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose and glass-eye, rattling breath.

label: shame
text: When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there naked.

label: guilt
text: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in love with another man.

label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.

label: fear
text: One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, but I was too frightened to go and see.

label: anger
text: When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a chair.

label: sadness
text: A person died (not really a friend).

label: disgust
text: Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted by a friend.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when asking and doing certain forbidden things.

label: guilt
text: When quarreling with friends.

label: joy
text: In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

label: fear
text: My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried hard, we could not find out the cause.

label: anger
text: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and started to cry. I grew angry.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.

label: disgust
text: On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day, beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

label: shame
text: When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was 16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short time.

label: guilt
text: I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning, although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From 3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.

label: joy
text: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

label: fear
text: On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it but I was very frightened.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

label: sadness
text: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.

label: disgust
text: In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less powerful people.

label: shame
text: When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and after a while I was crying.

label: guilt
text: I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

label: joy
text: When I worked as an \au-pair-girl\" in London, I received a call from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and especially when I saw her."

label: fear
text: It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened that my parents had to ask him to leave.

label: anger
text: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment to be able to see her.

label: sadness
text: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

label: disgust
text: A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave the room.

label: shame
text: When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special chair, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive behavior.

label: joy
text: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very much.

label: fear
text: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively well prepared.

label: anger
text: At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the trousers again.

label: sadness
text: In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship, died.

label: disgust
text: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

label: shame
text: A friend started to insult another person without reason and I felt ashamed of her behavior.

label: guilt
text: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 p.m.

label: joy
text: After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

label: fear
text: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

label: anger
text: A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really became conscious of her death at that moment.

label: disgust
text: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted when he told that.

label: shame
text: In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

label: guilt
text: After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own house but the house of people I hardly knew.

label: joy
text: On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for the dress-rehearsal of \Aida\". It was a different world for us full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic pizza in a restaurant near the \"Arena\"."

label: fear
text: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I really did not like that.

label: anger
text: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

label: sadness
text: I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure are always very depressing.

label: disgust
text: When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said \I thought you wanted to invite us for dinner\". \"Of course\", I said, but I thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought it."

label: guilt
text: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl but I considered it only as an \affair\". Only much later I realized how painful this must have been for the girl."

label: joy
text: When I was informed that a short story I had written had been accepted for publication.

label: fear
text: Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and prevent the accident.

label: anger
text: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had intended.

label: sadness
text: Death of my grandmother.

label: disgust
text: In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work for an examination, I really felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I could not remember the words I had to say.

label: guilt
text: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had a bad conscience and felt guilty.

label: joy
text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

label: fear
text: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men molesting my girlfriend and me.

label: anger
text: I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The three Magi), a local custom called \star singing\". One of the girls, my girlfriend, broke the star. Being the accompanying person, I felt very angry thinking of the consequences."

label: sadness
text: When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend was crying and I was sad, too.

label: disgust
text: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of his mouth while speaking.

label: shame
text: It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something,  but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt ashamed and blushed.

label: guilt
text: My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).

label: joy
text: I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for me, I was very glad.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and trembled.

label: anger
text: During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss them.

label: disgust
text: During a football game, another player who was perspiring very strongly ran into me.

label: shame
text: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

label: joy
text: At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth, security etc.

label: fear
text: I am a \cantor\" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not sing."

label: anger
text: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I had never asked her.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself to it.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the white population.

label: shame
text: My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.

label: guilt
text: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

label: joy
text: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after may weeks.

label: fear
text: After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being robbed in Marocco.

label: anger
text: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

label: sadness
text: I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew that I would never see them again.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

label: shame
text: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and staring at us.

label: guilt
text: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

label: joy
text: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

label: fear
text: I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and overstrained.

label: anger
text: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and I felt totally helpless.

label: disgust
text: I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about \Hainburg\". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union speak about the situation."

label: shame
text: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.

label: guilt
text: I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once she had a child she had a better relationship with them.

label: fear
text: Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boy standing behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me with him. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a tree I could stop.

label: anger
text: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat to them.

label: sadness
text: When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth place.

label: disgust
text: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.

label: shame
text: Some men were talking about me and my sister.

label: guilt
text: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the circumstances

label: joy
text: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had not seen for two years.

label: fear
text: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

label: anger
text: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me and nobody mentioned anything about that.

label: sadness
text: My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when playing in the garden.

label: disgust
text: At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.

label: shame
text: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her feel hurt.

label: guilt
text: I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed holiday job.

label: joy
text: I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our \11-months jubilee\", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red rose."

label: fear
text: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited until somebody passed by.

label: anger
text: I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her boyfriend.

label: sadness
text: When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few days later he died.

label: disgust
text: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of the night and shouted at me.

label: shame
text: At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be rebuked in front of the other pupils.á

label: guilt
text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

label: joy
text: After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling his body.

label: fear
text: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

label: anger
text: One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had the priority.

label: sadness
text: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

label: disgust
text: One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of cider and threatened to throw it at me.

label: shame
text: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had told him that my father had retired.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I had wanted to.

label: joy
text: A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

label: fear
text: When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a madman.

label: anger
text: I was in \Hainburg\" in December and I was angry about the politicians and the police."

label: sadness
text: I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that there had grown a certain distance between us.

label: disgust
text: When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the power of money.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

label: disgust
text: I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel which was filled with blood of pigs.

label: shame
text: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about our problems, I told her lies.

label: guilt
text: I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

label: joy
text: I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my father took his purse and payed.

label: fear
text: My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.

label: anger
text: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed his car on the place.

label: sadness
text: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

label: disgust
text: At a discussion a friend took a \faschistic view\", what I had not expected."

label: shame
text: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was prevented from participating in several activities.

label: guilt
text: When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly damaged.

label: joy
text: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our relationship grew closer.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could be freed only with big difficulties.

label: anger
text: I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and dangerous driving habit.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I lived with her for several years).

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly she did not give up for a longer time.

label: shame
text: When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men and women.

label: guilt
text: When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and invited me for a party.

label: fear
text: When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young people approached.

label: anger
text: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the letter.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: guilt
text: When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught me with them in my bag.

label: joy
text: When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for hours. She was in a good mood.

label: fear
text: When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess, and nervous.

label: anger
text: When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he avoids any confrontation, and is vague.

label: sadness
text: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

label: disgust
text: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in front of a group of my friends.

label: shame
text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

label: guilt
text: Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.

label: joy
text: When planning to marry.

label: fear
text: No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow beside me.

label: anger
text: My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in recent broken relationship.

label: sadness
text: Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along by would-be  in-laws.

label: disgust
text: No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her dancing instructor - he is a \user\", i.e., takes advantage of her good nature."

label: shame
text: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of difficult personal circumstances.

label: guilt
text: Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth year twice.

label: joy
text: When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians at ther wedding.

label: fear
text: Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided (after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.

label: anger
text: When boyfriend lied to me.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

label: disgust
text: On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) cigarettes.

label: shame
text: When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

label: guilt
text: When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about why I was home late.

label: joy
text: Getting a part-time job.

label: fear
text: Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¦ turn we followed and ended up in a gully.

label: anger
text: People hunting animals.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though, when he was sick.

label: disgust
text: People spitting in railway stations.

label: shame
text: Falling over.

label: guilt
text: Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

label: joy
text: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was ecstatic.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that someone was in the house.

label: anger
text: At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard the conversation.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't jailed.

label: sadness
text: In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with several employers, after several years of dedication I was dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

label: disgust
text: I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the attacked person bleeded to much.

label: shame
text: In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

label: guilt
text: Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a bird-cage, killing it.

label: joy
text: When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date a boy whom I liked for a long time.

label: fear
text: When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

label: anger
text: When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, because there where persons that didn't have problems, and wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people don't give you the right to have.

label: disgust
text: The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights, phisical aggrssion, etc.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text and didn't stop stuttering.

label: guilt
text: When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

label: anger
text: When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

label: sadness
text: The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

label: disgust
text: In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.

label: shame
text: When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

label: guilt
text: On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the least, reason or better motive.

label: joy
text: When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt well and very happy for being able to express to myself something that was suffocating me.

label: fear
text: When I crashed my car.

label: anger
text: When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly negative and distorted results.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I was not present either to see the person or to try to share my emotions with other friends.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she told me.

label: shame
text: When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an extremely positive word).

label: shame
text: When my mother surprised me while masturbating.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my friends who share the flat with me.

label: joy
text: After my final examination at school I was glad that the examination was over and that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by myself.

label: anger
text: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball offending her relatives.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something very precious.

label: disgust
text: My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

label: shame
text: Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a nonsense.

label: guilt
text: I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was for her to do it.

label: joy
text: For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father. Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very glad about it. It was a fine evening.

label: fear
text: I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very frightened.

label: anger
text: My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that she was busy - I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and I still do not want to believe that it is true.

label: disgust
text: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

label: shame
text: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed about what I had said.

label: guilt
text: An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were hurt.

label: joy
text: I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its life.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas' Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a light had to be left turned on.

label: anger
text: As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

label: sadness
text: A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised because in front of other people she had always treated him in a friendly way. I am very sad about it.

label: disgust
text: I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.

label: shame
text: During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

label: guilt
text: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my mother. So my mother always scolded her.

label: joy
text: When I passed my final examination at school.

label: fear
text: When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.

label: anger
text: When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than to my mother.

label: disgust
text: When I was molested by an old drunk man.

label: shame
text: When I had a Latin examination in school.

label: guilt
text: When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long separation.

label: fear
text: When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through a wood.

label: anger
text: A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an examination.

label: sadness
text: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

label: disgust
text: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; blood was dripping on the floor.

label: shame
text: In school I was very bad in running long distances and my class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt while he was playing.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

label: fear
text: Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny noises. I was terribly frightened.

label: anger
text: When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he got more money.

label: sadness
text: My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt very sorry for her.

label: disgust
text: When I attended school, our class visited an institution for mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to control my feelings, I was disgusted.

label: shame
text: After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.

label: fear
text: One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty bottle with me.

label: anger
text: I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people stood around the open grave and cried.

label: disgust
text: At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense and always wanted to kiss me.

label: shame
text: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me. Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on my birthday two weeks later.

label: joy
text: Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very much.

label: fear
text: One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible. Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

label: anger
text: I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for me to go to Carinthia.

label: sadness
text: Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the hunter who shot him.

label: disgust
text: I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

label: shame
text: I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

label: guilt
text: When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

label: joy
text: My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

label: fear
text: I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

label: anger
text: At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that, he did not listen to me but sent me away.

label: sadness
text: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with the driver.

label: disgust
text: When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who had been murdered by terrible methods.

label: shame
text: At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had observed that.

label: guilt
text: During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it impossible to continue discussing.

label: joy
text: On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long time.

label: anger
text: When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead of listening, I become angry.

label: sadness
text: When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I had a job there.

label: disgust
text: I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some persons like this course.

label: shame
text: Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been necessary.

label: guilt
text: I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some time later I apologized for that.

label: joy
text: On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself and got to know many other people.

label: fear
text: I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.

label: anger
text: I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because I was prevented from eating.

label: sadness
text: My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry for that and something like sadness.

label: disgust
text: On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me. At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills me with disgust.

label: shame
text: I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to come.

label: guilt
text: I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

label: joy
text: I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher seemed satisfied.

label: fear
text: A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw him.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected his call impatiently but in vain.

label: sadness
text: Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas Years ago.

label: disgust
text: A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

label: shame
text: It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able to join the conversation.

label: guilt
text: I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said \I am not a radiator\".

label: joy
text: On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody had passed the test.

label: fear
text: At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

label: anger
text: I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination. With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

label: sadness
text: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I cried for several days because I was so sad.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very disgusting, especially because I was eating.

label: shame
text: At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was rather ashamed for that.

label: guilt
text: By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

label: joy
text: During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our adresses.

label: fear
text: Many years ago I saw the film \Psycho\" by Hitchcock for the first time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep."

label: anger
text: I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said something like that).

label: sadness
text: I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

label: disgust
text: Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an improper and unsavoury conversation.

label: shame
text: My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had died recently.

label: guilt
text: When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

label: joy
text: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I heard that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was very afraid so that I will never forget it.

label: anger
text: My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was terribly angry with my sister.

label: sadness
text: I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at home. As something like that had happened to me several times before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody and I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second, because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught me napping.

label: guilt
text: I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a bit guilty for what had happened.

label: joy
text: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of the life-saving dogs.

label: fear
text: I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red switch.

label: anger
text: A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.

label: sadness
text: A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

label: disgust
text: On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after me and insisted on my apologizing.

label: guilt
text: I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I always started crying so that he had to give in.

label: joy
text: To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination, I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to be able to be with me.

label: fear
text: I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with fear until it was my turn.

label: anger
text: When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not finished.

label: sadness
text: My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own feelings were intensified.

label: disgust
text: When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed only helplessness and indecision.

label: shame
text: I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that and I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.

label: fear
text: My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

label: anger
text: I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg, especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.

label: sadness
text: Death of my father; he died of laryngeal cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I got indecent offers.

label: shame
text: When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

label: guilt
text: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend himself very well; I should have taken his part.

label: joy
text: I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned enough.

label: anger
text: Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I would win , but at last I lost the game.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather's funeral.

label: disgust
text: In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his guts when he was still alive.

label: shame
text: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it, but at that time I was not able to remember it.

label: guilt
text: I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

label: joy
text: When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome them.

label: fear
text: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard about that I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to live. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw him for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad when I saw that.

label: disgust
text: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his friends, but I was present.

label: shame
text: When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as it was for me.

label: guilt
text: When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had hurt him so much.

label: joy
text: Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their group, although it was late in the evening.

label: fear
text: After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury. Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out again and put the butter into the pan.

label: sadness
text: After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I had a feeling of emptyness.

label: disgust
text: I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be pitied.

label: shame
text: I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything - although I knew how he felt.

label: guilt
text: With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

label: joy
text: I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault, everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

label: fear
text: After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps coming nearer.

label: anger
text: I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.

label: sadness
text: I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.

label: disgust
text: I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that there was no reason for that.

label: joy
text: My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time through a pane of glass and she looked at me.

label: fear
text: My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid that he would do us a harm.

label: anger
text: I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would require.

label: sadness
text: When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a short time I had liked him very much.

label: disgust
text: When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath the air that smelled of her presence.

label: shame
text: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw how much she had worried (herself).

label: joy
text: When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became unimportant, I heard or saw the words \overcome egotism\". The feeling of joy remained for month after that experience."

label: fear
text: When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was forced to.

label: anger
text: When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.

label: sadness
text: When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had wanted to make sex.

label: guilt
text: When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our school who asked me what I was doing.

label: joy
text: When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything (normally he ofter grumbles at me).

label: fear
text: I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me, that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

label: anger
text: I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.

label: sadness
text: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

label: disgust
text: After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

label: shame
text: I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school (with success).

label: fear
text: Before my final examination.

label: anger
text: When my mother kept me in leading-strings.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.

label: shame
text: When I made a fool at an examination.

label: guilt
text: When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an examination.

label: joy
text: Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with whom I get along very well.

label: fear
text: Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because someone had informed me about it.

label: anger
text: My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign myself to it.

label: sadness
text: A friend who was 22 years old died.

label: disgust
text: When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very hungry.

label: shame
text: I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

label: guilt
text: A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.

label: joy
text: When we got a young dog.

label: fear
text: I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.

label: anger
text: I had an accident with damage to the car body.

label: sadness
text: My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress myself and was examined by several doctors.

label: guilt
text: When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so that he was slightly injured.

label: joy
text: When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long time, would come and see me.

label: fear
text: When I had my first oral examination after a long time; especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up for it.

label: anger
text: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.

label: sadness
text: When my brother died.

label: disgust
text: I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

label: shame
text: When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it out.

label: guilt
text: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad about that.

label: joy
text: I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

label: fear
text: When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.

label: sadness
text: A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

label: disgust
text: When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my sole.

label: shame
text: Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had not washed the dishes.

label: guilt
text: I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down, was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

label: joy
text: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long time.

label: fear
text: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important for my work, but she forgot it.

label: sadness
text: My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his soporification.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I was able to break loose.

label: shame
text: When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my body.

label: guilt
text: I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was impossible for me to help him.

label: joy
text: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at the station.

label: fear
text: After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit blood.

label: anger
text: At an office an application that I had made was turned down because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.

label: sadness
text: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

label: disgust
text: I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her awfully.

label: shame
text: After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.

label: guilt
text: I spread abroad an intimate secret.

label: joy
text: I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

label: fear
text: My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to lose her.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers dropped out.

label: sadness
text: During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she looked miserable.

label: disgust
text: On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other in such a degrading way.

label: shame
text: My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

label: guilt
text: I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying - and it started crying again.

label: joy
text: I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt glad.

label: fear
text: When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how it would react later on.

label: anger
text: My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not enough space to store them.

label: sadness
text: A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.

label: disgust
text: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression on me.

label: shame
text: During a discussion I said something rather stupid and unnecessary.

label: guilt
text: When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I should not have done that and felt guilty.

label: joy
text: On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

label: fear
text: I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt that a stranger was in my house.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours late.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

label: shame
text: When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother discovered that.

label: guilt
text: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the door closed.

label: joy
text: After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had passed all my written examinations.

label: fear
text: Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had happened to him.

label: anger
text: I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid mistake - and he won!

label: sadness
text: It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

label: disgust
text: 3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested for 3 days. I still detest this man.

label: shame
text: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from sleep.

label: guilt
text: When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my little brother because of a fit of rage.

label: joy
text: After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend, who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.

label: fear
text: Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised another person to give him a lift.

label: sadness
text: I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

label: disgust
text: I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted. Perhaps once, when I saw a big spider.

label: shame
text: When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.

label: guilt
text: I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but I did not.

label: joy
text: Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

label: fear
text: Unknown person knocking repeatedly on backdoor when no one else was at home.

label: anger
text: Boyfriend \chatting up\" another girl."

label: sadness
text: A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a stranger.

label: shame
text: Parents finding out I smoked.

label: guilt
