text: Not thanking relatives for a favor done.

label: joy
text: Emotional reassurances by spouse.

label: fear
text: Movement in bush late at night while camping.

label: anger
text: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.

label: sadness
text: Loss of close relative.

label: disgust
text: The price I was charged for work on my car.

label: shame
text: Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.

label: guilt
text: Losing my temper with my spouse.

label: joy
text: A night spent with a group of friends.

label: fear
text: A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the street.

label: anger
text: A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly thereafter.

label: sadness
text: A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected manner.

label: disgust
text: A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

label: shame
text: On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend, I caused her to be physically harmed.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when I said I would.

label: joy
text: Getting a phone call from a very old friend.

label: fear
text: Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

label: anger
text: Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't think I committed.

label: sadness
text: Death of a parent.

label: disgust
text: At a social event when none of the guests would help to serve food or clear tables. It was all beneath them.

label: shame
text: The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.

label: joy
text: The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed university subject was communicated to me by phone.

label: fear
text: I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the runway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilot suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

label: anger
text: A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my protestation was obvious to me.

label: sadness
text: While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I shot it.

label: disgust
text: A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the bench.

label: shame
text: I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a certain date, then thought no more about it until the friend reminded me after the date had passed.

label: guilt
text: A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the smoke in that direction.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet of flowers.

label: fear
text: When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night. Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was fearful whenever walking through the area.

label: anger
text: When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

label: sadness
text: When I found out that a person I went to school with had died in a car accident.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated him, and caused a great instability.

label: shame
text: When I realised that I had become too emotionally involved with the person I'm going out with, and when I began to like someone else and questioned whether I really care about person I'm with.

label: guilt
text: When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

label: joy
text: One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was spontaneous and lots of fun.

label: fear
text: I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

label: anger
text: At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I am nice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.

label: sadness
text: Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and friends behind.

label: disgust
text: Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself and never acting positively to do something about her problems.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my little sister.

label: guilt
text: Often I forget to give my immediate family birthday presents.

label: joy
text: I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw structure.

label: fear
text: I do not recall being scared in the near past.

label: anger
text: As for disgust.

label: sadness
text: Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in tutorial.

label: disgust
text: I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him with no excuse to do so.

label: shame
text: I do not seem to feel emotion such as shame, guilt or fear - far out !

label: guilt
text: I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past. REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.

label: joy
text: When I was complimented and called \delightful\"."

label: fear
text: When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.

label: anger
text: Anger towards my lover for being late.

label: sadness
text: The death of my twin sister - suicide.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only wanted 50 g).

label: shame
text: I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

label: guilt
text: Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before she died.

label: joy
text: My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and had not had time alone together for almost a month until one afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered and ate together.

label: fear
text: A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work standards.

label: anger
text: I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was rejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying for a moment she said \There, have you got it all out now ?\"."

label: sadness
text: I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled), watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances - pressures of examinations in particular.

label: disgust
text: I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers. The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on one another.

label: shame
text: Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I found that a collection of pornographic literature had been removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was aware of the existence of this material.

label: guilt
text: My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the road, and I had transgressed (together with the \wild\" kids from across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I was severely scolded."

label: joy
text: Blank.

label: fear
text: After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious cuts which were gaping open.

label: anger
text: The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the house.

label: sadness
text: Watching \11 am\". They had a programme on the starving refugees. Their plight was a source of sadness for me."

label: disgust
text: A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about 3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night, and back again.

label: shame
text: During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted her parents by having had sex in their house which they overheard.

label: guilt
text: A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an impulsive kiss.

label: fear
text: When my boyfriend was leaving to go home one night, I had a very deep sense of uneasiness and an unwarranted fear that I wouldn't see him again.

label: anger
text: Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his girlfriend.

label: sadness
text: Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of cancer.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed with a stranger.

label: shame
text: I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I have attempted, but have not actually gone through with corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

label: guilt
text: After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected his opinions of me.

label: joy
text: When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual emotion.

label: fear
text: I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly (actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no one to help me).

label: anger
text: I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing them being scared away.

label: sadness
text: When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days. She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).

label: disgust
text: When my father revealed inconsistent morals.

label: shame
text: When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and discovered several untoward things had occurred.

label: guilt
text: Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having given her this additonal problem.

label: joy
text: I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

label: fear
text: My brother and I were driving to Brisbane when he drove back onto the road, perhaps cutting off another car but not noticeable - this driver did his best to drive us off the road for about 1/2 an hour.

label: anger
text: I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about people using him to cash notes.

label: sadness
text: My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the sun rose.

label: disgust
text: A lecturer in great detail spoke about his sexual experiences.

label: shame
text: I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped and fell.

label: guilt
text: I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.

label: joy
text: On a sailing boat at night, under a full moon, listening to Pink Floyd, drinking good wine, with good company, the boat being steered by autopilot, and a full eclipse of the moon.

label: fear
text: Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.

label: anger
text: When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by co-owners out of pure selfishness.

label: sadness
text: At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great esteem.

label: disgust
text: Viewing the nuclear war film \Threads\"."

label: shame
text: Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive counter-attack.

label: guilt
text: Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore his personal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other person was made to feel terrible/defensive.

label: joy
text: Family member survived an operation.

label: fear
text: I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being followed.

label: anger
text: I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital) as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed money from my purse.

label: sadness
text: Death of grandmother.

label: disgust
text: When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.

label: shame
text: Caught cheating on a diet.

label: guilt
text: I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.

label: joy
text: A close married friend has just had his first child.

label: fear
text: Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire vehicle.

label: anger
text: Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for 11 years (I had stayed down due to illness)

label: sadness
text: At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.

label: disgust
text: A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a wedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car when home took quite a while.

label: shame
text: Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

label: guilt
text: I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).

label: joy
text: Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

label: fear
text: Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and was motivated by fear of being eaten to perform great swimming feats.

label: anger
text: Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an entire packet of almonds I had bought for a family treat.

label: sadness
text: The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart attack.

label: disgust
text: When after a party celebrating a friend's 21st birthday - upon leaving I found 10 people outside throwing up and further 4 unconscious.

label: shame
text: Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began hitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.

label: guilt
text: A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.

label: joy
text: Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was behind by 3 games. We won the last set 6-2 and won the match by a game.

label: fear
text: When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what would happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.

label: anger
text: Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude problem.

label: sadness
text: Death of the family dog.

label: disgust
text: We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in the air, and it bounced on an expensive table and damaged the table .The person did not apologise.

label: shame
text: After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too personal.

label: guilt
text: Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army location.

label: joy
text: Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip - something \exhilarating\" about the change of scenery etc."

label: fear
text: As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and becoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.

label: anger
text: Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs.

label: sadness
text: Leaving the house myself and a female friend had shared for 6-8 months because of the friendship which developed and our approach to each other in occasional instances of several personal crises.

label: disgust
text: Discovering a good friend had lied to me, resulting in a detrimental relationship with another person.

label: shame
text: No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resulting in someone else being blamed for the event.

label: guilt
text: Leaving University in 1982 following exclusion and lying to parents/friends about reasons for leaving, i.e. lying about the fact of having been excluded.

label: joy
text: Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years previously.

label: fear
text: Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.

label: anger
text: At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without harming her.

label: sadness
text: Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three out of seven (subjects).

label: disgust
text: When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the company they worked for - using company petrol and food supplies and claiming furniture and crockery.

label: shame
text: When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd been doing behind her back.

label: guilt
text: After having told an authority figure a very large lie I was told she believed me, because she believed I had never lied to her.

label: joy
text: After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived interstate, had remembered when I'd get back and phoned to welcome me home on the night of my arrival.

label: fear
text: Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

label: anger
text: Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and take the blame for any mistakes.

label: sadness
text: After training for an Australian championship competition for a year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.

label: disgust
text: Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

label: shame
text: A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a cheap one.

label: guilt
text: Talking about someone behind their back.

label: joy
text: I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I swam in, and thus my team won the championship.

label: fear
text: I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told that my mother had skin cancer and would have to go to the hospital straight away.

label: anger
text: Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away and we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of being selfish and a snob.

label: sadness
text: Shifted from Melbourne to Brisbane. All my old school friends gave me a party and I had to say good-bye to them all.

label: disgust
text: Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

label: shame
text: Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her down to other friends.

label: guilt
text: Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she was.

label: joy
text: When I won the \Under 18\" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing."

label: fear
text: When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody around that I could run to.

label: anger
text: When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived and \different\" from other children at school."

label: sadness
text: I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put down.

label: disgust
text: When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and was experimenting with drugs.

label: shame
text: When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had been over to a friend's place.

label: guilt
text: When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I felt very guilty.

label: joy
text: Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.

label: fear
text: First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).

label: anger
text: At a school dance when my supposed \best friend\" kept walking away from me whenever I came near her."

label: sadness
text: At end of school - function to \celebrate\" ? Leaving friends who I'd known for up to 12 years."

label: disgust
text: While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes, mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

label: shame
text: When my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not require much effort on my part, yet I refused for selfish reasons and saw her have to do it.

label: guilt
text: After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and felt guilty about having taken it.

label: joy
text: Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we are homesick.

label: fear
text: Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being alone.

label: anger
text: A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

label: disgust
text: At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly getting drunk.

label: shame
text: A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys I knew. It sounded really childish.

label: guilt
text: I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I felt I had lied to them.

label: joy
text: Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but expected only a moderate mark.

label: fear
text: When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a \Jungle Spider\") ran out near me. (I do not like even small spiders)."

label: anger
text: At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric measurements, I made a mistake, and didn't buy enough tiles for the bathroom. I was angry at myself, because I hope to be a Maths teacher.

label: sadness
text: My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

label: disgust
text: During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown  was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

label: shame
text: Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket. The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.

label: guilt
text: I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

label: joy
text: I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a presentation I'd given that I was very worried about.

label: fear
text: A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats, though not to me.

label: anger
text: Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.

label: sadness
text: Passing away of my father.

label: disgust
text: At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about the girls they'd been with.

label: shame
text: Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

label: joy
text: When I received the results from my final examination - Higher School Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond my wildest expectations.

label: fear
text: Walking around the University at night by myself, having been previously warned of rapes, etc.

label: anger
text: When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.

label: sadness
text: When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a long time.

label: disgust
text: At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything about.

label: shame
text: When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew I would miss out on more information which I did not know, but I couldn't cope with going.

label: joy
text: Got through first semester University.

label: fear
text: At the tender age of eleven a friend and I left a party and proceeded to walk through dark and secluded streets of a bad neighborhood to find a telephone (recent spate of Horror Movie watching had occurred).

label: anger
text: In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

label: sadness
text: I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very \indepth\" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss were over I felt an immense sadness."

label: disgust
text: A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip of whimsy.

label: shame
text: I bacame involved with a boy for a very brief moment not because I liked him but because I needed some sort of company. The consequences weren't as I expected and caused me much shame.

label: guilt
text: Ignoring my parents'wishes.

label: joy
text: Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.

label: fear
text: Having my luggage checked at Customs.

label: anger
text: When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.

label: sadness
text: Thinking about friends overseas.

label: disgust
text: Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.

label: shame
text: Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.

label: guilt
text: Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.

label: joy
text: When I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into Physiotherapy.

label: fear
text: When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of \bitching\" about best friend."

label: sadness
text: At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing will ever be the same again.

label: disgust
text: At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

label: shame
text: When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke the cup.

label: guilt
text: When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I was (going).

label: joy
text: When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to  graduate from their courses.

label: fear
text: When I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.

label: anger
text: When I was put into a tennis team below my standard.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: disgust
text: When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of themselves.

label: shame
text: When my friends were rude to a girl.

label: guilt
text: When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

label: joy
text: When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I had waited a long time for this to occur.

label: fear
text: When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

label: anger
text: When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to tell me for several days after it happened.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away of cancer, I was extremely saddened. He was not very old, which made matters worse. The actual death was horrendous, but the moving funeral saddened me more so.

label: disgust
text: When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I told my sister I had slept with my boyfriend, and she at first was mad at me I then felt shame for this act, but not guilt.

label: disgust
text: I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother came to drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin his friends. I was embarrassed because the family involved was extremely nice, and hospitable to him.

label: shame
text: I allowed my then boyfriend to touch me, if only briefly.

label: guilt
text: I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't know why.

label: joy
text: When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus Christ as his saviour and Lord.

label: fear
text: I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and saved me.

label: anger
text: While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but they didn't show up.

label: sadness
text: When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was now a female (I don't know it/them personally).

label: shame
text: When Dad went to a Sports Day and was the only parent there, and he was cheering for us.

label: guilt
text: We owned a shop and I used to serve in it occasionally. We sometimes took lollies out of the stand and Dad caught me one day.

label: joy
text: On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling overwhelmed.

label: shame
text: Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it came to it, I let them down.

label: joy
text: Good news about a sick relative.

label: fear
text: Walking in the dark by myself.

label: anger
text: Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.

label: sadness
text: When felt lonely about writing my family.

label: disgust
text: Person talking about a situation while eating.

label: shame
text: Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the most important in my life.

label: guilt
text: Not giving up something for Lent.

label: joy
text: When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University - it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.

label: fear
text: Every time I see a spider or a snake.

label: anger
text: My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I ended up in tears - he'd won.

label: sadness
text: The first time I left home.

label: disgust
text: On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.

label: shame
text: When my new jeans split while I was with the youth group.

label: guilt
text: When I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, when really it was 3.30.

label: joy
text: Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately happy until a year or so ago.

label: fear
text: Left alone in dark when young.

label: anger
text: Can't remember exact example.

label: sadness
text: Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.

label: disgust
text: Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is now dying of cancer.

label: shame
text: One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay with her - still felt shame.

label: sadness
text: After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.

label: disgust
text: A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing it.

label: shame
text: A situation where we were the center of attention, and things happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement, and ignorance.

label: guilt
text: When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.

label: joy
text: When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting changes in my life, and I became happy.

label: fear
text: When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.

label: anger
text: When I was left by the person I loved without any reason.

label: sadness
text: To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.

label: disgust
text: To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.

label: shame
text: A day when I was getting out of the shower I covered only the front part of my body with a towel (I was 7 years old), and I didn't see that my cousin was in the room.

label: guilt
text: When I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sad end.

label: joy
text: I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and vanity about it.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

label: anger
text: I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of me.

label: sadness
text: I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sense between my parents.

label: disgust
text: When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.

label: shame
text: I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a classroom at P.V.C.

label: guilt
text: I felt it when playing I pushed my brother and he fell down cutting himself in pieces of tile.

label: joy
text: When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.

label: fear
text: When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that I use to go almost not excaping.

label: anger
text: I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like made fuss at my girl.

label: sadness
text: The death of my grandfather.

label: disgust
text: To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly kept.

label: shame
text: In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.

label: guilt
text: I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.

label: joy
text: When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.

label: fear
text: When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.

label: anger
text: When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.

label: sadness
text: When my team lost a championship.

label: disgust
text: A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.

label: shame
text: I confused a girl with another.

label: guilt
text: Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my parents.

label: joy
text: When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16 months ago.

label: anger
text: I learned that my girlfriend had been unjustly missed from work.

label: sadness
text: I got separated from the man I loved.

label: disgust
text: An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to me.

label: shame
text: Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my teacher spotted me.

label: guilt
text: I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being paralysed.

label: joy
text: When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was extremely official.

label: fear
text: When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a possible failure.

label: anger
text: I was indignant at the unimpartiality shown by the referees at the football match between Bulgaria and France.

label: sadness
text: When I got separated from the man I loved so much.

label: disgust
text: When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film \Twentieth Century\"."

label: shame
text: When I was a school girl and I copied at a class work.

label: guilt
text: When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I have happened to deceive them over some trifling things.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Sofia University.

label: fear
text: When I come home late at night.

label: anger
text: When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.

label: sadness
text: When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.

label: disgust
text: When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.

label: shame
text: When I have a plain appearance.

label: guilt
text: When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

label: joy
text: I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.

label: fear
text: I was bitten by a dog.

label: anger
text: My grandfather's funeral.

label: sadness
text: I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.

label: disgust
text: I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.

label: shame
text: I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

label: guilt
text: Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage that occurred at the building site I had designed.

label: joy
text: My admittance to the University.

label: fear
text: A grenade blew out next to me.

label: anger
text: An unjust calumny concerning me.

label: sadness
text: Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).

text: Disgust with a subordinate.

label: shame
text: I lied to a friend.

label: guilt
text: Betraying someone's trust.

label: guilt
text: Friend's fiancT left her for me.

label: joy
text: Winning Queensland Chess Championship.

label: fear
text: When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or write off).

label: anger
text: With self at losing an important game that I should have won.

label: sadness
text: Death of grandfather (unexpected).

label: disgust
text: Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.

label: shame
text: When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

label: guilt
text: Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do it due to transport troubles.

label: joy
text: Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had thought possible.

label: fear
text: Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.

label: anger
text: I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.

label: sadness
text: I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a flood of the same emotion.

label: disgust
text: When one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.

label: shame
text: I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking, along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.

label: joy
text: Being in love for the first time.

label: fear
text: As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might get tetanus.

label: anger
text: As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being set upon by another boy who claimed it was \his land\" - being intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc."

label: sadness
text: As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.

label: disgust
text: Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.

label: shame
text: As a child - being sent to the shop by mother - buying some chocolate - getting caught by mother.

label: guilt
text: As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it dying.

label: joy
text: When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of 3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded pass).

label: fear
text: One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of brances, which was not the wind.

label: anger
text: I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to this, she had said nothing.

label: sadness
text: Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

label: disgust
text: When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation ceremony.

label: shame
text: Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.

label: guilt
text: When I was about 14 years old, I \borrowed\" a can of drink from the refrigerator, intending to replace it later that day. But it was found missing before I could do anything - no one owned up to its disappearance."

label: joy
text: When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I followed her out, then witnessed them being born.

label: fear
text: On embarking on University life. I came from a different city and did not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my well known and loved friends, also all my security had been taken away.

label: anger
text: When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his fault.

label: sadness
text: Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different city, I felt no longer \under the wing\" of my parents even though they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions."

label: disgust
text: I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother, right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming - probably in pain.

label: shame
text: Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt shamed when I finally confronted her again.

label: guilt
text: When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.

label: joy
text: The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

label: fear
text: Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in Brisbane (the \big smoke\") leaving home, my family, and moving to such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was anxious about it."

label: anger
text: My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became defensive.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays. Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.á

label: disgust
text: One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning, to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

label: shame
text: First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I was annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to be with my family.

label: guilt
text: When my Bictorian \friend\" was staying at my house we ere going places together, and sleeping together. At the time I had a boyfriend locally. The first time I had to face him after sleeping with the guy from Melbourne I felt very guilty."

label: joy
text: Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

label: fear
text: Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

label: anger
text: Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth. They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

label: sadness
text: When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination, even though his case was relatively mild.

label: disgust
text: I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the racism she has been subjected to.

label: shame
text: I can't remember ever feeling shame.

label: guilt
text: When I decided my first marriage had ended, and left with the child. I felt overwhelmed by guilt as I was separating mother and child.

label: joy
text: Receiving notification that I had made a successful application to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig of achievment and joy.

label: fear
text: Not included on questionnaire.

label: anger
text: My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he had been doing behind her back.

label: sadness
text: My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I would see him again.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and contempt.

label: shame
text: I recently became sexually involved with my sister's lover. I care for him very much, but I am ashamed of the hurt I may cause her.

label: guilt
text: I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. I have been promoted to work in a very privileged section of the store. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.

label: joy
text: Seeing a close friend who had just returned from twelve months overseas.

label: fear
text: Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to have had great psychological disturbances.

label: anger
text: After seeing an \uncertain\" child work on a model for several hours, I watched a \"bully\" of the same age destroy it, telling the child that it was worthless."

label: sadness
text: Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child, this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself.

label: disgust
text: Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary school.

label: shame
text: I slept with a man purely because I found him physically attractive and was under the influence of alcohol.

label: guilt
text: Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.

label: joy
text: When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately, could jump for joy.

label: fear
text: When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous, and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

label: anger
text: When a so-called friend let me down, when she promised to tell me when a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing, just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it was going to be.

label: sadness
text: When my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.

label: disgust
text: When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and their government was spending millions on celebrating being in power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing food, etc.

label: shame
text: I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them down.

label: guilt
text: I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about the bump (later I had to confess).

label: joy
text: Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we found out that he succeded in entering at the University.

label: fear
text: One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters. After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

label: anger
text: One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got in my car and went away.

label: sadness
text: I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow that I can call sadness.

label: disgust
text: Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made by a man with the purpose that I saw it.

label: shame
text: In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant. We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My car broke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrived stand up and applauded us when we entered two hours late. All the restaurant attention was turned on us.

label: guilt
text: When I was a little girl about eight years old I broke the bey from a closed. Mother asked who did it. I said that it wasn't me, as I almost never lied, and my brother did it more frequently in spite my brother denieing it my mother gave him a few slaps.

label: joy
text: When I entered at the University.

label: fear
text: One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and almost died.

label: anger
text: When one teacher unjustly gave me zero in a test saying that I was cribbing.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners for eat.

label: shame
text: When the teacher asked me to read my composition that was the homework I stood up and invented one because I hadn't done it. A colleague saw that in my copy book there was nothing written and he accused me and so I was called in the director's room.

label: guilt
text: When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that I judged very difficult.

label: fear
text: Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I thought that I was going to be trampled.

label: anger
text: I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other colleague asked for it she gave it to him.

label: sadness
text: Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me to decide either the place nor the time.

label: disgust
text: A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.

label: shame
text: One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.

label: guilt
text: When I answered to my mother with rudeness.

label: joy
text: The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when I was with the person I love for the first time.

label: fear
text: Fear of thief.

label: anger
text: I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I was despised by another person.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust of dirty.

label: shame
text: Shame of not doing something well.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.

label: joy
text: When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and when I finished I knew I had passed it.

label: fear
text: I was inside the car with my husband and we were assaulted with a gun at 10 o'clock in the evening.

label: anger
text: When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.

label: sadness
text: I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are many sisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't know why I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, their shouts when this happened.

label: disgust
text: When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about that people.

label: shame
text: I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.

label: guilt
text: When my niece was 3 years old she was in the living room while we were fixing the table for a birthday party and, as every child, she couldn't stay calm. She burst a balloon. When I told her to be quiet her father pinched her. I believe if I hadn't said anything this wouldn't have happened.

label: joy
text: I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.

label: fear
text: When I was looking for a job I felt a lot of fear but the fear was greater when I found it.

label: anger
text: This feeling occurred to me when my colleague entered in G.V. (University) and I didn't.

label: sadness
text: When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST, and I wasn't approved in the second fase.

label: disgust
text: I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty but she was to \fresh\", dump and childish."

label: shame
text: I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body.

label: guilt
text: When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and I insisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let me go out alone for the first time.

label: fear
text: I felt afraid when I smoked maryhuana for the first time in my life with a lot of friends in the middle of the street at day brake.

label: anger
text: I felt anger when I had a fight with my father, and he beated me. My mother came to help me (because I was beeing beated) and he also beated my mother.

label: sadness
text: It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car accident.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.

label: shame
text: When my mother found out that I smoke maryhuana.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I \stole\" the boyfriend of a friend of mine."

label: joy
text: Always when I am well succeded.

label: fear
text: When there is danger nearby.

label: anger
text: I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.

label: sadness
text: When I couldn't go for a trip with my friends in a holiday.

label: disgust
text: Disgust of drunkers and of blood.

label: shame
text: Shame of being reprehended.

label: guilt
text: When I shout at a colleague in classroom.

label: joy
text: When there was a possibility of getting on better in professional life. I valorized very much this aspect. People showed me this possibility, not the real fact (even because until now ...)

label: fear
text: When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me (sort of incorporation !).

label: anger
text: When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional level.

label: sadness
text: During an informal talk with a friend when we talk about the life of another person, a common friend, that is in a situation of not being able to assume certain problems that he decided to solve, that is, she herself suggested the problems and decided to solve them but didn't get it until the moment.

label: disgust
text: When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans, and dishes, and even the food.

label: shame
text: When I went to meet the family of my boyfriend in a party in his house. His mother was eager to know me and all his friends ready to make jokes about the situation.

label: guilt
text: When I met another person I began to go out with him, and my boyfriend (with marriage accorded) met us together he did a great scandal, he broke the engagement and I began to go out with the other, and it didn't work because my mind was all mixed up.

label: joy
text: When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.

label: fear
text: Afraid of getting alone without friends, without anybody.

label: anger
text: When they stole my dark blue tennis.

label: sadness
text: When I became conscious that men don't wnat anything they don't have a goal. They have: sex, but this isn't important.

label: disgust
text: When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions people are attended there.

label: shame
text: In the last day of carnaval I met a boy and began to flirt with him. I was in love with him. When he introduced me to his friends I died of shame because I was with them before, I met my boyfriend in carnaval.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't pass the examinations for FUVEST I felt myself guilty for I should have studied. I had the opportunities, and I drew them out.

label: joy
text: When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with him. When I see again another I miss.

label: fear
text: I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also a little afraid of the directions that it's going.

label: anger
text: I felt anger of a friend when she met \a date\" and become nervous and pest as she always gets when she meets him."

label: sadness
text: When I knew almost the same day about two great friends of mine that had serious existential crisis, and mainly when I notice that I'm in the same situation that they are, but I didn't realize it.

label: disgust
text: When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I thought he was disgusted and \a friend\" of mine for whom I feel a little disgust wanted to stay with him."

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I wouldn't know what to say.

label: guilt
text: When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because I didn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she always does), and wouldn't stick on me.

label: joy
text: When I entered University.

label: fear
text: I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I almost didn't enter University.

label: anger
text: I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist championship, and so it lost the classifications.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother, my second mother died.

label: disgust
text: When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.

label: shame
text: When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.

label: guilt
text: When my father had a serious fight with my sister, because of me.

label: joy
text: When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of joy.

label: fear
text: The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt - disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.

label: anger
text: About the car (sadness) I felt anger the way I acted after negotiating it.

label: sadness
text: To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.

label: disgust
text: I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.

label: shame
text: When my mother looked in my drawer (where I keep my personal things) and she found some porno photos that I have kept from more than a week, and split it.

label: guilt
text: About the girl (22 years, married) I felt guilty of the relationship.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in the entrance college examination.

label: fear
text: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

label: anger
text: Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride, when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver and provokes an accident.

label: joy
text: To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps because it has been one of the good things that I learned with this friend.

label: fear
text: When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and tried to \catch me\"."

label: anger
text: The fact that I hadn't been informed about something and I had the greatest trust in this person.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad and couldn't believe it (until today).

label: disgust
text: In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.

label: shame
text: It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me a surprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.

label: guilt
text: Attending to a demand made by a client (I work in a bank) I suggested her an application of money in a week ahead, but I informed her wrongly. The client arrived a week after and the application wasn't made and she lost with this a lot of time and money.

label: joy
text: When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.

label: fear
text: After some time of work I was transferred to another place and in an other quite harder job.

label: anger
text: When I used to go to my chief asking about any doubt about the job and he didn't care, didn't answer me, leaving me speaking alone.

label: sadness
text: When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react the way I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.

label: disgust
text: When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other feelings.

label: shame
text: After lot of explanation, to fail in my work.

label: guilt
text: My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that it was my fault.

label: joy
text: When a person that I like very much got near to me.

label: fear
text: I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs, and drawers.

label: anger
text: When a person is privileged in account of situations that are unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

label: sadness
text: When I was betrayed by a friend, and decided to stay apart form her.

label: disgust
text: After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want to see her anymore.

label: shame
text: I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. I got a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to a place were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rang and a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.

label: guilt
text: I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.

label: joy
text: I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold, and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.

label: fear
text: I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all night in bed without falling asleep.

label: anger
text: Once in my work it happened a fight between the person in charge and me. I got so angry and spoke out everything I felt at the moment.

label: sadness
text: I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my sadness was so great that until today I remember everything about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was the greatest sadness I felt.

label: disgust
text: I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this situation, and of the persons implicated in it.

label: shame
text: Some times I was ashamed of presenting seminaries or even to speak in class.

label: guilt
text: In adolescence I had a very violent fight with my sister I hold her stong in her neck, she had a throat surgery what make me feel guilty about the future reactions she might had injuring the surgery.

label: joy
text: The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed to us that this was almost impossible to happen.

label: fear
text: I had a driver licence but I didn't drive for a long time, than I started to drive again, and had to get into hard transit and highways.

label: anger
text: When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl take vacations that month. The anger was because of the resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.

label: sadness
text: My fiancT's family was adopting a 5 years old boy. I felt myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send him back.

label: disgust
text: There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.

label: shame
text: A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar, and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what). Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed and sorry just after.

label: guilt
text: When I was starting in romance with my husband, we went out to curt, and we stayed in the car \making love\". At the time I was seventeen and I was very immature until a day I lost my virginity."

label: joy
text: It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

label: fear
text: When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the dream scare.

label: anger
text: When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at that moment.

label: sadness
text: When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best because of my foolishness.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after a week only on meat.

label: shame
text: When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).

label: guilt
text: When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and at the same instant the pastry felt on the floor.

label: joy
text: In a day when at work, in school, and relationships came out as I wanted, and I was recognized in my work.

label: fear
text: When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke because of a certain end.

label: anger
text: When I was robbed in a bus.

label: sadness
text: When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.

label: disgust
text: When I felt the smell of industries that pollute.

label: shame
text: When somebody I knew greeted me and started to talk with me and I didn't know, I couldn't remember who he was.

label: guilt
text: When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she didn't really do.

label: joy
text: I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M., somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours, and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach, painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.

label: fear
text: I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home terribly afraid.

label: anger
text: One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it. Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt very angry.

label: sadness
text: The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and didn't get approved.

label: disgust
text: I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at the travel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she and her friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask for silence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.

label: shame
text: I was working in I. when a friend of mine borrowed his car so I could get bach there, I had to come to S.Paulo and his car was here. He said :\When you get the car tell my mother that you are only taking the car bacause I asked, for she doesn't like me to borrow it\". Next day he borrowed me it again for I had to come back again. When I was coming back I crashed the car quite a lot. One of the first person I met at the accident was his mother, that said to me \"You weren't to take the car only yesterday ?\" (before I saw her I was already ashamed)."

label: guilt
text: I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go, I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.

text: I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with this person.

text: In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During the fight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came back next day.

label: sadness
text: Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.

label: disgust
text: In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating something so strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because I remembered the scene all the time.

label: shame
text: I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.

label: anger
text: In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between my group and the graduation commission (two students of my classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about them.

text: When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his work (he passed three months away from home).

label: disgust
text: I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that they did disturbed me very much.

label: guilt

text: When I got a small present form a person I like very much.

label: joy

label: fear
text: I was sitting on the bus coming back from school. A man from nearly forty years sat beside me. After a while I looked at him and saw that he was looking at me with opened throusers and holding his penis.

label: anger
text: My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it, and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I wasn't able to cook by myself.

label: sadness
text: When on Christmas day my grandmother died. I received the news when I was coming back from a party on the 24th at 5 am.

label: disgust
text: The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat beside me, with his trousers open and holding his penis.

text: When I went to a halloween party and had to walk through a shopping center dressed like a witch.

text: I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.

text: I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of the people who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that blame me.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or negative critic.

label: guilt
text: Yesterday I broke my sister's raio. She hears it always when she has school examinations and now she has examinations.

text: When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.

label: fear
