label: anger
text: When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, and irresponsibility of that person.

label: sadness
text: When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity, and effort weren't corresponded.

text: I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by my boyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for his falsity.

label: sadness

label: sadness

text: One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well, but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone farther.

label: anger

text: Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the first moment I felt shame, not ache.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being right dominated.

label: joy
text: When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.

label: fear
text: Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good intentions.

label: anger
text: My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not guilty. He was misled by his wife.

label: sadness
text: When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he did nothing to relieve the situation.

label: disgust
text: I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and it was moving its limbs.

label: shame
text: When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but I didn't cope with the task.

label: guilt
text: I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

label: joy
text: Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close friends of mine.

label: fear
text: I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

label: anger
text: Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be blamed. I left them without supervision.

label: sadness
text: I got separated form my closest friend. He went to work abroad.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene words.

label: shame
text: I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.

label: guilt
text: I couldn't fulfill a promise.

label: joy
text: An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long separation.

label: fear
text: I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone, it was very quiet and very dark.

label: anger
text: A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't the slightest grounds for it.

label: sadness
text: I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion after an accident.

label: disgust
text: I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.

label: shame
text: I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.

label: guilt
text: I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because I couldn't organize myself.

label: joy
text: At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

label: disgust
text: I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the facilities available for their use cause it involved her having to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her attitude.

label: shame
text: I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to myself.

label: guilt
text: I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything I could and that his progress of a \normal\" life was poor I felt guilty as if I could have done more."

label: joy
text: For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

label: fear
text: When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

label: anger
text: When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned home to find half my stuff gone.

label: sadness
text: When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

label: shame
text: I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.

label: joy
text: When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when you have someone really close to share your life with.

label: shame
text: I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill, while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I hurt my parents in one way or another.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test after three failures.

label: fear
text: When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

label: anger
text: When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do with football.

label: sadness
text: A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back home.

label: disgust
text: We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to stop using it.

label: shame
text: During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an ear-ring.

label: guilt
text: It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a present together. However, now I had bought something together with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.

label: joy
text: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

label: fear
text: Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a disco.

label: disgust
text: I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life of another by means of utterly unfair methods.

label: shame
text: I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on other people.

label: guilt
text: I stroke a person undeservedly.

label: joy
text: I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour of a competition.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.

label: anger
text: I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my colleagues.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved who had to leave for her motherland.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. This \sight\" I watched from the bus."

label: shame
text: I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after not attending his lectures.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.

label: joy
text: I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then, I felt it in my soul.

label: fear
text: I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.

label: anger
text: I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally grew into anger.

label: sadness
text: My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of the irritation.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: \Don't stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed\" I got up terrified and a thrashing followed."

label: shame
text: I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned my sister out of my parents home.

label: joy
text: That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.

label: fear
text: I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my reason.

label: anger
text: I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car because of the missing spare parts.

label: sadness
text: A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it is painful for me to remember about it.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose problems I had always shown deep understanding.

label: shame
text: I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward when I had to show what I had prepared.

label: guilt
text: Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and bad but it was too late.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend made me a proposal.

label: fear
text: I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

label: anger
text: A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning because we had business on the following day. The instructor tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite of everything, all the time he made me angry.

label: sadness
text: When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera (and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of an important felow while at the same time some young and able singers work in a quite different field of life.

label: shame
text: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.

label: guilt
text: I offended my mother.

label: joy
text: When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

label: fear
text: Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no one to help me and call First Aid.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

label: fear
text: When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come to the surface and inhale.

label: anger
text: When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be examined by good experts and she deceived me.

label: sadness
text: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see them as soon as possible.

label: disgust
text: I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself with high ranking officials.

label: shame
text: When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me \a three\" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.

label: guilt
text: When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward factors.

label: joy
text: When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something you have striven to.

label: fear
text: One fears many things, for example one fears going to the dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected with the examination session.

label: anger
text: When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have been right.

label: sadness
text: For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief when you are away from home, too.

label: anger
text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.

label: sadness
text: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

label: disgust
text: I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

label: shame
text: My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out with me only because of my defect.

label: guilt
text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.

label: joy
text: Having passed an exam.

label: fear
text: Having a car accident.

label: anger
text: I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a very good friend.

label: disgust
text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

label: shame
text: Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which he learned.

label: guilt
text: Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

label: joy
text: I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most of all when we are at a party.

label: fear
text: I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly small distance.

label: anger
text: I get angry with people who attain certain status without deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of other people.

label: sadness
text: I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could stop it - at least I think so.

label: disgust
text: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double dealers.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to answer in the presence of the patients.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I haven't done it.

label: joy
text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher Institute.

label: fear
text: I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

label: anger
text: I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving it or when someone deceives me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.

label: shame
text: When I do something unworthy.

label: guilt
text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.

label: joy
text: After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

label: fear
text: A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. I was afraid for her and for the baby.

label: anger
text: I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, naturally negative. Servility, \connections\", impudence, traits that get me mad."

label: sadness
text: My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

label: shame
text: Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

label: guilt
text: When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

label: joy
text: After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

label: fear
text: Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I might lose him.

label: anger
text: I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

label: sadness
text: We are several friends but our characters are very different and we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the \parties\" because there are conflicts to which one I should belong."

label: disgust
text: I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an awful scene, which I still remember.

label: shame
text: In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

label: guilt
text: My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is not late still.

label: joy
text: I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. Because everything turned out different from my expectations. Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the beginning of September.

label: fear
text: In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

label: anger
text: When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years of my life.

label: disgust
text: Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - it was partly having my friend there.

label: shame
text: In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit, but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

label: guilt
text: I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.

label: joy
text: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.

label: fear
text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

label: anger
text: Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my daughter.

label: sadness
text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

label: disgust
text: Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

label: shame
text: A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a \street walker\" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was falsely trying to impress with my family."

label: guilt
text: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

label: joy
text: Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They were special people to me.

label: fear
text: I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

label: anger
text: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been drinking.

label: sadness
text: My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away was very sad.

label: disgust
text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

label: shame
text: My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same way.

label: guilt
text: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while in a position of trust.

label: joy
text: When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night out in 20 years.

label: fear
text: While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - via a flooded river !

label: anger
text: A friend got angry and drove \like a lunatic\" with me and others in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving."

label: sadness
text: A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

label: disgust
text: 4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were entertaining \conservative\" relations who wanted to see the first episode."

label: shame
text: A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.

label: guilt
text: I had to leave an important function early because of family commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.

label: joy
text: I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy being alive.

label: fear
text: I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut fence.

label: anger
text: In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

label: sadness
text: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep going because it was late and I would be back in the next few days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

label: disgust
text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state and her actions.

label: shame
text: A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of confidentiality.

label: guilt
text: When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught, then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come and get me.

label: joy
text: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had thought.

label: fear
text: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

label: disgust
text: Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

label: shame
text: When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected with copying at a class-work at school.

label: guilt
text: When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

label: joy
text: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature National Olympiad.

label: fear
text: When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing him because he is so dear to me.

label: anger
text: When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and in general the best records of all the candidates.

label: sadness
text: When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I went to live in Sofia.

label: disgust
text: When, for example, someone is calumnating.

label: shame
text: When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

label: guilt
text: For example, when I have promised something but I haven't fulfilled it.

label: joy
text: Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the worst.

label: fear
text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.

label: anger
text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.

label: sadness
text: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

label: disgust
text: I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

label: shame
text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.

label: guilt
text: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.

label: joy
text: Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction from the realization of one's desires and aims.

label: fear
text: Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping from under my feet.

label: anger
text: Attitude to some manners of dealing and some \sanctioned\" relations."

label: sadness
text: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent as they are when you are young.

label: disgust
text: Attitude to a related family.

label: shame
text: Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation of these circumstances.

label: guilt
text: Low evaluation of other people's cares.

label: joy
text: I won a sport contest.

label: fear
text: If a close relative's life is in danger.

label: anger
text: A close person lied to me.

label: sadness
text: Getting separated from my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: Encouter with a prostitute.

label: shame
text: A theft committed by me.

label: guilt
text: Lack of respect for my parents.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: fear
text: Before an examination.

label: anger
text: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: After the loss of a close relative.

label: disgust
text: When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

label: shame
text: I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling of shame.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to convey an important announcement.

label: joy
text: Meeting a loved man.

label: fear
text: I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow light.

label: anger
text: At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment of one's personality.

label: sadness
text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.

label: disgust
text: At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

label: shame
text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I respect.

label: guilt
text: When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of yours and you are at the bottom of it.

label: joy
text: I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of them.

label: fear
text: This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

label: anger
text: Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives were brought to my knowledge later.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - friends who I love and respect.

label: disgust
text: Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the food or when watching the way some people eat.

label: shame
text: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.

label: guilt
text: Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to me, of the unknown.

label: anger
text: In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory which he himself had never known. His information was from fortuitous sources.

label: sadness
text: Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I was crying.

label: disgust
text: I saw in the street a man spitting.

label: shame
text: I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself, I started to talk imitating him.

label: guilt
text: Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

label: joy
text: When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a half.

label: anger
text: I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a form.

label: sadness
text: When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

label: disgust
text: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, lied to me.

label: shame
text: I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethically and without understanding the problems of the man I love.

label: guilt
text: When I offend somebody unfairly.

label: joy
text: A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

label: fear
text: One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I felt it a very near and possible event.

label: anger
text: Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I was the witness of, caused anger in me.

label: sadness
text: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the elementary human norms.

label: shame
text: I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

label: guilt
text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of guilt.

label: joy
text: When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

label: fear
text: I broke my knee when I was skiing over \Yastrebetz\" (a racing track in a Bulgarian winter resort)."

label: anger
text: The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL (A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

label: sadness
text: My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was quite strong.

label: disgust
text: A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a scholarship for an excellent grade.

label: shame
text: I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

label: guilt
text: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of amidophen.

label: joy
text: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for \a master of sports\"."

label: fear
text: I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed towards the precipice along the road.

label: anger
text: When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because of indifference or cowardice.

label: sadness
text: When I left a man in whom I really believed.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with drunk people.

label: shame
text: When I try to lie.

label: guilt
text: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity better but I had not done it because of reluctance or carelessness.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: When I broke my leg I felt fear.

label: anger
text: When someone lies to me.

label: sadness
text: At an unjust insult or injure.

label: disgust
text: From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I am in a restaurant.

label: shame
text: When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.

label: guilt
text: When I don't fulfill my obligations.

label: joy
text: When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

label: fear
text: In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with us.

label: anger
text: It was quite recently, at the football match between the national teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish referee who ran the match quite partially.

label: sadness
text: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and which I had listened before together with friends.

label: disgust
text: A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

label: shame
text: I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and respected.

label: guilt
text: In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

label: joy
text: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in the children Assembly.

label: fear
text: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock someone knocked violently on the door.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he didn't come.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present one with whom things are not much of a success.

label: disgust
text: Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend then over me.

label: shame
text: I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

label: guilt
text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of mine.

label: joy
text: Bulgaria won a football match against France.

label: fear
text: I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.

label: anger
text: I was neglected undeservedly.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.

label: shame
text: I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.

label: guilt
text: I didn't attend lectures.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

label: fear
text: The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be in order.

label: anger
text: About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

label: sadness
text: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in the tram.

label: shame
text: Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits of a good driver.

label: guilt
text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

label: joy
text: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

label: fear
text: A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his behavior.

label: anger
text: When I encountered not only with my father's lack of understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be right are concerned.

label: sadness
text: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in which the children were involved as accusers of one of the parents.

label: shame
text: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

label: guilt
text: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty days.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

label: anger
text: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.

label: fear
text: A fear of lack of personal powers.

label: anger
text: At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is not treated decently.

label: sadness
text: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).

label: disgust
text: At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and mostly at a philistinism.

label: shame
text: At a weakness on my part.

label: guilt
text: When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to interrupt my studies.

label: anger
text: I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.

label: sadness
text: At a prolonged separation with my family.

label: disgust
text: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of a rat.

label: shame
text: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.

label: guilt
text: I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped me for everything.

label: joy
text: The day when my son said for the first time \mummy\"."

label: fear
text: Before an exam in logics.

label: anger
text: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my anger.

label: sadness
text: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers having walks with their children.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to my norms of behaviour.

label: shame
text: I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our national holiday as a servant.

label: guilt
text: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

label: joy
text: The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's out of me.

label: fear
text: I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

label: anger
text: A honest \sliding\" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books."

label: sadness
text: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial \explanation\"."

label: disgust
text: A lie on the part of a person close to me.

label: shame
text: I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.

label: guilt
text: I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.

label: joy
text: My son was born.

label: fear
text: I had a car accident.

label: anger
text: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

label: sadness
text: I lost a close friend.

label: disgust
text: I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. After the film I felt disgust.

label: shame
text: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.

label: guilt
text: I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My friend relied on them.

label: joy
text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I passed my last exam.

label: fear
text: Before going to the dentist.

label: anger
text: When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological investigation and then I got really angry.

label: sadness
text: When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but I am alone.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. \Tried\" because it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not competent and cultured."

label: shame
text: I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who deserves high respect.

label: guilt
text: We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up the idea.

label: joy
text: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often happenes.

label: fear
text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

label: anger
text: I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.

label: sadness
text: It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

label: disgust
text: I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like normal people.

label: shame
text: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant professor whom I highly respect.

label: guilt
text: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the whole night.

label: joy
text: I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love with me.

label: fear
text: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

label: anger
text: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent words.

label: sadness
text: When my dog was stolen.

label: disgust
text: I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very loudly and threatened that with \connections\" she will expel me from the inst."

label: shame
text: I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a foreign language.

label: guilt
text: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame bacause with her it is a stress disease.

label: joy
text: When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

label: fear
text: One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody took it seriously but I got frightened.

label: anger
text: I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently and immorally

label: sadness
text: When I failed at the first entrance exam.

label: disgust
text: The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

label: shame
text: Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.

label: joy
text: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in our fate.

label: fear
text: Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked in me many negative emotions.

label: anger
text: I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

label: sadness
text: Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my general impression from severl situations which evoked this feeling in me.

label: disgust
text: I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can happen in this world.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and sister, and with me too.

label: guilt
text: I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of trouble.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student.

label: fear
text: I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not serious and I need not worry.

label: anger
text: With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

label: sadness
text: For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when I don't see her even for two or three days.

label: disgust
text: For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

label: shame
text: I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I rarely become ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my mother's presence.

label: joy
text: I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve the pains of a patient.

label: fear
text: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw another one, as if out of control of the driver.

label: anger
text: I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she kept on telling lies.

label: sadness
text: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

label: disgust
text: I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

label: guilt
text: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.

label: joy
text: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

label: fear
text: Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me afraid.

label: anger
text: When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a person I loved very much.

label: disgust
text: Deception from a person I loved very much.

label: shame
text: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but she didn't stop me.

label: guilt
text: The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary examination.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted as a student in medicine.

label: fear
text: I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on the terrace of the flat.

label: anger
text: I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for the term examinations.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither his fault nor mine.

label: disgust
text: I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words at a man without any reason whatsoever.

label: shame
text: At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp remark.

label: guilt
text: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still haven't had time to see her.

label: joy
text: When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me alone for a few years.

label: fear
text: I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of hours.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago I was disgusted with the \cleanness\" of the refectory of our institute."

label: shame
text: We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium (the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole town !

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many people about my applying for this institute and I decided to prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

label: fear
text: Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness (and so it is now).

label: anger
text: A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and threatened me.

label: sadness
text: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now I remember about it quite often.

label: disgust
text: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

label: guilt
text: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more than that and I put down \very good\" for fear of being scolded. Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for what I had done."

label: joy
text: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general one).

label: fear
text: I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it rolled by and hit me.

label: anger
text: My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old he was (79).

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we had to get separated again.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

label: shame
text: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I couldn't answer.

label: guilt
text: I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.

label: joy
text: I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.

label: fear
text: I had worries about a certain illness.

label: anger
text: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that it was done by a \good\" acquaintance of mine."

label: sadness
text: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him understand I felt miserable.

label: disgust
text: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if nothing had happened.

label: shame
text: I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.

label: guilt
text: I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I said I had not passed my last exam.

label: joy
text: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry examination.

label: fear
text: This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

label: anger
text: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, the pedology lecturer was the cause.

label: sadness
text: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car accident.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

label: guilt
text: The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

label: joy
text: I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at the Higher Agricultural Institute.

label: fear
text: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue duty as a soldier.

label: anger
text: When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

label: shame
text: Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.

label: guilt
text: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.

label: joy
text: After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he feels glad.

label: fear
text: Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance examinations.

label: anger
text: I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

label: sadness
text: When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of childhood.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.

label: guilt
text: I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days later he died.

label: joy
text: I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

label: fear
text: Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

label: anger
text: It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned out that there was no audience at all because everyone had pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got furious.

label: sadness
text: When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

label: disgust
text: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was quite  disappointed and disgusted.

label: shame
text: During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he didn't deserve it.

label: guilt
text: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I felt guilty before her.

label: joy
text: When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now my girlfriend).

label: fear
text: I fear before each exam.

label: anger
text: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.

label: sadness
text: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.

label: disgust
text: When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

label: shame
text: When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I burned with shame then.

label: guilt
text: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a man. But it remained undone.

label: joy
text: I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in February.

label: fear
text: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. I felt fear of what could have happened.

label: anger
text: I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

label: sadness
text: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think I can call it so.

label: disgust
text: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

label: shame
text: Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said and done on the night before.

label: guilt
text: Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents when I remembered how much they had done for me.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I could not feel it at all.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the events that were taking place there.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it was quite shameful.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived them.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it impossible that had driven the car.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural Institute.

label: fear
text: I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

label: anger
text: That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal marks.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something had irrevocably gone away from me.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class with her in our first year.

label: shame
text: That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was cought.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

label: joy
text: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

label: fear
text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

label: anger
text: I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I had got at the entrance examination.á

label: sadness
text: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my home town.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love in an abominable way.

label: shame
text: I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left them to the mercy of fate.

label: guilt
text: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have to tell them I have failed an exam.

label: joy
text: Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second birthday.

label: fear
text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

label: anger
text: A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced this feeling when I tried to chase her out.

label: sadness
text: After my father's death.

label: disgust
text: With an alcoholic.

label: shame
text: Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there and I felt quite awkward.

label: guilt
text: Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was directly involved in it.

label: joy
text: I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for a long period, my father came back home.

label: fear
text: I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left alone in this unfamiliar country.

label: anger
text: I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and anger.

label: sadness
text: When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

label: disgust
text: During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the world woman.

label: shame
text: When I first had a sexual intercourse.

label: guilt
text: I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set quite involuntarily.

label: joy
text: When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a kindergarten.

label: fear
text: When I first sat for an entrance examination.

label: anger
text: When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite undeservedly.

label: sadness
text: When I got separated from my first love.

label: disgust
text: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated physically me and my mother.

label: shame
text: When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the materials out she turned round and saw me.

label: guilt
text: When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.

label: joy
text: Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.

label: fear
text: Watching a horror movie with friends.

label: anger
text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

label: sadness
text: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well as her family etc.

label: disgust
text: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being deceitful, unfair, etc.

label: shame
text: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in effect lowering myself to their level.

label: guilt
text: Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

label: joy
text: Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

label: fear
text: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

label: anger
text: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he knows needs doing.

label: sadness
text: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother who had passed away about a month ago.

label: disgust
text: With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

label: shame
text: When I found a letter addressed \To Mum\" by my son, 6 months later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up after wearing them for the first time."

label: guilt
text: When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had discussed and I had to be one better.

label: joy
text: Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

label: fear
text: I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings despite my own being hurt in the process.

label: anger
text: In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a reflection of my own shortcomings.

label: sadness
text: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I went into the role of a performing clown.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. Especially in learning another language.

label: shame
text: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as I am.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this emotion)

label: joy
text: When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last 3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for Council.

label: fear
text: A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied intensely - once in the examiners room \I blew it\" -  I was so nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I got only blankness."

label: anger
text: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, and taking 3 University exams part time).

label: sadness
text: When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust saddned me.

label: disgust
text: People who came to our home - and requested \Put out your smoke\". That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to the situation."

label: shame
text: Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family friends dinner. Told \Not to Speak\". The attitude by him was negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range of experiences. Probably greater than he."

label: guilt
text: Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental rest. Staff on your return query your \sickness\" - it is easier in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons etc."

label: joy
text: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

label: fear
text: A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a small Lazer).

label: anger
text: A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December last year.

label: sadness
text: My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - \Lord Grey\" died in his sleep - His death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought."

label: disgust
text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

label: shame
text: I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not accept my Visa !

label: guilt
text: When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

label: joy
text: When my daughter was born.

label: fear
text: When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

label: anger
text: When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the time.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

label: disgust
text: When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with a rugby tour of South Africa.

label: shame
text: When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous language of Maori at an important function where I was the only woman in the group and it was expected of me.

label: guilt
text: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important family occasion that I should not have missed.

label: joy
text: Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the \paper work\" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming through the customs gate."

label: fear
text: I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days until we had left the district.

label: anger
text: My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the preceding week.

label: sadness
text: I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I wouldn't see many of them again.

label: fear
text: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and continue my studies.

label: anger
text: This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so much over unimportant trivial matters.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes me feel really sad.

label: disgust
text: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting themselves with no shame or embarassment.

label: shame
text: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was only \the thing to do\", and not really an act of love."

label: guilt
text: This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I (being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for myself and my future.

label: joy
text: My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along too.

label: fear
text: My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are perhaps dead.

label: anger
text: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

label: sadness
