text: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially my family - forever.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: guilt
text: I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had given me.

label: joy
text: Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for pharmacy completed.

label: fear
text: When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night because he thought I could dance with my friends who were friendly.

label: sadness
text: When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he diagnosed it.

label: disgust
text: My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me verbally.

label: shame
text: I found I was pregnant and unmarried.

label: guilt
text: When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to Catholicism but then once received - o.k.

label: joy
text: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process which have been going on for centuries.

label: fear
text: I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.

label: anger
text: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

label: sadness
text: This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our relationship due to some circumstances between her and her family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I thought about what had happened.

label: disgust
text: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do things stupidly and unjustly.

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: guilt
text: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.

label: joy
text: Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.

label: fear
text: Had fear of losing husband.

label: anger
text: When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future daughter-in-law.

label: sadness
text: When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

label: disgust
text: Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

label: shame
text: When ditched - divorced by husband.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a group.

label: joy
text: My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she asked me.

label: fear
text: That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted at 14.

label: anger
text: (1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he should be dead and not my father.

label: sadness
text: My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two days after.

label: disgust
text: A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and the stepfather disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my, what I call real name.

label: guilt
text: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

label: joy
text: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.

label: fear
text: When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

label: anger
text: When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman friend of mine in public.

label: sadness
text: After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

label: disgust
text: When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of mine.

label: shame
text: When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work expected of me was not going to be in.

label: guilt
text: When I masturbated in my room.

label: joy
text: When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.

label: fear
text: My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to die, it was just too much.

label: anger
text: My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

label: sadness
text: The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, hitch-hiking to work.

label: disgust
text: With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South Africa.

label: shame
text: That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with priviledge. Not using it positively.

label: guilt
text: When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought, NOW I would not have done it.

label: joy
text: A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the time for an informal \greeting\" in the church service. She said a few words."

label: fear
text: I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc, thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

label: anger
text: Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

label: sadness
text: Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

label: disgust
text: Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

label: shame
text: I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost taking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I should not.

label: guilt
text: I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard and didn't previously know about I suspect.

label: joy
text: My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it was really good - though really insane conversation.

label: fear
text: Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

label: anger
text: I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful message.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be sitting in the \lliving\" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't."

label: anger
text: When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

label: sadness
text: When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal feelings and then days later changed her mind.

label: disgust
text: When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

label: shame
text: While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal space to a large extent.

label: guilt
text: While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and someone elses in a minor way.

label: joy
text: Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in contact again.

label: fear
text: Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my parents.

label: anger
text: That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and the person that did it got away without any punishment from the law.

label: sadness
text: The death of an animal we had reared.

label: disgust
text: Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been seeing many others during our relationship.

label: shame
text: Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident where family car received minor damage.

label: guilt
text: Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly the use of another person.

label: joy
text: The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total enlightenment and freedome - bliss.

label: fear
text: Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by smouldering wood and flame.

label: anger
text: When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close - I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.

label: sadness
text: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - no one else there to do it.

label: disgust
text: When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had changed.

label: shame
text: When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat out of the bag.

label: guilt
text: Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close personal relationship.

label: joy
text: First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved emotionally.

label: fear
text: Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were drunk.

label: anger
text: Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the deliberation not the provocation.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship which at the time seemed doomed to fail.

label: disgust
text: A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

label: shame
text: Cannot recall the emotion with any force.

label: guilt
text: Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

label: joy
text: Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the last five years of my life.

label: fear
text: When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial insecurity.

label: anger
text: When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my anger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able to live up to my own expectations.

label: sadness
text: Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

label: disgust
text: I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to keep the peace.

label: shame
text: My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at largely using this sexual partner.

label: guilt
text: When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had of me !

label: joy
text: Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

label: fear
text: Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.

label: anger
text: Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

label: sadness
text: Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 others.

label: disgust
text: Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law reform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).

label: shame
text: Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.

label: guilt
text: Adolescent guilt growing up feeling \bad, immoral\" sexual desires, some 10yrs ago."

label: joy
text: Won a prize for effort.

label: fear
text: Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

label: anger
text: I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly disregarded.

label: sadness
text: Death of brother.

label: disgust
text: Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.

label: guilt
text: I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

label: joy
text: I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A guy called and said, in effect, that I was \nice\" and he liked me. Hence the emotional joy."

label: fear
text: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre that was almost empty.

label: anger
text: My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to really hurt her.

label: sadness
text: My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.

label: disgust
text: My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

label: shame
text: My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of, macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we were talking.

label: guilt
text: I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use it. She never found out.

label: joy
text: Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other friends.

label: fear
text: Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the airport, then board the plane alone.

label: anger
text: At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve when on a class trip overseas.

label: sadness
text: I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never be able to row again.

label: disgust
text: Our boarder burping after meals !

label: shame
text: Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.

label: guilt
text: Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had given her no attention.

label: joy
text: When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman games when I was eleven.

label: fear
text: When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

label: anger
text: Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my family.

label: sadness
text: When my mother died.

label: disgust
text: When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.

label: shame
text: When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not act very responsibly and one of them was injured.

label: guilt
text: When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had happened (my sister).

label: joy
text: Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.

label: fear
text: Haven't been frightened for ages.

label: anger
text: I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.

label: disgust
text: Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.

label: shame
text: Haven't felt shame for ages.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and returned them.

label: joy
text: Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.

label: fear
text: Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

label: anger
text: At work being shifted to another area.

label: sadness
text: Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain papers.

label: disgust
text: Noticing my flat had maggotts !

label: shame
text: A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible for (patient lived, no complications fortunately).

label: guilt
text: Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.

label: joy
text: When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).

label: fear
text: When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

label: anger
text: Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of traffic lights.

label: sadness
text: When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I was unable to see this person because of the situation.

label: disgust
text: When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no apparent reason.

label: shame
text: When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather embarassing situation from my past.

label: guilt
text: When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.

label: joy
text: At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging that fact to members of family and friends.

label: fear
text: As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned for guilt.

label: anger
text: Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no dinner prepared as I had expected.

label: sadness
text: At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred during university examinations and therefore I was unable to attend her funeral.

label: disgust
text: With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos pertaining to sex.

label: shame
text: Cannot remember such a situation.

label: guilt
text: Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to structure.

label: joy
text: Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.

label: fear
text: Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.

label: anger
text: Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend the entire evening.

label: sadness
text: On rising. No apparent reason.

label: disgust
text: Prolonged \niggling\" of friend on a single theme which I considered of no consequence."

label: shame
text: Felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted the problems I'd caused.

label: guilt
text: Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast. I felt guilty - \he's just done all that work for me\"."

label: joy
text: When my first niece was born.

label: fear
text: In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

label: anger
text: When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

label: disgust
text: Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

label: shame
text: Stealing money from my parents when I was young.

label: guilt
text: Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).

label: joy
text: When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank and danced.

label: fear
text: Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.

label: sadness
text: My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

label: disgust
text: I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the gutter, in broad daylight.

label: shame
text: I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoying me. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he was going to die.

label: guilt
text: I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my exams.

label: joy
text: Birth of children.

label: fear
text: Being alone at night.

label: anger
text: In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.

label: sadness
text: When grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: Obscene phone calls.

label: shame
text: Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the present point in time in outrageous activity.

label: guilt
text: Telling white lies.

label: joy
text: Thought had discovered true love.

label: fear
text: Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to go until light changed. When green I took off.

label: anger
text: When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

label: sadness
text: Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. Farewell scene at airport.

label: disgust
text: When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

label: shame
text: When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents also informed.

label: guilt
text: When caught shop-lifting as for shame.

label: joy
text: Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had previously wished to understand better.

label: fear
text: To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear delayed me acting to do this.

label: anger
text: Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties because of television watching.

label: sadness
text: Watching suffering in Third World country.

label: disgust
text: Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business managers to their actions esp.

label: shame
text: On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexual exploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even for sexual motives.

label: guilt
text: Telling a lie to wife over phone about what I had been working at.

label: joy
text: Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed terribly.

label: fear
text: Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

label: anger
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: sadness
text: My cat died painfully and slowly.

label: disgust
text: Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - disgusted by his implications.

label: shame
text: Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having done it and knowing that they knew.

label: guilt
text: Two-timing - going out with person other than guy I was in relationship with.

label: joy
text: I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We are very close sisters.

label: fear
text: I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and I thought I was lost and was going to panic.

label: anger
text: My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my friends were attending.

label: sadness
text: While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.

label: disgust
text: At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with a guy she knows I really like.

label: shame
text: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of members of my peer group while still at school.

label: guilt
text: Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and hoped the first person never found out.

label: joy
text: When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously met.

label: fear
text: When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an audiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.

label: anger
text: In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of view is completely disregarded.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely person and I did not have the means for his company.

label: disgust
text: I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.

label: shame
text: The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.

label: guilt
text: The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where we were staying.

label: joy
text: When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.

label: fear
text: When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

label: anger
text: When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for workers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towards me - I felt I did not deserve this.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might one day reconcile.

label: disgust
text: When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.

label: shame
text: When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg - causing great pain, and for me, severe embarassment at my own ineptitude, and shame that another person suffered as a result.

label: guilt
text: When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And I was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not to take her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a result, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, by not being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

label: joy
text: I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck and it was a real adventure.

label: fear
text: A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 nights.

label: anger
text: I \cooked\" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the huge row which developed."

label: sadness
text: This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was \TRUE LOVE\" !!"

label: disgust
text: I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.

label: shame
text: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which 15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol, marijuana and contraceptives !

label: guilt
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: joy
text: A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.

label: fear
text: Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was heading.

label: anger
text: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing and went out with him herself.

label: sadness
text: I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said they carried diseases.

label: disgust
text: A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my friend by feeling my parts.

label: shame
text: I told my primary teacher I hadn't done my homework as my mother was in a car accident. My teacher rang that night to see how my mother was - she was fine i.e. no accident !

label: guilt
text: I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are my parents. As the relationship developed I found it harder and harder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship. He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.

label: joy
text: Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks. (Running Race).

label: fear
text: When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).

label: anger
text: When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

label: sadness
text: When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive, but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

label: disgust
text: When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

label: shame
text: When I had come home drunk the day after a party, I felt very ashamed in front of my parents.

label: guilt
text: When I crashed by bike into an old lady crossing a road and knocked her down.

label: joy
text: Listening to the opening bars of Tchaikovsdy's symphony No.2 fourth movement at my sister's wedding.

label: fear
text: As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.

label: anger
text: As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

label: sadness
text: A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally graphic. B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima calling for her mother.

label: disgust
text: The repression of rioting and non-rioting \Blacks\" in South Africa by the police of that \"Democracy\"."

label: shame
text: Breaking an implicit promise.

label: guilt
text: At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky would like this).

label: joy
text: Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband for 3 months.

label: fear
text: I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed one night by myself in the house.

label: anger
text: Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of my friends.

label: sadness
text: My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months in hospital.

label: disgust
text: My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another close friend of mine.

label: shame
text: Sleeping with a girl on a Saturday night and then not contacting her in later days.

label: guilt
text: Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the family when visiting.

label: joy
text: Talking with someone I admire a lot.

label: fear
text: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

label: anger
text: Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money stolen.

label: sadness
text: Caused a family disturbance.

label: disgust
text: Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.

label: shame
text: When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.

label: guilt
text: Beating my brother up.

label: joy
text: I was \best man\" at my brother's wedding a year ago."

label: fear
text: Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

label: anger
text: I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land held by our family - ours is the 5th generation. A \democratic\" decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves."

label: sadness
text: Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told the group around us of advances I had made.

label: disgust
text: A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the accident.

label: shame
text: My father died 4 years ago, 18 months after my mother died. I feld my sister was responsible for his death, in that she \hadn't loved him\". I felt ashamed for myself, and for my family."

label: guilt
text: My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractor pulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respect me.

label: joy
text: Hearing my girlfriend accept my offer of marriage.

label: fear
text: Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

label: anger
text: Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the telephone.

label: sadness
text: Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.

label: disgust
text: Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men committing various acts.

label: shame
text: Being caught by parents in a compromising situation with girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while I was babysitting.

label: joy
text: When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.

label: fear
text: Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the motorway on my motorcycle.

label: anger
text: When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

label: sadness
text: A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had hoped to go out with her soon.

label: disgust
text: I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who wanted to talk to me.

label: shame
text: I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends to have a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with each other.

label: guilt
text: Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when it had to be done.

label: joy
text: When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpecting it and I was so happy.

label: fear
text: I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was really frightening and it made me stop and think about the world around me and what it is really like out there. I was frightened all that night.

label: anger
text: When my flatmate put me down because she \thought\" she was better than me, or she felt she was."

label: sadness
text: When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a relative she had no relatives in N.Z.

label: disgust
text: One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.

label: shame
text: When I let my girlfriend use my essay to help her to write hers and the tutor found them alike.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie to my boyfriend so that he wouldn't suspect I'd bought him a xmas present as expensive as I had.

label: joy
text: I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

label: fear
text: I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town) when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road and hurried home.

label: anger
text: I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

label: sadness
text: At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

label: disgust
text: I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to use them for fighting purposes.

label: shame
text: I was amongst a group of people talking about how the Maori people were stirrers and causing trouble in our country. I felt shame to be a pakeha when other pakehas had such narrow conservative views.

label: guilt
text: I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the beach - on the way I got a puncture.

label: joy
text: Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from boarding school on accrediting leave.

label: fear
text: Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

label: anger
text: When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements on him.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's funeral - My grandparents virtually raised me as my mother was a solo-parent and had to work.

label: disgust
text: Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.

label: shame
text: I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

label: guilt
text: I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.

label: joy
text: The birth of my first child.

label: fear
text: A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite fortunately).

label: anger
text: Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of South Africa to play rugby in that country.

label: sadness
text: When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother that is).

label: disgust
text: When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the university. Due to students own lack of concern for the environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea and coffee left everywhere.

label: shame
text: When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

label: guilt
text: When my husband discovered I was having an affair with another man.

label: joy
text: I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night together.

label: fear
text: I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was afraid.

label: anger
text: In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions as negative. We however only posed several questions which she couldn't answer.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the funeral: I sat on the table and cried.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).

label: shame
text: Once in a public ladies room, I opened the door of a cubicle that was taken, although it was not locked.

label: guilt
text: In a playground I was playing at the seesaw with a little niece. I wanted to stop but nobody came to help me. When I got off, all alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt above her eye. Now there is a scar.

label: joy
text: When passing the final examinations for social worker.

label: fear
text: Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no good.

label: anger
text: A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair, he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.

label: sadness
text: When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.

label: disgust
text: A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some fellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I felt myself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.

label: shame
text: Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I broke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.

label: guilt
text: I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

label: joy
text: A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go on holiday.

label: fear
text: At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined creepy men sneaking into our house.

label: anger
text: The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that made me angry.

label: sadness
text: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

label: shame
text: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the fright and because I was nervous.

label: guilt
text: My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this because she always talks negatively about the same people whatever I do it doesn't help.

label: joy
text: At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.

label: fear
text: I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the elevator at our university.

label: anger
text: When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to listen to me.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.

label: disgust
text: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better than she is.

label: shame
text: When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question so that everyone starts to laugh.

label: guilt
text: I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew that my moving was an important reason for this.

label: joy
text: I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I have done things good in relation to other people especially when my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved him very much.

label: anger
text: A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was very angry about that.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

label: disgust
text: I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in vicinity.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for myself and the others.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love with him while I had a close boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.

label: fear
text: When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

label: anger
text: When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother in confindence.

label: sadness
text: Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my friend was.

label: disgust
text: When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about the killing of cows.

label: shame
text: When I made an end on a relationship after three years.

label: guilt
text: That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to persuade him.

label: joy
text: When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very good and we were very satisfied.

label: fear
text: When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was afraid he would kill him.

label: anger
text: I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.

label: sadness
text: Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.

label: disgust
text: A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their clothes and their way of doing.

label: shame
text: During carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dance because I am rigid in my moving around during a dance, I stopped very soon.

label: guilt
text: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little tension which became worse.

label: joy
text: At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

label: fear
text: When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we were on a camping.

label: anger
text: I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other person didn't appear.

label: fear
text: When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult operation.

label: anger
text: When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged to go out together.

label: sadness
text: When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

label: disgust
text: When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.

label: shame
text: At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a bag spread all around while I was going through the metal detector.

label: guilt
text: When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stopped working.

label: joy
text: When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final of the Europe Cup at Athens.

label: fear
text: On the scenic railway at the fairground.

label: anger
text: At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

label: disgust
text: When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.

label: joy
text: The day I finished my military service.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for several minutes.

label: anger
text: One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

label: sadness
text: The day I left my first girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the figs were full of worms.

label: shame
text: When I got my fingers stuck in one of the side holes of the door, in the tube.

label: guilt
text: I ran over my dog with a bicycle when I was carrying him tied to the handle bar.

label: joy
text: When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

label: fear
text: I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and I had to intervene with some risk.

label: anger
text: An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to spend spare time were disapproved.

label: sadness
text: I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.

label: disgust
text: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

label: shame
text: A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.

label: guilt
text: I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.

label: joy
text: When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

label: fear
text: Before I had a tooth pulled out.  I was very upset and ill.

label: anger
text: When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the U.E.F.A cup.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One morning I found it dead.

label: disgust
text: On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and started to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.

label: shame
text: I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybody started looking at me.

label: guilt
text: When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer any question, I doubted whether I would pass the exam  or not.

label: joy
text: When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people and close friends.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the Netherlands.

label: shame
text: I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took out his chair I knocked down my own glass.

label: guilt
text: My mother always took my side. That brought about quarrels with my father. I knew she didn't like that and I felt very sorry for that.

label: joy
text: When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the study for speech therapy.

label: fear
text: Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who accompanied us.

label: anger
text: We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.

label: sadness
text: I partly colored my hair black. My mother didn't like it and reproached me to be a \subversive element\". Later on she stated that this was due to my friends. As I see it, this all resulted from colouring my hair."

label: disgust
text: I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat it.

label: shame
text: I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the secretary again should see me.

label: guilt
text: I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy. When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.

label: joy
text: It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during an examination of personality while I thought I performed very badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

label: fear
text: My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was scared to death.

label: anger
text: My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I couldn't play them again.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours were terrible.

label: disgust
text: When I watched TV and saw a performance of \Prince\" (a popidol). Disgusting he'd better be a stallion."

label: shame
text: We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got drunk I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt so tense (studied too hard for an examination).

label: joy
text: Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

label: fear
text: I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the sense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet, the fear makes me feel dizzy.

label: anger
text: If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

label: sadness
text: I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

label: disgust
text: Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

label: shame
text: When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.

label: guilt
text: When my father (physically handicapped) asks me to do something and I raise several objections. Often I can fix it in few moments.

label: joy
text: When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our holiday together.

label: fear
text: When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I realized it too late.

label: anger
text: Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had happened.

label: sadness
text: When my last relation broke up.

label: disgust
text: When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the washing.

label: shame
text: When I forgot the birthday of my best friend and I innocently came to visit her one week later.

label: guilt
text: When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However I know that she loves me.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

label: fear
text: I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very romantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with the lights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.

label: anger
text: I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of them cut up some material I flared up.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk and she can hardly talk.

label: disgust
text: I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.

label: shame
text: I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend not to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she got informed about it. I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My parents appreciate very much me and my boyfriend coming and have dinner with them at Christmas. However we decided to visit his parents. My mother was rather disappointed.

label: joy
text: When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in love already some time ago.

label: fear
text: Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a \cold\" film). I do not know the reason."

label: anger
text: I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

label: sadness
text: My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and suffered an aphasia.

label: disgust
text: Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and torture.

label: shame
text: I wrote a letter to my father to ventilate my bottled up feelings. Afterwards I thought it was too negative.

label: guilt
text: I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.

label: joy
text: I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to move up to the second year course.

label: fear
text: On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran away fast.

label: anger
text: I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared everything and all this was finished.

label: disgust
text: I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a little cup. There was a thick white \wad\" in it. I tried to take it out and throw it in the sink."

label: shame
text: When I was 10 years old I stained our bench with a fountain-pen, I tried to twin the cushions, but then there were colour nuances. Then my mother catched me, she saw it and became very angry.

label: guilt
text: I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell him that.

label: joy
text: I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

label: fear
text: I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On a very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked at what time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoiding answer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.

label: anger
text: I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion) nonsens reason.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied that he loved that girl more than he loved me.

label: disgust
text: On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty international. There I read (for the first time) a description of the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.

label: shame
text: A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure whether she saw it or not.

label: guilt
text: When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it myself.

label: joy
text: When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, but it appeard that we both had passed.

label: fear
text: When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked me and threatened me.

label: anger
text: When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was also very sad) \Oh, how I hated him\"."

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.

label: disgust
text: A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with their class. When they were back home I heard people tell \strange\" stories about my friend and that girlfriend."

label: shame
text: When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical insight.

label: guilt
text: Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently were hit by our father).

label: joy
text: Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

label: fear
text: When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was very heavy weather then.

label: anger
text: A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

label: sadness
text: The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

label: disgust
text: When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to stories about torturing people or animals.

label: shame
text: Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain person, while that person is standing besides you and hears everything.

label: guilt
text: I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was pregnant.

label: fear
text: Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.

label: anger
text: When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

label: sadness
text: When a friend died.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler and his adepts).

label: shame
text: When I embarrassed a friend by asking him aloud if a certain person was \the source of gossip\" he told me about, while that person was also present."

label: guilt
text: When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love with me, rather bluntly four times.

label: joy
text: Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of Nijmegen) for a while.

label: fear
text: Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid to be left alone and that I could not manage it.

label: anger
text: When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel for one year.

label: disgust
text: I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

label: shame
text: I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and lies.

label: guilt
text: After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were \inflated\" enormously."

label: joy
text: A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means a draw.

label: fear
text: In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

label: anger
text: While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

label: sadness
text: I was together with my family one night, a few days after my father had died, during that conversation I expressed my displeasure because nobody understands me.

label: disgust
text: Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War II.

label: shame
text: I was jerking me off in my bedroom, when suddenly, my mother came in. She looked at me and immediately left the room.

label: guilt
text: My girlfriend and I agreed to go to the cinema. However I completely forgot our appointment. I remembered it two hours too late when I went to visit her.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a period in which he felt very depressive.

label: fear
text: I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was very quiet. Then a man approached me and said \Hello\"."

label: anger
text: When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

label: sadness
text: When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started using them again.á

label: disgust
text: In a disco, there was a dirty little chap who punched my bottom.

label: anger
text: When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee and I refuse to give him this.

label: sadness
text: Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV together.

label: disgust
text: Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.

label: shame
text: Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because I needed it myself.

label: guilt
text: When I tell someone no. In other words when I refuse to do something although I could have helped him.

label: joy
text: When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.

label: fear
text: One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who tried to molest me.

label: anger
text: My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my birthday he forgot he promised this to me.

label: sadness
text: A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).

label: disgust
text: I read a book about torture. The book described exactly how the torturing was done.

label: shame
text: I made a joke about the rat of a boy. I compared his rat with a sausage. I told the boy he had a delicious sausage.

label: guilt
text: After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy was very sad about this.

label: joy
text: I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.

label: fear
text: I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to our relation.

label: anger
text: My bicycle was demolished.

label: sadness
text: During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and other family members crying.

label: disgust
text: A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be a slimy fellow towards a professor.

label: shame
text: My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my friends.

label: guilt
text: I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the presence of my friends.

label: joy
text: This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact a few years ago.

label: fear
text: I was raped by a friend.

label: anger
text: Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking only about himself.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing several things. So we don't see each other often.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic Hospital, then he died.

label: disgust
text: Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation. He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he had achieved this position.

label: shame
text: After having failed my driving test.

label: guilt
text: When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.

label: joy
text: I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

label: fear
text: Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. He said to me \Hello darling\" I was terrified and imagined the wildest scenes."

label: anger
text: My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become very angry.

label: sadness
text: When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing our relationship.

label: disgust
text: When I read about or think about environmental pollution, the armor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind is bad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature and mankind.

label: shame
text: When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.

label: guilt
text: I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boy although it was finished already 3 months before. That person seriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then I felt very miserable because I had told lies.

label: joy
text: A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).

label: fear
text: As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have never been so anxious and fearful.

label: anger
text: When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, which my father also adheres.

label: sadness
text: I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no work, only loneliness.

label: disgust
text: It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently occurring cause may be described as \the self-assured dullness\"."

label: shame
text: Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he lived (I succeeded).

label: guilt
text: In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I didn't have any more money.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

label: fear
text: When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong. Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.

label: anger
text: When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised criticisms all the time.

label: sadness
text: When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and probably would die. We had not expected this because he was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, gave him medicines during the night.

label: disgust
text: When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often with her.

label: shame
text: When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before the introduction of novices on the University start).

label: guilt
text: When my father told me that I should help my mother more often, because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.

label: joy
text: Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

label: fear
text: I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter my room.

label: anger
text: I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in an overload.

label: sadness
text: I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They try to repress it.

label: disgust
text: Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on \Mummy's day\") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family more important than grandfather ?"

label: shame
text: Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so long.

label: fear
text: When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

label: anger
text: When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was buying bathing soap.

label: sadness
text: When I failed the grade seven examination.

label: disgust
text: When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at all.

label: shame
text: When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.

label: joy
text: The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

label: fear
text: When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there were ghosts in that area.

label: anger
text: In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  There was a fight.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the hospital.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

label: guilt
text: I broke my friend's badminton racket and she kept quiet about it.

label: joy
text: \Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your uncle is coming back fron Canada next week,\" my father told me and it was a happy moment."

label: fear
text: I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village.  And we were caught red handed there by a form master.

label: anger
text: When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.

label: sadness
text: My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments.  I was very sad when I learnt this.

label: disgust
