text: Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.

label: sadness
text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

label: disgust
text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        operation.

label: shame
text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents attention by talking to them.

label: guilt
text: When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was a clear and unfair insult.

label: joy
text: When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.

label: fear
text: When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

label: anger
text: I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's death.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.

label: shame
text: At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do silly things.

label: guilt
text: I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left, I did not try to prevent her from leaving.

label: joy
text: When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film marathon I wanted to see.

label: fear
text: We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to swerve and we almost got run over.

label: anger
text: I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had already taken place.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged everythiing for them.

label: disgust
text: I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

label: shame
text: I was in a very small class and the professor said something about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

label: guilt
text: I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

label: joy
text: The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

label: fear
text: I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which I should not have made.

label: anger
text: My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had done nothing.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

label: disgust
text: I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the bathroom on time.

label: shame
text: In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me either to pay more attention or to leave.

label: guilt
text: When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.

label: joy
text: When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time and I had lost his address and telephone number.

label: fear
text: I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we climbed up a tree.

label: anger
text: When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.

label: sadness
text: I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a lot for it.

label: disgust
text: When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.

label: shame
text: I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.

label: guilt
text: I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as much affection as I receive.

label: joy
text: I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found him.

label: fear
text: I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At last I arrived home.

label: anger
text: My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.

label: sadness
text: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

label: disgust
text: Finding a hair in the soup.

label: shame
text: I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started looking at me and I had to move to their table.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a trip, and I did not turn up.

label: joy
text: I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

label: fear
text: We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of the right way back.

label: anger
text: I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me and he lost it.

label: sadness
text: To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

label: disgust
text: Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.

label: shame
text: At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.

label: guilt
text: One night, I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home, my parents were very worried.

label: joy
text: My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  was all right.

label: fear
text: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

label: anger
text: I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

label: sadness
text: The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back to University and to the exams.

label: disgust
text: There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was open.  We passed beside it.

label: shame
text: At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak from the stand by drawing lots.

label: guilt
text: I had a small argument with a relative and some other people got implicated.  It resulted in a proper row.

label: joy
text: Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had previously failed.

label: fear
text: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.

label: anger
text: My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

label: sadness
text: When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did not know what would happen.

label: disgust
text: I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber in my cup.

label: shame
text: When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.

label: guilt
text: At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me who had laughed, and she punished the entire class by making them stay behind for one hour.

label: joy
text: One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

label: fear
text: We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could not find our way out.

label: sadness
text: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not have the money to do it.

label: disgust
text: In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed, leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of one of the actors.

label: shame
text: I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

label: guilt
text: At a party, several comments were made about the personal situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected and uncomfortable.

label: joy
text: It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could at last be with the people I wanted to see.

label: fear
text: One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some strange noises which put my imagination to work.

label: anger
text: When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

label: sadness
text: I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

label: disgust
text: I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend of mine after several months.

label: guilt
text: When I noticed the negative changes in a friend's behaviour.

label: joy
text: I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in Madrid.

label: fear
text: I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent approached me.

label: anger
text: My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me telling me how she had got drunk the last time.

label: disgust
text: I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I called my mother.

label: shame
text: I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if I was a rare specimen.

label: guilt
text: I was spending a few days at my aunt's place.  One night I got home very late, I had told them I was going to a party but I went to another place.  They were very worried.

label: joy
text: Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a long time.

label: fear
text: I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost  my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.

label: anger
text: My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was my sister who had done it.

label: disgust
text: At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.

label: shame
text: I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my friend.

label: guilt
text: Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends quarelled.

label: joy
text: When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

label: fear
text: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports at the police station.

label: anger
text: When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more money to carry on studying.

label: sadness
text: The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each other.

label: disgust
text: In a park near our home, a group of young people who were strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They began to eat while carressing each other.

label: shame
text: I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings in public, because other people do not understand my reactions and think that I am silly.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one which I had desired a lot.

label: fear
text: When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous for me and the people close to me.

label: anger
text: When my father made my mother go through really terrible situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

label: sadness
text: When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.

label: disgust
text: When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......

label: shame
text: I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very worried in case someone should see me.

label: guilt
text: When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had commited a grave sin.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

label: fear
text: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My friend had to turn the car rapidly.

label: anger
text: When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

label: sadness
text: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had failed.

label: disgust
text: When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

label: shame
text: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help blushing.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.

label: joy
text: The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a wonderful time all day long.

label: fear
text: I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry and made the other person apologize.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not believe it.

label: disgust
text: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and vomited.

label: shame
text: I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things wrong.

label: guilt
text: Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said no.

label: joy
text: On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.

label: fear
text: Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

label: anger
text: They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that the one I had was out of date.

label: sadness
text: When I came back from my holidays.

label: disgust
text: When I saw an insect going up my arm.

label: shame
text: When I entered a bar looking for a friend.

label: guilt
text: Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I felt sorry.

label: joy
text: When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a fortnight.

label: fear
text: Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the house and came back very late.

label: anger
text: When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and she was fed up with my behaviour.

label: sadness
text: When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated from them for about three months.

label: disgust
text: When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

label: shame
text: When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle of the class and I had to gesticulate.

label: guilt
text: Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.

label: joy
text: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

label: fear
text: I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house.  A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this alley.

label: anger
text: My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

label: sadness
text: One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that some of my relatives had died in an accident.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which impressed me most.

label: shame
text: I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where there were many soldiers.  They began to pass remarks at me.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.

label: joy
text: I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not expected this so I was very happy.

label: fear
text: When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened but he recovered later.

label: anger
text: I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to tease me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.

label: shame
text: When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.  I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.

label: guilt
text: When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets worried and this made me feel angry.

label: joy
text: When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the examinations she was about to take.

label: fear
text: When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school, was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

label: anger
text: One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

label: disgust
text: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the driver made the same excuse every day.

label: shame
text: One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.  I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not the servant but my daughter who had broken it.

label: guilt
text: When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.

label: joy
text: When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

label: fear
text: When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   during my holidays in Monze.á

label: anger
text: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about something.

label: sadness
text: When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

label: disgust
text: When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while  we were playing near his home.

label: shame
text: The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if  all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the influence of the beer.

label: guilt
text: When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

label: joy
text: After going through much shame, I became a Christian and something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was manifest in me.

label: fear
text: When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard      when it entered my room at night.

label: anger
text: When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him \Mister\".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry as he had belittled me."

label: sadness
text: When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of a sore on the leg.

label: disgust
text: When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third time.

label: shame
text: I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family got to know about it, this was just when I had become a Christian.

label: guilt
text: When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to the girl's secondary school.

label: joy
text: When I first passed a job interview.

label: fear
text: I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having failed the exams.

label: disgust
text: I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late to find some visitors at my place.

label: shame
text: I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most people performed well.

label: guilt
text: I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the only ones he had.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had guns.

label: anger
text: When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made me wonder if he was a really a good friend.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.

label: disgust
text: When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.

label: shame
text: I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very drunk, as he approached us he started to undress.

label: guilt
text: When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had been teling her was false.

label: joy
text: When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

label: fear
text: When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

label: anger
text: When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after having been punished for it.

label: sadness
text: 1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's reaction to the students demands concerning the educational system.

label: disgust
text: When I got  grade \C\" in M160 at the end of my first year at UNZA.  I had expected a \"C+\" or a \"B\" as M160 is easy, going by my capacity in mathematics."

label: shame
text: When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own urine from the wet soil, I did it.

label: guilt
text: When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to stop and get up, I carried on.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for further education, here at the university.

label: fear
text: When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  I suspected that it was witch-craft.

label: anger
text: When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money was found later.

label: sadness
text: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and was in hospital.

label: disgust
text: When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply because it was far away from my house.

label: shame
text: When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students laughed at me.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.

label: joy
text: When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

label: fear
text: When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost fallen.

label: anger
text: When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.

label: sadness
text: When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

label: disgust
text: When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a prostitute.

label: shame
text: My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.

label: guilt
text: When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have thought that I had been stealing.

label: joy
text: When I had my four children.

label: fear
text: When two of my children were critically ill with measles.

label: anger
text: When I got a low grade in an administration course.

label: sadness
text: When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

label: disgust
text: When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband when we were separated - pending divorce.

label: shame
text: When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.

label: joy
text: This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had  thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in all my courses.

label: fear
text: When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed -rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.

label: anger
text: When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's problems.

label: disgust
text: When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister, Indira Gandhi.

label: shame
text: When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were there with me.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after having  gone to a disco without permission.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I had passed the exams.

label: fear
text: When a thief broke into my house at night.

label: anger
text: When my sister broke my china tea set.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.

label: disgust
text: I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.

label: shame
text: When I failed to answer a simple question.

label: guilt
text: My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days later he stole it from my father.

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

label: anger
text: When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and looking down on me.

label: sadness
text: When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it to UNZA.

label: disgust
text: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in me.

label: shame
text: I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.

label: joy
text: When I passed the grade 7 exam.

label: fear
text: When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, that I had tuberculosis.

label: anger
text: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in it and threw it in the dust-bin.

label: sadness
text: This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.

label: disgust
text: When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends with my boyfriend's other girl.

label: shame
text: When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad things that I had been saying about them.

label: guilt
text: When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my father had brought another woman home while she was away.

label: joy
text: The time I qualified to enter secondary school.

label: fear
text: One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

label: anger
text: When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a witness.

label: sadness
text: The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

label: disgust
text: The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.  It was so filthy that it really made me sick.

label: shame
text: My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a young boy.

label: guilt
text: When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it was killed by the dogs.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a Christian.

label: fear
text: When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

label: anger
text: When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      my studies in time at UNZA.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my nephew had passed away.

label: disgust
text: When my father thought that I was an unrelaible son.

label: shame
text: When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest of the class laughed at my attempt.

label: guilt
text: When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.

label: joy
text: When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the envelope and my eyes ran into two \B+\" - in EC110 and M160, this meant that I had qualified for a major in economics."

label: fear
text: I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hear any broadcast,  \ What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? \"  --I did not know how to tune a radio."

label: anger
text: I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbd my step-dad.  I thought, \ Why did she break her promises ? Why had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? \""

label: sadness
text: When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was not even selected.

label: disgust
text: I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some soft music from my three band radio cassette.  There was only young Kaley there and he explained, \ Your aunt has sold it as she wanted to buy clothes.\""

label: shame
text: When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that she was in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughed and started looking at me.

label: guilt
text: My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.

label: joy
text: This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her response.

label: fear
text: It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have never seen anything like that before.

label: anger
text: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my trousers without my consent.

label: sadness
text: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 and we were about to take the main exam.

label: disgust
text: This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman (prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered by the guardian.

label: shame
text: This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home, I was very hungry a few hours before supper.

label: guilt
text: When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous day.

label: joy
text: I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition.  In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell down.

label: fear
text: I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we   saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have any legs.

label: anger
text: The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining school to cool off.

label: sadness
text: A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the loo.

label: disgust
text: A pig in the well from which we drink.

label: shame
text: My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred.  Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

label: guilt
text: I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then, neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell him about the accident and I will never tell him.

label: joy
text: I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my school congratulating me for my performance at the previous year's exam.

label: fear
text: This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the head-master and he threatened to suspend me.

label: anger
text: When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew nothing about this.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the information that she had died.

label: disgust
text: When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize.

label: shame
text: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she was engaged to an another man.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had failed.  I wished that I had helped him.

label: joy
text: My being admitted to UNZA.

label: fear
text: While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

label: anger
text: I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my father, however he misused the money.

label: sadness
text: The loss of my mother.

label: disgust
text: Over an argument.

label: shame
text: At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.

label: guilt
text: When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.

label: joy
text: My first kiss.

label: fear
text: When I saw a ghost.

label: anger
text: My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.

label: sadness
text: When a friend left me and went back home for good.

label: disgust
text: When I failed an exam.

label: shame
text: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.

label: guilt
text: I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

label: joy
text: When I passed my form three exams.

label: fear
text: The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form four).

label: anger
text: When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking behind my back.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of my aunt.

label: disgust
text: When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfill the promise.

label: shame
text: I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a wet lawn.

label: guilt
text: When I took drugs.

label: joy
text: As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more anxious.  My friend called me and said, \ You have passed.\"  My heart was full of joy."

label: fear
text: I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the second reel ended.

label: anger
text: \ I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing people in your room,\" he said.  This sentence really shot my heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away without uttering a word."

label: sadness
text: One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we stayed indoors.

label: disgust
text: One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very disgusted.

label: shame
text: I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought.  I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

label: guilt
text: I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.

label: joy
text: When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.

label: fear
text: The possibility of having failed the examination.

label: anger
text: When someone chased me from his house.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a student like me.

label: disgust
text: When some people, including me, are treated in a way which equates them to an animal or a thing.

label: shame
text: When someone I know was caught in an \adultery\" situation."

label: guilt
text: When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it when asked about it later.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months pregnant and that I was responsible for the \damages\".  This made me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine."

label: fear
text: The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

label: anger
text: I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds  (security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to be for me.

label: sadness
text: That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital  to see my brother.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and found him screwing my girlfriend.

label: shame
text: When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

label: guilt
text: My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too old for me.

label: joy
text: When a girl I wanted very much, said \yes\" and fell in love with  me."

label: fear
text: One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.

label: anger
text: When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died.

label: disgust
text: A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the class during a tough mathematics examination.

label: shame
text: I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red handed.  She forgave me later.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.

label: guilt
text: I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for it, and I was caught red handed.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first year examination and was among the thirty students who would major in economics.

label: fear
text: I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

label: sadness
text: It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so that I could take my exams.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.

label: shame
text: I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.  I had tried to hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in the kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered the stolen package.

label: guilt
text: Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had done it.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

label: anger
text: When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

label: sadness
text: When my beloved grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole thing was handled disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,        \ Will you not say good-bye to me?\"  He is only 31/2 years old. "

label: guilt
text: When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.  He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

label: joy
text: I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the second year.

label: fear
text: When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

label: anger
text: This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She was the last of my grand parents to pass away.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I could not get into the school I had initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never thought I would do.

label: shame
text: I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me down.

label: guilt
text: My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told me that the change was not correct.

label: joy
text: When my first child was born.

label: fear
text: I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at a distance of about four metres.

label: anger
text: When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of nine only.

label: sadness
text: When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone an operation.

label: disgust
text: When my best friend started getting involved in my private affairs.

label: shame
text: I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in a fight.

label: guilt
text: I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the   doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt guilty when asked to explain things on my return.

label: joy
text: I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.

label: fear
text: We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following us.

label: anger
text: I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

label: sadness
text: I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked down by a car.

label: disgust
text: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

label: shame
text: I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.

label: guilt
text: I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to pick me up from work.

label: joy
text: When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

label: fear
text: When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

label: anger
text: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time student at UNZA.

label: sadness
text: When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to wait at his home so that I could see his new car.

label: disgust
text: When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would not go to the training school that year but only the year after.

label: shame
text: A patient, to whom I had given a powerful medicine, shouted at me in front of many people.  I realized that he did so because he was very ill.

label: guilt
text: When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.

label: joy
text: When I received my promotion letter.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my neighbour's house.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

label: sadness
text: My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been different.

label: disgust
text: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.

label: shame
text: After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my friends.

label: guilt
text: A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do what she had requested me to do.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former secondary school.

label: fear
text: I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours last academic year.

label: anger
text: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

label: disgust
text: When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite my excellent certificate.

label: shame
text: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life.  I really felt like hiding.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  morning for manual work.

label: joy
text: When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

label: fear
text: When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could see was this hand coming towards me.

label: anger
text: When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He embarassed me in front of a crowd.

label: sadness
text: When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been waiting to see us.

label: disgust
text: When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and there was no water to clean up.

label: shame
text: When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every one read it and started teasing me about it.

label: guilt
text: When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my boyfriend found out.

label: joy
text: After a long time (of no communication with him, physical illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected to see him.

label: fear
text: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it was the birds till my mother told me so.

label: anger
text: The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

label: sadness
text: My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I cried myself to sleep.

label: disgust
text: On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.

label: shame
text: When I wet my bed at boarding school.

label: guilt
text: My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get her on my back, she slipped and fell.

label: joy
text: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

label: fear
text: When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.

label: anger
text: My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's room.

label: sadness
text: I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this message he was already dead.

label: disgust
text: The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not finish the work.

label: shame
text: I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that I had forgotten.

label: guilt
text: I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.  I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this neighbour's house.

label: joy
text: When my father bought me a suit.

label: fear
text: After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

label: anger
text: I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding party.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home in Woodlands.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120 assignment.

label: guilt
text: I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had to plead guilty.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

label: fear
text: When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards me.

label: anger
text: I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away.

label: disgust
text: Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me when I was not responsible for the theft.

label: shame
text: When I failed the grade seven exams.

label: guilt
text: One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I decided not to talk to her.

label: joy
text: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

label: fear
text: When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she would die.

label: anger
text: When I found out that my sister had been playing with my confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.

label: sadness
text: When one of my best friends commited siucide during these holidays.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are pregnant illegitimately.

label: shame
text: When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.

label: guilt
text: When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial problems.

label: joy
text: When I fell in love with \X\".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,    responsible and worthwhile."

label: fear
text: When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

label: anger
text: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due at 1400 hours.

label: sadness
text: When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

label: disgust
text: When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was meant to be a joke.

label: shame
text: Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect - my friend's home.

label: guilt
text: When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

label: joy
text: The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be selected.

label: fear
text: The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of leaves behind our house.

label: anger
text: When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with certain other friends which they thought was improper.

label: sadness
text: The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

label: disgust
text: The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a dead fly in my gravy.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my friends.

label: guilt
text: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I had passed.

label: fear
text: I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.

label: anger
text: I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I had trusted her.

label: sadness
text: I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

label: disgust
text: When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like the windows, glasses etc.

label: shame
text: When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.

label: guilt
text: I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who caught me.  Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid for my bad behaviour.

label: joy
text: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my registration at UNZA.

label: fear
text: I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came from behind to overtake us.  However another one was coming right in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way and so we crashed against the side of the road.

label: anger
text: I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested me, by my employers.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt of the death of a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA, even though I registered as a student later.

label: shame
text: My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.

label: guilt
text: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him anything.

label: joy
text: When I first came to the campus.

label: fear
text: When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock.  I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the gallows.

label: anger
text: When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly knocked him out.

label: sadness
text: When I lost my father in a car accident.

label: disgust
text: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when a friend, I had always respected, insulted me in public.  He was drunk.

label: guilt
text: When my library books were overdue and I did not have the money to pay for them.

label: joy
text: When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had not expected to do so well.

label: fear
text: When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not know how to get back home.

label: anger
text: When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt angry over his actions.

label: sadness
text: When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from what I was told about it.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and        splinters of bone every where.

label: shame
text: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and myself.

label: guilt
text: When I \passed out\" a female friend of mine for no apparent reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation."

label: joy
text: When I was accepted at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard gunshots.

label: anger
text: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a murder).

label: disgust
text: When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized how bad it was.

label: shame
text: When my friend had a child out of wedlock.

label: guilt
text: When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

label: joy
text: Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

label: fear
text: When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel us.

label: anger
text: At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he fainted and so I called the first aid.

label: shame
text: As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a neighbour.

label: guilt
text: I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut above his left eye while trying to separate us.

label: joy
text: I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

label: fear
text: I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money.  I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

label: anger
text: A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not leave her alone.

label: sadness
text: When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to rest.

label: disgust
text: When I witnessed an accident.

label: shame
text: When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon when he entered the room.

label: guilt
text: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.

label: joy
text: When I won some coins in a small competion.

label: fear
text: I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that the dogs may be outside.

label: anger
text: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

label: sadness
text: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate woke me up.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

label: shame
text: My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.

label: guilt
text: The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day when I wanted something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in the act.

label: joy
text: When I was selected for the university.

label: fear
text: When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the spot.

label: anger
text: When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my wardrobe.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother passed away.

label: disgust
text: While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting helplessly.

label: shame
text: When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was me.

label: guilt
text: When I told a person something that had happened to my friend, and this person went and told my friend.

label: joy
text: When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a long time.

label: fear
text: When I was told that the form five results were out.

label: anger
text: When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not know.

label: sadness
text: The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the Zambia closed badminton championships.

label: disgust
text: When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken her time.

label: shame
text: When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.

label: joy
text: When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

label: fear
text: When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be forced to marry her or go to court.

label: anger
text: When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given me.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation and they are together now).

label: disgust
text: When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was almost a brothel.

label: shame
text: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

label: guilt
text: When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father before they briefly separated.

label: joy
text: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to learn that it was me who was delaying things.

label: fear
text: Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them would be killed.

label: anger
text: When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

label: sadness
text: I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted at not having got aa \A\" in yesterday's practicals of G220."

label: shame
text: I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the money last term.

label: joy
text: Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

label: fear
text: My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.  There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

label: anger
text: I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

label: sadness
text: I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my friend.  That day I was really sad.

label: disgust
text: I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

label: shame
text: We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt embarassed.

label: guilt
text: We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did not own up so the  whole class was punished.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA was approved after it had been cancelled.

label: fear
text: When I met an elephant in the bush.

label: anger
text: When someone took my pen away.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

label: disgust
text: An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

label: shame
text: I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to leave their home.

label: guilt
text: I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.

label: joy
text: When I was with someone I love.

label: fear
text: When I was walking around all alone at night.

label: anger
text: Being made to look like a fool by a girl.

label: sadness
text: When my dad passed away.

label: disgust
text: When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.

label: shame
text: Getting very low marks in mathematics.

label: guilt
text: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.

label: joy
text: At my sister's wedding.

label: fear
text: When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

label: anger
text: When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

label: sadness
text: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of Zambia.

label: disgust
text: When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.

label: shame
text: When I swindled money out of someone.

label: guilt
text: I did not deliver a message on time.

label: joy
text: When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my lover and future wife.

label: fear
text: When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be heard.

label: anger
text: When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

label: sadness
text: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my grade six.

label: disgust
text: When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I had learnt all the lines.

label: shame
text: When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant, unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

label: guilt
text: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I thought that I would be found out.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last born in the family.

label: fear
text: My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

label: anger
text: I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the transport money I had to go to school.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other till we apologized to each other.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I felt responsible for her illness.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

label: fear
text: In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.

label: anger
text: When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.

label: sadness
text: When I heard of the death of my mother.

label: disgust
text: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them financially.

label: shame
text: When I failed one of the first year's courses.

label: guilt
text: When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up late.  I thus cheated my boss.

label: joy
text: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year courses.

label: fear
text: In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I was very frightened.

label: anger
text: In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible for his guardian's failure.

label: sadness
text: Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

label: disgust
text: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

label: shame
text: A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

label: guilt
text: Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

label: joy
text: When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who qualified for form I that year.

label: fear
text: When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

label: anger
text: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  days earlier.

label: sadness
text: When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the death of my father.

label: disgust
text: When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the rooms were allotted to first year students who were from \Rucher\" and came from influential families."

label: shame
text: When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I was entertaining my mother who had come from home.  However, I later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I had taken out another girlfriend of mine.

label: guilt
text: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary was taken away from him.

label: joy
text: When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

label: fear
text: When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and ordered me to give them money or face death.

label: anger
text: When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.

label: sadness
text: When my elder brother died.

label: disgust
text: When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.

label: shame
text: When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his pants after having drunk beer.

label: guilt
text: When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

label: joy
text: When my brother gave me a watch.

label: fear
text: Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.

label: anger
text: When I was insulted by a fellow student.

label: sadness
text: When the girl I loved turned me down.

label: disgust
text: When I found my girl in bed with another man.

label: shame
text: When I failed grade 7.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.

label: joy
text: When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my second year.

label: fear
text: I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, very far away.

label: anger
text: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him for over an hour.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard to accept.

label: disgust
text: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling false stories about us to other people.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of self pity.

label: guilt
text: One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying colours and that I had made it to the university.

label: fear
text: Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were trying to kiss me.

label: anger
text: One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I was sure that I had done no such thing.

label: sadness
text: The passing away of my mum.

label: disgust
text: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.

label: shame
text: About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was nothing wrong with me.

label: guilt
text: This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from the pot.

label: joy
text: The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

label: fear
text: The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.

label: anger
text: When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

label: sadness
text: When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my form five exams with flying colours.

label: disgust
text: When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.

label: shame
text: When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.

label: guilt
text: When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.

label: joy
text: When my sister's first child came home, after one week in intensive care at the hospital.

label: fear
text: When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the whole scene.

label: anger
text: A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been left out.  Biased judgment !

label: sadness
text: My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then the older one died a week later.

label: disgust
