text: When a friend carelessly broke and object in my parent's house and did not apologize, or pay, or anything.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: This person I know lied about how much income his parents made and received money through grants which he did not need. Another person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive enough money.

label: shame
text: After a big fight with my parents.

label: guilt
text: I forgot about a close relatives's birthday.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party for me too.

label: fear
text: While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to creak loudly.

label: anger
text: I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time. She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the relationship without going out with other people. I was her first boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: I read in the newspaper about a 21 yr. old woman who was found naked and dead along a roadside. It turned out she had had two relatives 14 and 19 who were kidnapped, raped and killed earlier.

label: shame
text: I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.

label: guilt
text: I dreamed that this girl and I were cuddling in bed when my girlfriend walked in. I really love my girlfriend so I felt guilty and sad. I know that this is a wierd example but the dream and the feeling was clear to me as if it had really happened.

label: fear
text: Being involved in a car accident and having my thumb caught in the glove compartment. My sister and I had a Fear of finally telling my parents, since my sister was the driver.

label: anger
text: A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do it himself since he was quicker at it.

label: sadness
text: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a few days before and then one morning it was gone.

label: disgust
text: NO RESPONSE

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE

label: guilt
text: Having told a certain lie.

label: joy
text: I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well. I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her giving her a neck massage.

label: fear
text: Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountains at midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one another horrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaring eachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads we knew the fears were unjustified.

label: anger
text: I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered me greatly.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died thirteen years ago.

label: disgust
text: When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures another relatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgust mingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaulted another person for having a certain religious belief.

label: shame
text: I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later than I had originally intended.

label: guilt
text: I angered a close friend and he was injured.

label: joy
text: My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that we have a great new design - it's always the same.

label: fear
text: I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00 already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could have been.

label: anger
text: While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with eachother because we were both fed up.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

label: disgust
text: One of my good friends told people something I had told her in confidence about someone else.

label: shame
text: I wanted my boyfriend to stay when he didn't. He stayed but when he left I felt ashamed because I should have let him leave when he wanted. I was too selfish.

label: guilt
text: At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend but kept on looking at me as I talked.

label: joy
text: Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

label: fear
text: I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to go back and see if I caused him to crash.

label: anger
text: I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics. I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious to see it.

label: sadness
text: It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.

label: disgust
text: I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.

label: shame
text: I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high school. That was my first and last time.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular  remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to getting an A in the class.

label: joy
text: I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did well on a test.

label: fear
text: When  first came to CAL I went to a rally on Sproul and I later learned that the rally was conducted by the Moonie cult. They were taking pictures at the rally, so I was afraid that they would circulate the pictures and then kidnap people. I did not know how the cult worked. I was scared.

label: anger
text: When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for not having the time to write a good essay.

label: sadness
text: I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a girl in my economics discussion section smiling and asking stupid questions to the TA. just to get attention. She was obviously ass-kissing. It happens in every Econ. discussion held weekly.

label: shame
text: I was supposed to go out with my girlfriend one Saturday night, but I got really drunk with some friends earlier that afternoon and evening. So, I totally forgot about going out with my girlfriend. She showed up the next day, and that was when I remembered.

label: guilt
text: I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I fixed the tire. After fixing the tire, the salesperson who helped me was gone so I walked out of the store without paying. I felt guilty so I went inside and paid for the tire.

label: joy
text: I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found out how he felt about me.

label: fear
text: I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of the foxtail.

label: anger
text: One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was serious.

label: sadness
text: One of my relatives became seriously ill. I felt sad because I didn't know if she will ever be the same again.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me. That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

label: shame
text: After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of the results of the midterm.

label: guilt
text: A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't pay as much attention to him as I should have.

label: joy
text: I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.

label: fear
text: I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are not my favorite spots in life.

label: anger
text: I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't care for my style, even though she was not using correct English. I told her it was her letter and we would do it her way.

label: sadness
text: Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at times just plain rude behavior.

label: shame
text: I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about it.

label: guilt
text: I was supposed to have done some things for my mother, but just plain didn't get around to it.

label: joy
text: My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took interest.

label: fear
text: I was physically assaulted and sexually abused about a year ago. Just the feeling that I might not get away intact, or even alive, produced fear.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to do so.

label: sadness
text: My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him because a similar situation happened to me.

label: disgust
text: My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talking and a few of them said awful things about women. I became disgusted by their narrow-mindedness.

label: shame
text: I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his \doormat\"."

label: guilt
text: I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with my boyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion - I did.

label: joy
text: When I got accepted to CAL.

label: fear
text: My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.

label: anger
text: When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me, calling me names and pushing me around.

label: sadness
text: I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was unable to go because of registration.

label: disgust
text: I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myself because I was prepared and thought I did well.

label: shame
text: When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.

label: guilt
text: A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, but something came up and I cancelled out on him.

label: joy
text: After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my first love called me and told me that he would always care for me no matter what I did.

label: fear
text: When my exboyfriend threw me around the dorms because I was talking on the phone to another guy of whom he was jealous, after we had an argument in which I thought we broke up.

label: anger
text: When someone tried to rape one of my best friends and he claimed it was her fault. He the hassled her, claimed she was loose, and threatened to sue her.

label: sadness
text: My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur like a brother. He was easy to talk to.

label: disgust
text: I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed not to like.

label: shame
text: The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.

label: guilt
text: I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I would hurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we had created.

label: joy
text: I spent a lovely relaxing evening with my boyfriend. We played games and talked all evening.

label: fear
text: When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call the police and he started following us.

label: anger
text: When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered or purified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.

label: shame
text: The same for guilt would apply.

label: guilt
text: I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of a yield.

label: joy
text: Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for one question (the question was graded by the professor and he indicated he liked my answer).

label: fear
text: In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hitting close by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid I might be struck.

label: anger
text: We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact plans to paint my room without consulting me.

label: sadness
text: Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was at work).

label: disgust
text: I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our Halloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummy of a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.

label: shame
text: I came home from school very keyed up. At the dinner table I unfortunately unloaded a lot of my hostility off on one of my parents. I'm ashamed that I didn't dispate and control these feelings before coming to the table or even let the energy build up in the first place.

label: guilt
text: Eating the last remains of dinner that someone else (unknown to me) had claimed.

label: joy
text: After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me extremely happy.

label: fear
text: While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could have been much more severe and that terrified me.

label: anger
text: I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault, but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one weekend from CAL to take me home.

label: disgust
text: Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.

label: shame
text: When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real bad about it.

label: guilt
text: When my grandfather was in a nursing home when I was young I never wanted to go and sometimes didn't have to and later I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when my boyfriend proposed to me in marriage.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.

label: anger
text: After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday, November 14.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I was in a restaurant which didn't appear to be clean and orderly. (I do not like to be in unclean environments).

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.

label: guilt
text: When I did not defend my close friend when my father degraded him. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with his actions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter up with my father a few weeks later.

label: joy
text: After much trouble getting together in the first place my boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

label: fear
text: I got caught shoplifting a package of gummy bears.

label: anger
text: Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer) insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimes blames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.

label: sadness
text: Since I moved into the dorms and I've been spending most of my free time with my boyfriend. I hardly see my old high school friends. I had several bad incidents with my 2 past best friends.

label: disgust
text: I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.

label: shame
text: My grades. When my parents say, \How are you doing at school, getting good grades ?\" I say, \"Great, just fine !\" Actually, I feel ashamed about myself."

label: guilt
text: I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

label: joy
text: Winning a close volleyball game. (I'm on the intercollegiate team at CAL)

label: fear
text: Speaking in front of a large group of people.

label: anger
text: Same situation as before - having my car stolen.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend drowned in the American River.

label: disgust
text: Getting a low grade on my physics midterm.

label: shame
text: Arguing with a friend over politics. She was more informed on the issues and made me feel very ashamed of my political ignorance.

label: guilt
text: When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang - very hard to replace).

label: joy
text: Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work for a week at that plan.

label: fear
text: On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.

label: anger
text: Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without my consent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying to find a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.

label: sadness
text: Death of my father.

label: disgust
text: Getting back my math midterm, I received a lower grade than I thought I would get. After going through the questions I felt that the grader had graded harshly and I had made only a few ? errors.

label: shame
text: Getting a low grade on a midterm.

label: guilt
text: Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.

label: joy
text: When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.

label: fear
text: I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.

label: anger
text: I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat tire.

label: sadness
text: After my little sister's Graduation from High School my grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the change to buy wine.

label: shame
text: I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.

label: guilt
text: After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ? crying and upset.

label: joy
text: A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many friends were present and good music.

label: fear
text: I'm afraid of not being able to go to the school I want because of suffering grades.

label: anger
text: I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared for.

label: sadness
text: After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what I had done and hurt that person and myself.

label: disgust
text: My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need to accomplish.

label: shame
text: I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really dependiong on me.

label: guilt
text: After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said all the wrong things.

label: joy
text: I realized the girl liked to be with me.

label: fear
text: That I would do bad in a class and not get into Bus school.

label: anger
text: When my dad told me about something he had done against my mother.

label: sadness
text: When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.

label: disgust
text: An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.

label: shame
text: I did bad on a test I didn't study for.

label: guilt
text: Decided at the last minute not to do something that I said I would do with a person.

label: joy
text: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

label: fear
text: When my B.A results had not come.

label: anger
text: When I failed my S.S.C exam.

label: sadness
text: When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.

label: disgust
text: I trusted a friend of mine, but she lied to me about something and this disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.

label: joy
text: My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful future, who made me dream.

label: fear
text: When I got to know that the friend I am closest to got engaged, and she was going away.  I was overjoyed for her, but also felt frightened as I was very emotionally dependent on her.  I did not know what I would do without her.

label: anger
text: I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take out my anger on him.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not reciprocated.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted while studying for my applied psychology and mental testing papers in B.A.

label: shame
text: I had a habit of wetting my bed when I was young.  One day, when I was invited to my friend's place to stay for the night, it happened again.  I was ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

label: joy
text: After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.

label: fear
text: A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughter properly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.

label: disgust
text: When my parents-in-law scolded me, without any reason, in front of the other members of my family for the first time.  They had called me from my room where I had been studying for my exams.

label: shame
text: When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I felt ashamed in front of the whole class.

label: guilt
text: When my friend failed an exam by just one mark.  During this exam she had asked me to show her my answer sheet and I had not done it.  When the results came out, I thought that had I shown her my answer sheet she would have passed the exam.  I felt guilty as I had failed her.

label: joy
text: When my family allowed me to do higher studies.

label: fear
text: When I decided to separate from my husband.

label: anger
text: When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel angry.

label: disgust
text: When my husband quarrelled with me for no reason at all.

label: joy
text: I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

label: fear
text: That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.  I did not know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them to come back and nobody came.  It was getting very late and I was terrified.

label: anger
text: I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there were not too many people on the street.  A couple of guys were following me and I was ignoring them.  Suddenly one of them came in front of me and started using dirty language and harrassing me.  I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.

label: sadness
text: A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad on hearing of his death.

label: disgust
text: A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.

label: shame
text: I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.

label: guilt
text: I went to the cinema with my friends, without telling my mother about it as I had been to the cinema the day before also.  When she asked me where I had been, I lied.

label: joy
text: When I got permission to study at a place which was far away from my home.

label: fear
text: I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be a quarrel because of my being late.

label: disgust
text: When people around me did not understand me the right way.

label: joy
text: When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.

label: fear
text: When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as to what would happen to him.

label: anger
text: I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.

label: sadness
text: When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.

label: disgust
text: When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city,á came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked me the reason for my absence.

label: joy
text: I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress award, while our play got the first place.

label: fear
text: I have done the teachers training course (B.Ed).  During our training I was asked to handle the ninth standard class in a boys school.  I was scared to face the class the first day.

label: anger
text: I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time     (about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not intend to come as he was feeling tired.

label: sadness
text: When my sister died in a fire accident at home.

label: disgust
text: When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.

label: shame
text: When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.

label: guilt
text: I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  attend the class she took a few minutes later.á

label: joy
text: When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I had not expected.

label: anger
text: When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did not turn up - I was annoyed at her.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted when people do not understand me in the right way, i.e they misunderstand me.

label: shame
text: Whenever I am late, I feel ashamed of myself even though no one tells me anything.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

label: fear
text: While trying to board a train I missed the footsteps and fell down on the platform.

label: anger
text: I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we  started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started teasing me.

label: sadness
text: My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house with her child, who spoils our furniture.

label: shame
text: When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at having to see my parents later.

label: guilt
text: When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.

label: joy
text: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

label: fear
text: When I was coming back home alone at night.

label: anger
text: When I failed the M.S.C exams.

label: sadness
text: When my father was ill.

label: disgust
text: When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not invite me.

label: shame
text: When I failed the M.S.C exam.

label: guilt
text: When I fought with my friends.

label: joy
text: Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.

label: fear
text: When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for 6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.

label: anger
text: A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very angry at the children and slapped some of them.

label: sadness
text: My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and lonely.

label: disgust
text: When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.

label: joy
text: When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.

label: fear
text: I had a very horrible dream one night, I dreamt that I had fallen off a very crowded train.

label: anger
text: When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in another college and this was not easy and I felt angry.

label: sadness
text: When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without knowing the real cause of what had happened.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and lies all the time.

label: shame
text: One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simple question which I could not answer.  Finally the teacher himself gave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I had not been able to answer a simple question.  I knew the answer but feared that my response may be wrong.  All this made me feel ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: When I was taking the 11th standard exam, my friend who was sitting behind me asked me for some answers.  The teacher looked at us just then and scolded both of us.  Everyone started looking at us and I felt very guilty.

label: joy
text: After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

label: fear
text: It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining bathroom switched on.

label: sadness
text: When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

label: disgust
text: I do not like one of our neighbours as they are very selfish.  Whenever they want something or need help they come to see us,  otherwise they do not even bother about people who live next to them.

label: shame
text: When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.

label: guilt
text: In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt guilty so I told them the truth and felt free.

label: joy
text: Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes, without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for me.

label: fear
text: When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother.  He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without my brother realizing it.

label: anger
text: One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay me much attention.

label: sadness
text: Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt very sad at loosing a close friend.

label: disgust
text: We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up eating meat after this incident.

label: shame
text: As part of the assessment I had to speak on a subject in front of the class. I was not really prepared and I was just reading the stuff I had on a piece of paper, when some of the students  asked me something I could not give them an answer.  I felt ashamed as I had not prepared the topic.

label: guilt
text: One day I went to see a movie without my parents permission.  It was an adult movie and I was scared that my parents would not allow me to see the movie.  However after coming home I felt very guilty at what I had done.

label: joy
text: When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

label: fear
text: I was in a garden one evening and I saw a snake coming towards me.

label: anger
text: I am separated from my husband.  The way he has behaved towards me makes me angry.

label: sadness
text: When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my home.

label: disgust
text: The way my husband and his family treated me - unfairly, cruelly, and unjustly.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at myself for having shouted at my daughter because of my marital break-up and the unfair way I was treated.

label: guilt
text: While having an argument with my daughter, I got angry and over-excited and said angry words.

label: joy
text: When I got married.

label: fear
text: I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine went out of order while I was still in the upward position.

label: anger
text: A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours.  When this common friend told me the version my friend had told her, I was angry.

label: sadness
text: When my elder sister died.

label: disgust
text: My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on the treatment or the diet control.

label: shame
text: Every time I do not write something well in English.

label: guilt
text: When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teacher nor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.

label: joy
text: The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got engaged.

label: anger
text: One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and  conductor.

label: sadness
text: At the death of my friend's father and especially as this happened ten days before her wedding.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor error.

label: shame
text: When I could not pass my exams with good marks.  My wedding was to take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convince myself that this was the reason for my not having done well.   However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well at the exams I would have done well.

label: joy
text: When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical stress.

label: fear
text: When I had to travel alone, unescorted for the first time.     It was an over-night journey by train to a distant place.

label: anger
text: I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as to why I could not go to visit them when they were ill.  When I did go, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible duringá their illness.

label: sadness
text: I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor appreciated.

label: disgust
text: Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close  relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being inconsiderate in my relationship with them.

label: shame
text: The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

label: guilt
text: I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital  for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.

label: joy
text: I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.

label: fear
text: I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about 9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of fear.

label: anger
text: Uncleaniness at my work place.  The place is generally not very clean, but when it reaches a point, I get angry at the person who is supposed to clean the place and the people who are supposed to supervise him.

label: sadness
text: Three weeks ago a friend of mine bid me good-bye before going abroad.  I felt happy for her as she was achieving something by making the trip, but I also felt sad as I would not be seeing her for a long time.

label: disgust
text: When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3 days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole situation.

label: shame
text: I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into another dress.

label: guilt
text: When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost time.

label: joy
text: When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial burden of the family was reduced.

label: fear
text: I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year degree exams.

label: anger
text: When the others did not do their bit of work on a group assignment task, and I had to do all the work.

label: sadness
text: After having been ill, when I was coming back to the hostel, I felt very sad leaving home.

label: disgust
text: When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and caused her trouble.

label: guilt
text: I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well.  When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.

label: joy
text: When I was selected at TISS X.

label: fear
text: When I almost walked on a snake.

label: anger
text: When I was insulted by a man.

label: sadness
text: When my mother left for Kenya.

label: disgust
text: When I see that the toilet is unclean.

label: shame
text: When my co-resident opened the bathroom door while I was bathing inside.

label: guilt
text: When I could not complete my assignment on time.

label: joy
text: At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel very happy.

label: anger
text: When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.

label: sadness
text: When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

label: disgust
text: When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the visiting hours.  This disgusted me.

label: guilt
text: Once I was not able to give a relative, who was in a critical period, a helping hand.  Whenever I think about it I feel guilty  for letting down the person who trusted me to give him a helping hand.

label: joy
text: The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had been awarded the junior research fellowship.

label: fear
text: When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel where I would be residing.

label: anger
text: When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness and dirtyness.

label: sadness
text: When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.

label: disgust
text: When I went to visit a relative and saw how messy and dirty his place was, in the absence of his wife.

label: shame
text: When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.

label: fear
text: Once when I was walking alone at mid-night, I happened to put my foot on a frog, as it felt smooth I thought that it was a snake  and I felt afraid.

label: anger
text: My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and I felt very angry at him.

label: sadness
text: I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I failed and so I felt very sad.

label: joy
text: When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of me having topped I could not believe it.

label: fear
text: When my son fell off the cot at the age of 5 months, I became very nervous and thought that it would cause defects in his head.

label: anger
text: I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember the face of my father.

label: disgust
text: One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a woman.

label: shame
text: One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something.  In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I realized that what she had done had been for my good.

label: joy
text: When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.

label: fear
text: I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the part II exam.

label: anger
text: I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality - one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would ignore the others.

label: sadness
text: On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially on the farewell party day.  I felt sad to leave behind my beloved teachers and friends.

label: disgust
text: I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and tiring.

label: shame
text: I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.

label: guilt
text: I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper guidance from my parents.  I felt guilty of improper use of the chances provided to me.

label: sadness
text: When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.

label: guilt
text: When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I could have avoided.

label: joy
text: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

label: fear
text: Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.  However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.  This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.

label: anger
text: I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.  It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.

label: sadness
text: I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was intense.

label: disgust
text: This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to myself -\what is life?\".  It is one hell of a place where everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of the other one just for a living, (money).  When I think about such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and dejected."

label: shame
text: This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got into my element and started imitating the professor, and the professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through  out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the fact that she gave me a character certificate.

label: joy
text: This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stood first in the university for the M.A exams.  A few days before the official results were declared a clerk had brought the results unofficially.  So I had been expecting the results but the confirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at my success.

label: fear
text: This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus, by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.  I was even more petrified then.

label: anger
text: A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.  Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.

label: sadness
text: The day I was to receive my gold-medal for the M.A, my grandmother, who I loved very much, died after an illness.  She  died a few hours before the convocation.  While I was attending the convocation I had to control my grief as she would not have liked me to miss it.  It was a day she had been waiting for, but did not get to see.

label: disgust
text: We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)    staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the  guy.

label: shame
text: I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him in teaching girls judo at a suburban college.  I was just a beginer, and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to command respect.  This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myself to listen to him.  I gave it up soon after, however I felt very ashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put my foot down earlier.

label: guilt
text: I was coming back home with my mother when the purse I was carrying got stolen.  It was done so swifty that I did not realize what had happened till much later.  A lot of money and the keys of the house were lost.  I was guilt ridden at my carelessness.  I felt terrible as I do not normally loose things and this was quite important, especially the keys.á

label: joy
text: Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket match.

label: fear
text: When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the forest.

label: anger
text: When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a stranger.

label: sadness
text: When India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.

label: guilt
text: When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital cricket match.

label: joy
text: When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in the competition.

label: fear
text: As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were ghosts dancing around me.

label: anger
text: Despite our good performance and excellent results the management refused to meet our demands.

label: sadness
text: When my beloved girlfriend got married to another person.

label: disgust
text: When I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by four rikshaw drivers in our town.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence   70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.

label: guilt
text: I read about the national and social spirit and self-discipline of the people of developed coutries like U.S.A, England, France, Germany etc.  Comparing this to the Indian people I felt guilty as they have no national spirit or self-discipline.

label: joy
text: I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had  thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.

label: fear
text: One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.  There was no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to 6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink water or  milk.  There was no movement in her body and I felt really scared.  I almost lost my confidence about her survival.

label: anger
text: One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.

label: sadness
text: My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year, unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out as we had expected it to and this saddened me.

label: disgust
text: My classmate at TISS has the habit of biting his nails and ever since my childhood I have never liked this habit.  This person is near me in class, dining hall and the campus so I suggested that he should stop biting his nails.  However he found it difficult and my disgust feelings have not changed.

label: shame
text: I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speak to my relatives and  friends.  Because of this feeling I would avoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.

label: guilt
text: One day my mother forced me to eat more and I refused, the next day she served me more rice and mutton pieces than usual.  When I saw this I got very angry and scolded her, and refused to eat.  Later I felt guilty and asked her to excuse me.

label: joy
text: When I was a student at the Institute doing my M.Phil degree, one of my professors called me before the convocation and told me \You have got the gold-medal (first rank) in the university and tomorrow you will be on T.V\"."

label: fear
text: When I was in my village one of my enemies had written a non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl that I was the culprit.  When I got to know this I was scared as  the girl's father was a worse man.

label: anger
text: When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not get the money.

label: sadness
text: When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.

label: disgust
text: I once got a phone call stating \one of your friend is in jail, please come and see him\".  When I went to the jail and saw him, I was disgusted."

label: shame
text: Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What had happened is that something had been written against my friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me  -\you also signed ?\"   "

label: guilt
text: One of my friends came to know through some other friends that I   had applied for some course in an institute.  He asked me \why did not you tell me, I would also have applied.\"  At that I felt guilty."

label: joy
text: I am joyfull to be alive every night.

label: sadness
text: The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of hope on the Indian horizon.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst the poorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources we do not utilize them.  I was ashamed at myself and my country, shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of the citizens.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting my life.

label: joy
text: My joy knew no bounds when I was selected for a job even before having finished my studies.

label: fear
text: I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which I was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when  I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the train.  I finally made it.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in doing his duty.

label: sadness
text: I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.  More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, withá vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted since I am unable to cope with all the wordly affairs as I spend much precious time to pursue my hobby and to be admist the people I love and long to be with.

label: shame
text: I always feel ashamed when I do not succeed in accomplishing something in which I had put in all my efforts.

label: guilt
text: At times I have been attracted to conducts which are socially degraded due to their ill consequences, and then I feel guilty.

label: joy
text: When India first won the world cup cricket tournament.

label: fear
text: I was then in the 10th standard and was going to my native place.  The last bus had already left and so I started walking, it soon became quite dark.  The road was a village road and was deserted, I was not even sure if that was the right way.  I finally reached home at 10 P.M.

label: anger
text: I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.  However, in the train my name had been omitted from the reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I paid money.

label: sadness
text: The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds  of Mexican people died.

label: disgust
text: In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other during the agitation.

label: joy
text: I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well.

label: fear
text: One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.  We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of the consequences.

label: anger
text: I had made an error in planning a programme and had publicly accepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring the matter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks. I reacted angrily.á

label: sadness
text: I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as a person but could not agree with the life the future would demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

label: disgust
text: Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but to further their own interest.

label: shame
text: I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.

label: joy
text: This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the last time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with a high rank.  This was a few years ago when my friend told me about the result.

label: fear
text: A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain       derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this    would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of  the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

label: anger
text: A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I felt very bad about it later.

label: sadness
text: The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister a few years back.

label: disgust
text: Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road when a country guy who was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on the road.  It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I would have had a very good shower of his saliva.  Though I was not angry, I felt that these people were very indecent.

label: shame
text: Yesterday while playing volley ball, there was one person extra    and somebody had to out.  A mess worker and I were the  last ones to arrive and we had arrived at the same time.  Rightfully one of us had to opt out of the game, as I was delaying leaving the mess worker opted out saying that I should play.  I felt ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him on Sunday.  I had accepted it but later did not go for no specific   reason.  I just slept in my room.  The next day this friend called  me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before and his wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gone waste.  I felt very bad about this incident and it has been growing in my heart ever since.

label: joy
text: When I got my B.Sc degree with first class.

label: fear
text: Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.

label: anger
text: When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.

label: sadness
text: When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.

label: disgust
text: When I could not attend the college picnic due to some difficulties.

label: shame
text: When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for indiscipline.

label: guilt
text: One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.

label: joy
text: This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.

label: fear
text: At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village, about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.

label: anger
text: One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

label: sadness
text: A few months a close relative of mine died.  I had never expected this to happen and was sad for a few months.

label: disgust
text: One day, at an important place I met a group of girls and while we were waiting for a bus these girls started smoking and commanded me to smoke; I felt very disgusted.

label: shame
text: A few months back I had gone to my friend's place and they offered me tea and coffee.  I do not have the habit of drinking tea or coffee and so they offered me a glass of milk instead, so I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: At my native place I was riding my cycle, which did not have lights, at night and so a police man caught me.  I requested him to let me go but he would not so after a few minutes I just escaped.

label: joy
text: After my graduation exams I was waiting to get admitted to a post graduation course, however the situation was not very favourable for me and I was upset.  Suddenly, Bombay university offered me a seat and I landed up in Bombay for my post graduation studies.  This happened last year and was very pleasant for me.

label: anger
text: This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally spoiled my New year's night.

label: joy
text: When I got my B.A degree with first class.

label: fear
text: I received a letter from my college telling me that I would not be allowed to sit for the exams because of my low attendance in class and the bad experience in the terminal exams.

label: anger
text: Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he accused me of having broken the window.

label: sadness
text: When I received my S.Y.J.C results which did not allow me to get   admission in engineering.

label: disgust
text: Once when I was studying for my examination, I was asked to do some work which was unavoidable.

label: shame
text: My teacher asked me a question which I failed to answer and I was told to stay behind after the class and give the answer after studying it from a book.

label: guilt
text: During class one day I walked out of the class.  The teacher noticed it and decided that he would take some action against me, when I realized this I approached him and told him that I was sorry for the incident and would not repeat it.

label: joy
text: When I passed the 12th standard board exams.

label: fear
text: My illness a few years back.  I was sevely down with malaria and asthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.

label: anger
text: During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.

label: sadness
text: My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

label: shame
text: When I was 12 years old I was caught by the Ticket Collector when travelling without a ticket.

label: guilt
text: A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising loans from my friends.

label: joy
text: After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I would be selected in the written exam.  When I saw my name in the selected candidates list I was overjoyed.

label: fear
text: When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I  would succeed or not.

label: anger
text: When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who  was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was really angry with him then.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father I really pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.

label: disgust
text: After my +2, when I did not get admission in B.E I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and  my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I really felt ashamed then.á

label: guilt
text: When I got low marks in the final year B.Sc exams, I felt guilty as I had not worked hard because I had been roaming around with my  friends.

label: joy
text: I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5 times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

label: fear
text: Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.

label: anger
text: Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I was right.  My friends went on arguing with me even though they did not know the right thing.

label: disgust
text: My elder sister forced me to do a few things which I did not like to do.

label: shame
text: Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed at this.

label: joy
text: When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.

label: fear
text: After I was thrown out of a car in an accident, this resulted in a fracture.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I was in a helpless position at the loss of my fiancee.

label: shame
text: The day my fiancee told me that it was bad that I could not write my mother tongue.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my own feet.

label: joy
text: The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something between us would materialize.

label: sadness
text: When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for her, put forward to her.

label: joy
text: I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I) examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have ever scored in my life.

label: guilt
text: I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. In the bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there were delicate things.

label: joy
text: When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our family members qualifying for University level at long last.

label: fear
text: On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to the Principal.

label: anger
text: Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling me that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.

label: disgust
text: Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid, dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done something that very morning he might have been alive today.

label: shame
text: Truely, I got very ashamed when my brother was sent out of Business Machines Limited Company due to improper handling of the office equipment in Sales Services.

label: guilt
text: Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with friends and sometimes not even going to school.

label: joy
text: After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in 1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the Examination when the results were out.

label: fear
text: I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking to her yet she is dead.

label: anger
text: Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and I was trying to protect my brother but the other man was calling names to both of us.

label: sadness
text: I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not selected for Secondary School education in 1978.

label: disgust
text: I had experienced odd moments one time when a patient came into the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.

label: shame
text: When I was young I was playing football near my parent's house and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was not seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I had been on friendship with a certain girl for sometime and the love was going on well, but it happened that I made the friendship come to an end suddenly without good reasons.

label: joy
text: I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had longed for.

label: fear
text: I once felt that my last hour had come when I was unexpectedly found in the hands of.

label: anger
text: It happened that my brother promised to give me money for school and then he told me that he had failed to fulfil his promise a day before school started. I became so angry for I thought my future would be ruined.

label: sadness
text: I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short illness.

label: disgust
text: The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran away from the course.

label: shame
text: I once felt shame when I failed to fulfil the promise to marry a daughter of a certain gentleman.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.

label: fear
text: When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I had fear that I might be one of the failures.

label: anger
text: Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not true.

label: sadness
text: Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so long with cancer of the Oesophagus.

label: disgust
text: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received a letter from a boyfriend.

label: shame
text: When I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to get more than I did.

label: guilt
text: When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to wait outside the ward.

label: joy
text: When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected to go to a Boarding secondary school.

label: fear
text: When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked. This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I had killed the baby.

label: anger
text: We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all my writing materials plus the identification card from the place where I left them.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend did not turn up in time as he promised he would be coming.

label: disgust
text: The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy, then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made a mess of the whole thing.

label: disgust
text: Bad temper of the serving lady in the students' dining hall.

label: shame
text: Teacher suspected me stealing money.

label: guilt
text: Failed to do what I had promised.

label: joy
text: Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.

label: fear
text: Staying in the room alone at night.

label: anger
text: An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.

label: sadness
text: A friend's mother died.

label: disgust
text: Saw a dirty street.

label: shame
text: Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.

label: guilt
text: Not helping other people to do their homework.

label: joy
text: Made a wonderfull new friend.

label: fear
text: My friend started to misunderstand and hurt me.

label: anger
text: Insulted by disgusting people.

label: sadness
text: My friend was badly hurt.

label: disgust
text: Someone not responding to my criticism.

label: shame
text: Swearing in public.

label: guilt
text: Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.

label: joy
text: When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only English classes)

label: fear
text: Before an examn.

label: anger
text: My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English lectures.

label: sadness
