text: Finding out that the university will give first priority to qualified practioners and clinical years to go to your English lectures.

label: disgust
text: Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age will go to your English lectures and they do not understand English.

label: shame
text: China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.

label: guilt
text: I am not good enough for your experiment I am doing.

label: joy
text: Winning a game after a long time of losing.

label: fear
text: Almost had a bicycle accident.

label: anger
text: People not cueing in the dining hall.

label: sadness
text: Failed an examn.

label: disgust
text: Saw a real party leader.

label: shame
text: Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.

label: guilt
text: Forgot to collect post for a friend.

label: joy
text: Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.

label: fear
text: You may find out that I am stupid and not to let me do your experiment.

label: anger
text: A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me go to your English lecture.

label: sadness
text: I was not chosen for the All English class.

label: disgust
text: Saw my class leader acting like a God when he chose people to go to your English lectures.

label: shame
text: Talking to friends about how old you are and we cannot be as successful as you at your age.

label: guilt
text: Telling friends about your nickname.

label: joy
text: I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

label: fear
text: Before the examn.

label: anger
text: Insulted by some stupid people.

label: sadness
text: Lost a friend.

label: disgust
text: Hear people talking at my back.

label: shame
text: Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.

label: fear
text: I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.

label: anger
text: I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my friend.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad  when I got the XIIth standard results, when I got low marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admission to courses like medicine.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, while playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch was difficult.

label: shame
text: There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,  when I see friends of my age group working and earning a lot, when I am still studying.  A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5 years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I read an advertisement for a job as a chemist in the newspaper and when my friend asked me if I had applied for that job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of that day.

label: joy
text: When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based on this type of reactions and compounds.

label: fear
text: I was very scared at the time of the Ty.B.Sc examination as I had decided to get 1st class results.  I was afraid thinking of how the papers would be.

label: anger
text: When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and kept thinking of her all day long.

label: shame
text: When I had insulted my father two years back, at that time I was very angry due to some reasons.

label: guilt
text: I felt very guilty when I tried to teach swimming to my younger brother, as I myself could not swim very well and my brother had started sinking to the bottom, however my elder brother saved him.

label: joy
text: This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.

label: fear
text: It was the time when I was in no position to secure a Ist class in the M.Sc exam and this was likely to affect my career.

label: anger
text: I missed an opportunity to go abroad because of some silly mistakes for which I had to suffer a lot.

label: sadness
text: It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a position to take the exam after having studied seriously.

label: disgust
text: When I opted for my research field, for them the percentage of marks was more important than my knowledge.

label: shame
text: When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.

label: guilt
text: Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it was too late, however I did realize this.

label: joy
text: When I got the first compound through column.

label: fear
text: When I did not get the compound which is known.

label: anger
text: When I got low marks in B.Sc final.

label: sadness
text: When my first love was not successful.

label: shame
text: When I had been angry at my friend without any reason.

label: guilt
text: When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about herself.

label: joy
text: It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy knew no bounds.

label: fear
text: When I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my father when he came back from work.  One day it so happened that his hair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and when I opened the door as usual I saw something else.  I was so scared that I could not talk.

label: anger
text: This also happened when I was very small.  I was beaten up by my  mother for no fault of mine, I had just beaten up my younger brother for what I thought was his fault.  I was very angry with my mother.

label: sadness
text: After studying a lot for my H.S.C exams, I could not make it to the medical stream and I felt sad about this.

label: joy
text: When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very happy.

label: fear
text: When I came to know that my exams were on two successive days and that there was very little time (about 9-10 hours) to study in between.

label: anger
text: I was very angry when my friend lost my practical's journal, which I needed to study for the exams.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when our cricket team manager dropped me from the team.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girls   of my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.

label: guilt
text: I felt very guilty when a student, sitting in front of me in the exam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers,  though I knew them.á

label: joy
text: When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

label: fear
text: When I was going to take the practical exams.

label: anger
text: When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the exams.

label: sadness
text: When I was ditched by my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: When I lost the notes of the lecturer I had borrowed from my friend.

label: shame
text: When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother's dame.

label: guilt
text: When I was bluffing in front of my mother to get more money.

label: joy
text: The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

label: fear
text: My brother lost his temper and started smashing things in the house.  I was quite scared, that something terrible might happen, till the situation was brought under control.

label: anger
text: I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought that came to my mind was to quit the job.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to stay with him in the hospital.

label: disgust
text: There was a family fight in my house some time back.  My uncle had given me a watch as a present and I lost it.  During the fight he accused me of having sold the watch.  I was disgusted at his false accusations.

label: shame
text: I had written a \love-letter\" to a class-mate of mine, this was meant to be a joke.  Unfortunately it fell in the wrong hands  and I had to face the consequences."

label: guilt
text: My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in the sand.

label: joy
text: I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.  Her arrival is always a joyous one.

label: fear
text: While I was pushing a court roller out of a ditch, I slipped and fell down and the roller rolled back towards me -down slope-It is a miracle that I still have my legs intact.

label: anger
text: I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.  I felt frustation - bordering on anger.

label: disgust
text: A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to produce his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using his authority in a very wrong way.

label: shame
text: I am quite shameless, not applicable.

label: joy
text: When I was successful at my work I was full of joy.

label: fear
text: When I was treated improperly by someone.

label: disgust
text: When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people killing each other.

label: joy
text: When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which lasted for several days.

label: fear
text: When my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger that she would not survive and if she did she would loose her memory.

label: anger
text: When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just reason, and thus showed off his power.

label: sadness
text: When a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.  I was not present there and only got the news later.

label: joy
text: I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

label: fear
text: I felt the above condition when I took my brother's bicycle to a market and unfortunately the bicycle was stolen and I didn't know how I could tell the owner about the stolen bicycle.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew about the story.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know what he had to do.

label: disgust
text: I felt the emotion when I entered a certain ward in the hospital to visit my relative who was sick.

label: shame
text: I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was unable to answer.

label: guilt
text: I felt the emotion when I fought somebody who was drunk and tried to disturb us while we were having meals.

label: joy
text: When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had passed. I was the happiest person.

label: fear
text: I was living with my brother and one day he went away on business and I was left alone to look after the house and the property. At night thieves came and wanted to break into the house.

label: anger
text: My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to his friend at a cheaper price.

label: sadness
text: I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see her lying in a bed in the hospital.

label: disgust
text: One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I went to see him the following morning, the place was really a mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.

label: shame
text: It was my father's birthday party when I was asked to bring a tray of tea and other drinks.

label: guilt
text: One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty because it was me who took them there.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

label: fear
text: I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped by fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving there at night.

label: anger
text: There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw paw-paw in the face.

label: sadness
text: It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heard that I was not selected to study in the University of Malawi.

label: disgust
text: In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected. Few people could come near him.

label: shame
text: An out-patient asked me to read for him a certain prescription but I was unable to do so. The patient was dissappointed and lost hope in me.

label: guilt
text: It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

label: joy
text: It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

label: fear
text: In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep two or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sent back.

label: anger
text: I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain man. I felt anger.

label: sadness
text: I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were sent to Kenya for Training.

label: disgust
text: The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I found that she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the same room there were some women visitors with children so the room was smelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stay any longer.

label: shame
text: It was last week on Sunday that I was walking with my girlfriend along Kawale road going to town so I tried to stop a car for a lift and the driver didn't stop and I felt shame because people were looking at us.

label: guilt
text: I was once called in court in Zemba Traditional court to answer a charge of impregnanting a young lady, I felt guilty for she had some letters which I used to write her as an exhibit in court.

label: joy
text: There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a Medical Assistant.

label: fear
text: When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was filled with fear.

label: anger
text: A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew nothing about it and was very angry.

label: sadness
text: I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with my girlfriend's behaviour. She was going out with other boys who were also my friends.

label: shame
text: It was a shameful moment when I heard that I had failed my Primary School leaving Certificate Exam in 1978. My girlfriend was there when the news was released.

label: guilt
text: I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without permission and I was found guilty.

label: joy
text: When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic Students, so I felt very joyous.

label: fear
text: I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as playing it again.

label: anger
text: It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed my wristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch I got angry when he was telling me but the anger didn't take long to fade.

label: sadness
text: When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I received sad news telling me that my elder sister had passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker and caused great conflicts with the teachers.

label: shame
text: I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved a liar.

label: guilt
text: Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by some people because he was found raping the wife of the village headman.

label: joy
text: The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.

label: fear
text: The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principal threatened me that I was going to be expelled.

label: anger
text: The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my knowledge.

label: sadness
text: The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I loved so much got married to another man before a rebuff from her.

label: disgust
text: The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite to her mother hit her sister severely.

label: shame
text: The shame came when I was beaten by my teacher at school in front of boys and girls some of whom were my friends and a girlfriend apart from being classmates.

label: guilt
text: It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was a friend's girlfriend.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant Training.

label: fear
text: When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

label: anger
text: This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I kept in the cupboard.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my father had passed away.

label: disgust
text: This situation occurred when I entered into a smelling ward.

label: shame
text: This situation happened when I was found kissing a girl who was my friend's girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which I stole from him.

label: joy
text: When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at Kasungu town Hall.

label: fear
text: At night when I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena crying in the Lingadzi jungle. I was alone.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go to the University.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I was within the row of students who were making noise.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when I was trying to propose to her.

label: shame
text: When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during the birthday of my girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone else.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind me.

label: fear
text: I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two days another girl of mine also gave me a wristwatch.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was still mine.

label: sadness
text: I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.

label: disgust
text: I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.

label: shame
text: I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into another class leaving me behind.

label: guilt
text: Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there was a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at our door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.

label: joy
text: This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to start Form I in October 1980.

label: fear
text: As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced air into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling which is dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.

label: anger
text: My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her chatting with another guy.

label: sadness
text: I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very young.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing money.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love with an uneducated girl.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I lost K43 for my friend when he was arrested.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of Education.

label: fear
text: When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid hyena just near the path in the forest.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to be untrue.

label: sadness
text: When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.

label: shame
text: I once proposed my own niece whom I did not know but I discovered after she was my girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: A certain colleague of mine sent me to buy a bag of flour for him, he gave me K20. Unfortunately I lost it.

label: joy
text: When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.

label: fear
text: When my friend was involved in a car accident.

label: anger
text: When I was charmed by my relatives.

label: sadness
text: When my mother died in August 1978.

label: disgust
text: When I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospital in Blantyre which was stinking.

label: shame
text: When I first failed my standard 8 exams for the first attempt for Form I selection.

label: guilt
text: When I had beaten my auntie.

label: joy
text: My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for admission.

label: fear
text: I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had problems of how to move to this place.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with distinctions.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me with the boy who is my best friend.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I saw a friend walking in stagnant water without putting on gum boots.

label: shame
text: I experienced shame when I failed to keep a promise to meet my friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not turned up.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused of spending a night out.

label: joy
text: The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

label: fear
text: As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person - fear came.

label: anger
text: I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his friends.á

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard about the death of my teacher who taught me in Standard 8.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean the place where the vomit was.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move with failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no lady can refuse our proposal.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.

label: joy
text: My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

label: fear
text: I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day while playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flock escaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I was afraid of father. I went home and hid myself.

label: anger
text: I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my consent.

label: sadness
text: It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia and that she would never come back.

label: disgust
text: A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to have been responsible.

label: shame
text: One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had come back for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstore and ate all internal organs of the chicken. When mother discovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stained with soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.

label: joy
text: This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination and was selected for Secondary School.

label: fear
text: At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love with a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beat the girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.

label: anger
text: I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I talked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed for reasons which were not known to me.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed one day when we were found stealing and roasting maize cobs from Agricultural experimental projects.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when the truth was known about my impregnating the girl we were staying with.

label: joy
text: It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my M.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of the event.

label: fear
text: I was walking alone along the place where people fear that there are always thieves there and the people who kill their friends during the night two months ago.

label: anger
text: I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends passed and went to secondary school. In class I was always getting more marks than they did.

label: disgust
text: My first day to work in hospital, when I was dressing wounds I was disgusted when I came across one wound with a very bad smell.

label: shame
text: One day I was with my girlfriend and other friends were behind us, I fell down because the place was slippery and I really felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty one day when I was accused of running away from classes and I was caught.

label: joy
text: It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parents after being refused for three times on grounds that she should first write her examination.

label: fear
text: When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the night.

label: anger
text: It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared for the training at Military college when he was coming back from his personal social activities.

label: sadness
text: I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and my best possessions got burnt in there.

label: disgust
text: It was when my father beat my mother while she was ill for three weeks and now she was recovering.

label: shame
text: When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and she told me never to talk to her again.

label: guilt
text: The time I was at secondary school during the holiday I appeared to my father while heavily drunk and I talked nonsense like in some sort of carefree.

label: joy
text: This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money which was just like a miracle to me.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling at night.

label: anger
text: I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the Headmaster.

label: sadness
text: When I was at school.

label: disgust
text: One of those days when I was going to school with my brother and he annoyed me.

label: shame
text: This was when one of the Clinical officers scolded us in the hospital on how to make beds but we did not deserve to be scolded.

label: guilt
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: joy
text: That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly 9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the L.S.H.S.

label: fear
text: Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were out after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.

label: anger
text: I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate at all.

label: sadness
text: This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.

label: disgust
text: A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost money on my way home from the college.

label: shame
text: I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whom I was thinking loved me very much.

label: guilt
text: I once felt guilty when a certain passenger in the same (ship, plane ?) which I boarded when coming from home lost his 10t which in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.

label: joy
text: It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start form I.

label: fear
text: It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it was sleeping near a baobab tree.

label: anger
text: It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had disappeared.

label: sadness
text: It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

label: disgust
text: It was when I drunk urine during my childhood thinking it was water. My friend had urinated in the tin.

label: shame
text: It was when my father caught me with a girl in dark corners and asked me what I was doing there.

label: guilt
text: It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.

label: joy
text: Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy and full of joy.

label: fear
text: My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was going for surgery, I was afraid he might not come back to life after hearing of the General Anaesthesia.

label: anger
text: I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

label: sadness
text: I was away to school (Primary). In my abscence my young brother at home got sick suddenly. My parents took him to hospital. On the way he died. It came to me as a sad, sudden and shocking news and I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitals where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.

label: shame
text: I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court. I went to see what would happen to him.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after hearing that my girlfriend with whom I had spent most of my time was pregnant.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate and was selected to go for Secondary education.

label: fear
text: When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary School.

label: anger
text: When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of medical uniform.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my father had passed away.

label: disgust
text: When I vomitted a lump of blood.

label: shame
text: When a certain girl I believed to be my life partner refused an engagement.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.

label: joy
text: I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on the way home.

label: fear
text: One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On the way I met my friends and they told me that two people had died because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.

label: anger
text: An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I threw stones at him and he ran away.

label: sadness
text: When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and up to this moment my sadness is still on.

label: disgust
text: I was really disgusted when I saw one of my friends soiling on his clothes. I thought he was mad.

label: shame
text: One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as I had finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reason why he came in.

label: guilt
text: One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised that I had done a wrong thing to him.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 months without seing each other.

label: fear
text: When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too rough.

label: anger
text: When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the match.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I expected, I wanted some Disco records.

label: disgust
text: In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell that only a few people .... the place.

label: shame
text: It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and then I scored the third goal to my own side.

label: guilt
text: When I scored the third goal to my own side at a football match against William Murray Secondary School and we were badly defeated.

label: joy
text: On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.

label: fear
text: It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to darkness - until somebody had to escort me.

label: anger
text: It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates got promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similar Ranks.

label: sadness
text: It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter for him to be caught.

label: disgust
text: In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: In our class we had a test on Nursing, so a friend from the Army was caught peeping, by using a paper which had already answers which was written by him. So all of us from the Army got ashamed.

label: guilt
text: It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fanta bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was selected for Secondary School.

label: fear
text: One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I heard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up from my dreams and it was about to crash me.

label: anger
text: When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys in our hostel.

label: sadness
text: It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my third year of my Secondary School.

label: disgust
text: I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I was too young to join elderly people.

label: shame
text: In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crooky behaviour of dodging from Examinations.

label: guilt
text: A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as soon as I finished the procedure.

label: joy
text: When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

label: fear
text: When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises without permisssion and at the wrong time.

label: anger
text: When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy studying and concentrating on my classnotes.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: disgust
text: When somebody made me touch human faeces.

label: shame
text: Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

label: guilt
text: When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep the child away from the fire.

label: joy
text: When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

label: fear
text: One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but collection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started to incise the swollen part with surgical blade.

label: anger
text: One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.

label: sadness
text: One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her as being very faithful.

label: disgust
text: One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room. The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that I didn't even dare to enter the room.

label: shame
text: At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

label: guilt
text: I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was innocent and I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful. Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers who had passed after repeating for several times.

label: fear
text: We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to the point of threatening our lives.

label: anger
text: I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for pouring his soup.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

label: disgust
text: I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this ability that counts when choosing the winning side.

label: shame
text: News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.

label: guilt
text: I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage. Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guilty of violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.

label: joy
text: I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to attend a wedding ceremony.

label: fear
text: I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing one another and passed through the window outside the classroom. Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified. Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the window.

label: anger
text: Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

label: sadness
text: My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at school; this news reached me through someone.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I received visitors at an odd hour. I was seriously preparing for Examinations, so I did not appreciate their coming.

label: shame
text: I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked something about Femur and my answer was saying something concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

label: guilt
text: I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which we created ourselves.

label: joy
text: I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

label: fear
text: My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.

label: anger
text: There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and Silver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money for admission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not give me.

label: sadness
text: I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.

label: disgust
text: It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was short of clothes.

label: shame
text: I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an old man when I was in those shoes.

label: guilt
text: I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and I was guilty-conscious.

label: joy
text: Passing a very difficult examination which I didn't expect - MCE.

label: fear
text: As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it might bite me.

label: anger
text: Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.

label: sadness
text: After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.

label: shame
text: I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I was defeated.

label: guilt
text: I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in a pit-latrine that the little girl fainted.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.

label: fear
text: When one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and my friend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, after they had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might have beaten me.

label: anger
text: When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write Examinations in a few minutes.

label: sadness
text: When I failed my Standard 8 Examination for the first time.

label: disgust
text: When a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful to him.

label: shame
text: When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one Saturday.

label: guilt
text: After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so they had to send me money.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was selected to start Nursing.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone at their house to look after the baby when they went to a party.

label: anger
text: I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any comment I added to our chatting.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's cupboard at school (boarding).

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at school by my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I was asked by my cousin that I promised to buy her a birthday present but I didn't buy it for her in front of friends.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt when my friends were punished to slash grass at the gound because of making noise in class. I was in the group of noise-makers but I denied having done any noise.

label: joy
text: When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.

label: fear
text: I was with my boyfriend forgetting that I had left the house unlocked. Unfortunatly a thief came and stole all the kitchen utensils. Thereafter I was afraid of the consequences.

label: anger
text: My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when I heard that my cousin died because of being bewitched by her husband's second wife.

label: disgust
text: My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn up.

label: shame
text: I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I ran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and she told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to come here.

label: fear
text: Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would meet.

label: anger
text: This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him with a certain boy.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.

label: disgust
text: I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good and had a bad smell.

label: shame
text: One day I was supposed to go to a movie with my boyfriend. In the morning I went to see my Auntie and I didn't come back up to evening.

label: guilt
text: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.

label: joy
text: When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some weeks.

label: fear
text: When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at by my parents.

label: anger
text: When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

label: sadness
text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents attention by talking to them.

label: disgust
text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        operation.

label: shame
text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

label: joy
text: When I had my first boyfriend.

label: fear
text: I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I came across my mother just close to where we sat.

label: anger
text: During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good reason. I felt very angry with her.

label: sadness
text: When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St. Mary's Sec. School. I was happy at Chichiri as a day scholer and had made a lot of friends. I was going to a boarding and that meant parting with my friends as well as my boyfriend for the first time.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stop going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14 years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.

label: shame
text: When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriends we were through just because I never felt like having one at that particular time.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a University course.

label: fear
text: Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was afraid that he would report to my parents.

label: anger
text: One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and used it for her business without my knowledge.

label: sadness
text: It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already taken place.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a question and I could not answer it.

label: guilt
text: One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he did not and he put it in his mouth.

label: joy
text: I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School. When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out of 80 students hence I felt joy.

label: fear
text: When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would tackle the questions.

label: anger
text: Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.

label: disgust
text: In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for his family and himself.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when my lecturer said in class that I happened to be the dullest of all.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making noise in class.

label: joy
text: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.

label: fear
text: When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: anger
text: When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away.

label: disgust
text: When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.

label: shame
text: When I failed Psychology examination when most of the students passed.

label: guilt
text: When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the promise.

label: joy
text: I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.

label: fear
text: One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient. Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid fearing the dead body.

label: anger
text: It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.

label: sadness
text: My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got separated.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T. specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K. and went the same day and we do not have one.

label: shame
text: I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like disappearing from people.

label: guilt
text: I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't study for Anatomy class on Monday.

label: joy
text: I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.

label: fear
text: When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was moonlight.

label: anger
text: I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and in the end I got really angry.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic accident.

label: disgust
text: I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started vomiting. It was so disgusting.

label: shame
text: We were writing Primary school leaving Examinations when I had fallen at the steps going into the Exam room.

label: guilt
text: I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.

label: joy
text: I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things in this parcel.

label: fear
text: I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some fear that some men would attack me and rob me.

label: anger
text: I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so well.

label: sadness
text: I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

label: disgust
text: I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had done something which I really didn't do.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.

label: guilt
text: Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving Exams and I was selected to go to college.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and the bus leaned against a wall.

label: anger
text: I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at last that she would not turn up.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child defecated on the table side.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in the presence of my boyfriend.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a cafeteria.

label: joy
text: When I had passed MCE examinations.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my boyfriend came home because my parents disapproved him of his coming home. I thought they would chase me out of the house.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was intending to leave the college.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on the grounds of coming home late.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed to answer a question in the classroom.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: fear
text: I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped off the bus around 6.30 pm.

label: anger
text: I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my father was sick.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriend was her boyfriend.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father. When I went home he was at work.

label: joy
text: The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving Certificate Examinations.

label: fear
text: Afraid of a dead body.

label: anger
text: A tailor ran away with my skirt.

label: sadness
text: Cooks refused to give me food.

label: disgust
text: I saw a septic, smelling wound.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church congregation.

label: guilt
text: I cheated my boyfriend.

label: joy
text: A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

label: fear
text: I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came to report to my parents.

label: anger
text: Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she thought I was still interested in the boy.

label: sadness
text: In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.

label: disgust
text: One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend and out of jealousy he started calling me names.

label: shame
text: My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.

label: guilt
text: I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which all proved to be negative.

label: joy
text: When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

label: fear
text: I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered from that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.

label: anger
text: I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I was the quietest girl in class.

label: sadness
text: It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal pains.

label: disgust
text: I felt this situation when a certain woman from a close village shouted at my mother because she didn't get what she wanted, she wanted some salt to put in her relish.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I got the lowest result (mark) in class. All the same I didn't worry too much because I knew I would have got much better if I had read enough.

label: guilt
text: At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.

label: joy
text: The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

label: shame
text: I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the course.

label: guilt
text: When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care). I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary school leaving certificate exam.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house for one month.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away untimely at home.

label: disgust
text: One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was moving about with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.

label: shame
text: I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me about my brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I was ashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what had happened.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I tore a photograph I found at my boyfriend's place only to realise that it was his sister who was on the photograph.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.

label: fear
text: When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten (or eaten ?) by a snake.

label: anger
text: I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was also a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad about it and couldn't talk to anyone.

label: disgust
text: Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and say all she could about me.

label: shame
text: I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in shame without knowing where to go from there.

label: guilt
text: One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were very hard.

label: fear
text: I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's judgement and action on what I had done.

label: anger
text: The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

label: sadness
text: I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car accident and was admitted in hospital.

label: disgust
text: The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe disgusted without taking the tea.

label: shame
text: I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My patient died of Anaemia while I was organising blood transfusion for him, so I felt guilty, because I thought that may be I was slow.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.

label: fear
text: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.

label: anger
text: When my dress was stolen.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died after a long illness.

label: disgust
text: When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking tobacco.

label: shame
text: When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.

label: guilt
text: When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.

label: joy
text: I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my birthday.

label: fear
text: I was in the house at night and I heard a hyena crying outside. It cried for almost an hour and I feared it might break the window and enter inside the house.

label: anger
text: I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the girls who did him wrong.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted the other day I was told to take off the dog's faeces around the house since they smelled bad I did the job but in the end I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. The teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.

label: fear
text: When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend and he was calling me to talk about it.

label: anger
text: When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to bath.

label: disgust
text: When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my desk and put it on.

label: shame
text: When I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.

label: guilt
text: When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the message she included made me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.

label: fear
text: I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to do.

label: anger
text: A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

label: sadness
text: When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick before death but suddenly died.

label: disgust
text: I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad language but was a very smart looking lady.

label: shame
text: I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.

label: joy
text: I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.

label: fear
text: I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at 1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

label: anger
text: I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep, but the teacher told me to do it.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the standard 8 exams for the third time.

label: disgust
text: I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered so we had to put on top of the other bodies.

label: shame
text: I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence of my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short of bread.

label: joy
text: I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running competition.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my boyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during the last weekend.

label: sadness
text: I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her friends.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who needed it immediately.

label: joy
text: When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

label: fear
text: I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi and when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink on the side.

label: anger
text: Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was rude at a certain time.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.

label: disgust
text: I was forced to go to a party with someone I didn't love and he was telling people that I was his girlfriend.

label: shame
text: When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly standing waiting for a bus.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and some pieces broke off when the plug dropped off my hands.

label: joy
text: After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a short only knocked at the window whispering that I should open for him.

label: anger
text: The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away after he showed had his meals.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was told I shouldn't visit my sister because the holiday was short.

label: shame
text: I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.

label: guilt
text: I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and no one liked the meal that day.

label: joy
text: The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she had a child.

label: fear
text: Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time came when dad joined the family from his working place I found myself having fear for him for no cause at all.

label: anger
text: I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.

label: sadness
text: When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her training I felt very sad for she was young.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a lady putting on a pair of trousers, I felt it was a disguise according to Malawi culture.

label: shame
text: Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all over my uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. It happened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform. I was so ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I used to have two boyfriends in the past. Then one of them wanted to get engaged to me. I agreed but was guilt-conscious for disappointing the other one.

label: joy
text: I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College education.

label: fear
text: I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just playing with my friends.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just suddenly.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I saw a drunkard vomiting very offensive matter.

label: shame
text: I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was full of lamps in it.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I learnt that some of friends found the finished at the Cafeteria because I took food which was more than my share.

label: joy
text: I received money from my father at a time when I was completely broken.

label: fear
text: My friend had been telling me about a certain bird which when it cries at night it's the sign that someone will die. So one night I was alone in the house and I heard the cry of the bird and I was afraid.

label: anger
text: One of my friends went and told another friend of mine that I was going abut with another guy in Lilongwe besides the one I had. She said I was seen with him hand in hand.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.

label: disgust
text: Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with money.

label: shame
text: I fell off a bike in the presence of a lot of people.

label: guilt
text: A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.

label: joy
text: I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least expecting it.

label: fear
text: I had fear of my father (parents) when I first became pregnant. I was afraid of delivery itself and whether I would give birth to a stiiborn or a baby.

label: anger
text: It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was away. When I asked him he accepted it.

label: sadness
text: My child passed away after a short illness when he was just eleven months old. I was only told about his death without knowing that he had been ill.

label: disgust
text: My father promised to send me pocket money at the month-end since I wanted to buy a new pair of shoes when I was at secondary school, but he didn't.

label: shame
text: I just opened the bathroom without knocking not knowing that someone was bathing inside, it happened to be my father.

label: guilt
text: I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.

label: joy
text: Accepted by the college football team.

label: fear
text: Fighting with class mates in Highschool.

label: anger
text: Made mistakes in exam.

label: sadness
text: Failing examn.

label: disgust
text: Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.

label: shame
text: Did not finish homework.

label: guilt
text: Make a mistake, offended my friend.

label: joy
text: Article published in the college newspaper.

label: fear
text: Walking on a dark street with noone around.

label: anger
text: My friend misunderstood me.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: Class leader told me to collect homework for him.

label: shame
text: Did not finish homework.

label: guilt
text: Did not read reference when other people read them.

label: joy
text: Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through police.

label: fear
text: Before examination.

label: anger
text: Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.

label: sadness
text: My girl-friend left me.

label: disgust
text: People not cueing in the college dining room.

label: shame
text: Saw the film about Eight Nations Army conquering Beijing.

label: guilt
text: No ideal result in the University entrance examn, guilty to family and friend.

label: joy
text: Helping in the nursery school.

label: fear
text: Telling my parents that I did not well in an examn.

label: anger
text: My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.

label: sadness
text: Not being accepted by classmates in university.

label: disgust
text: Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus drivers were having a long lunch.

label: shame
text: Not having good marks like other people for homeworks.

label: guilt
text: Not handing in homeworks in time.

label: joy
text: Got a present from my friend for my birthday.

label: fear
text: Lost my purse, the money in the purse belonged to my parents.

label: anger
text: South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more than China).

label: sadness
