text: Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.

label: disgust
text: Saw my roommate messing up our room.

label: shame
text: Found out that I am not good at football.

label: guilt
text: Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).

label: joy
text: Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings, I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.

label: fear
text: Damaged the tap in the residental Hall.

label: anger
text: Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch TV.

label: sadness
text: My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.

label: disgust
text: Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.

label: shame
text: My sister was afraid of her husband.

label: guilt
text: I was not able to help my sister to understand that her husband is a bad man before she was married to him.

label: joy
text: Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.

label: fear
text: Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone else around.

label: anger
text: I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the bus.

label: sadness
text: Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone gave them money.

label: disgust
text: The serving lady in the students' dining hall shouting at studennts.

label: shame
text: Sitting on the bus seats supposed for disabled people, children and old people (by mistake)

label: guilt
text: Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.

label: joy
text: You told me psychology can help people to be happier.

label: fear
text: Left alone in the dining hall at night.

label: anger
text: Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).

label: sadness
text: Saw a father beating up his small child.

label: disgust
text: Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.

label: shame
text: Not quick enough to help the lectors to catty things for the lecture.

label: guilt
text: My mother wrote me and said that I would not writ enough letters home.

label: joy
text: My parents came to visit me.

label: fear
text: Could not find my way out in the college building at night.

label: anger
text: Saw in the TV South Korea cheating in the Asian Olympic games.

label: sadness
text: General Ye Jianying died.

label: disgust
text: A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.

label: shame
text: Failing an examn.

label: guilt
text: Made a misjudgement in a football match.

label: joy
text: My friend told me he really likes me.

label: fear
text: Getting lost in a strange place.

label: anger
text: South Korea cheating for gold medals.

label: sadness
text: My friend has to go on field trips, he just told me.

label: disgust
text: When I was the South Koreans on the TV.

label: shame
text: Zhu Jianhau did not break the world record for China.

label: guilt
text: Unable to help my mother to cook.

label: joy
text: I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.

label: fear
text: Going to the examn not well prepared.

label: anger
text: Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.

label: sadness
text: Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better than China.

label: disgust
text: Some foreign students playing loud music late at night.

label: shame
text: Not being able to be selected for the dancing team.

label: guilt
text: Did not get up early enough to watch my class football team playing against another team.

label: joy
text: Scoared a goal in a football match.

label: fear
text: Left alone in the dark in a big building.

label: anger
text: Someone called me a disgusting nickname.

label: sadness
text: Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.

label: disgust
text: A woman picked her nose and spit right next to me.

label: shame
text: Not brave enough to take up a challenge in a group discussion.

label: guilt
text: Not being a good host for a friend from a far away place.

label: joy
text: My class winning against another class in a football match.

label: fear
text: Walking alone in the dark in a strange street.

label: anger
text: A friend forgot his appointment with me.

label: sadness
text: A friend misunderstood me.

label: disgust
text: A boy in my class talking too loud in the lecture.

label: shame
text: Not being able to have a party at home with friends.

label: guilt
text: Being miserable in a party when other people are friendly and happy.

label: joy
text: Meeting an old friend from high school.

label: fear
text: Facing a mad dog.

label: anger
text: Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.

label: sadness
text: My old teacher in primary school died.

label: disgust
text: Getting into a crowded bus.

label: shame
text: Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.

label: guilt
text: Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.

label: joy
text: My old friend visited me in the university.

label: fear
text: Listening to horrot stories at night.

label: anger
text: My roommate was rude to me.

label: sadness
text: My uncle died in the Vietnam War.

label: disgust
text: Cueing in the students dining hall.

label: shame
text: Arguing about price with private shop-assistant.

label: guilt
text: Not being able to spend more time with a friend who was visiting me.

label: joy
text: Scoring a goal in football match.

label: fear
text: Finding out that I am not an as able student as I thought.

label: anger
text: I was told to do something I did not want to do.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that China is still backward in science.

label: disgust
text: Doing this pointless questionnaire.

label: shame
text: Insulted by somebody.

label: guilt
text: I am not doing what I should with this questionnaire.

label: joy
text: Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian Olympic.

label: fear
text: Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody.

label: anger
text: Insulted by teacher.

label: sadness
text: Finding out I am not good looking.

label: disgust
text: Someone I do not like kept talking to me.

label: shame
text: Finding out from this lecture that China is backward in psychology.

label: guilt
text: Being rude to someone I do not like.

label: joy
text: Joining in a research group studying consumer's behaviour and helping the people in the shop with the sales.

label: fear
text: Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.

label: anger
text: A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.

label: sadness
text: Not winning a medal in the swimming contest.

label: disgust
text: Some students talking when other people are having a nap.

label: guilt
text: A friend asked for help and I was not able to help.

label: joy
text: China winning the Asian Olympic.

label: fear
text: Before an examn.

label: anger
text: Korean judges cheating.

label: sadness
text: My father left us for another woman.

label: disgust
text: Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.

label: shame
text: Had to tell people that my parents are divorced.

label: guilt
text: Not beeing able to stay with my mother for the National Day holiday.

label: joy

text: I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus the picnic was worthwhile.

label: fear
text: I am afraid of my academic results as I will face several problems.  I am scared of my limitations and the unlimited problems and I do not know how to cope with them.

label: anger
text: I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One of them studies in a private school and the other one is repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.  They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems.  They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the floor).

label: sadness
text: I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.

label: disgust
text: I had been forced to get together with strange and disgusting classmates.  The things they talked about disgusted me and made me feel ill at ease.  I knew that I would feel unhappy if I stayed there but I was defeated by the social norms.

label: shame
text: I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the work.

label: guilt
text: I had not done my assignment seriously.  I only pretended to finish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.  The whole thing made me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: I preached to a F.3 students in a gospel camp.  They thus knew more about God and made up their minds to believe in Jesus.

label: fear
text: When the doctor told me that there was something wrong with my eye and I had to undergo an operation.

label: anger
text: I had left a student newspaper of the Chinese university on the table of the library.  It had disappeared when I came back.

label: sadness
text: One of my class-mates had a disease unexpectedly, he had been in a coma for six days in a hospital before he died.

label: disgust
text: Someone, who was sitting very close to me, was smoknig in the compartment of an air conditioned mini-bus.

label: shame
text: In the compartment of a public transport railway, I did not give my seat to an old man who was standing near me.  It was another teenager who did so.

label: guilt
text: One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bed very late.  Next morning I had was very sleepy so I continued sleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sunday service.

label: guilt
